author: .:: fAERiEN ::.
review: It Takes Two is an exciting co-op action-adventure 3D platformer that is soooo much fun to play, especially while voice-chatting on Discord with someone you love and enjoy spending time with. The story is simple but meaningful. It's about working together to solve problems that arise, and it emphasizes the importance of dedicating both the time and the effort that are necessary in order to nurture and maintain a loving, strong and healthy relationship. When you really care about someone, it is entirely worth it and rewarding to do so, even though it's not always easy... because life, itself, is not always easy or predictable.  The main characters are a couple named May and Cody who are going through a divorce. Their daughter, Rose, is devastated by this and desperate to get them back together. She makes a wish on a book and her parents get transformed into small wooden dolls that she made to represent them. They are thrust into a magical world where they encounter The Book of Love AkA Dr. Hakim, the flamboyant, mustachioed deuteragonist with a Spanish accent who is determined to repair their relationship. They need to get through a series of challenges so they can return to their human form.  The world is colourful and absolutely gorgeous, the puzzles are perfectly balanced in terms of difficulty (not too easy but not too hard), the bosses are tough, the mini games are entertaining, and the dialogue sometimes makes me laugh because it's so cute and comical. Also, there's so much to explore and so many toys to play with that it often makes me feel like a little kid in the world's biggest playroom. Honestly? I can't recommend it enough. It has become one of my favourite gaming experiences in many ways, and I'm not at all surprised that it has won several awards.

author: restful°
review: Damn, that is the best co-op game I ever played.  A lot of different gameplay mechanics, nice story, sweet characters and voiceovers, funny references and jokes (IMHO). I highly recommend this masterpiece.  9/10  - Do not forget about COL-LA-BO-RA-TION

author: mew mew
review: It Takes Two is an unique co-op game with an emotional heartwarming story. Fun mini-games, challenging boss fights, great puzzles, excellent voice acting and lots of silly humor. It is one of the greatest co-op experience currently out there. There's no way you regret it. This is honestly the most fun I've ever had in a game. I HIGHLY recommend it.BIG thanks to the developers for this fantastic game. <3 :)

author: unknown
review: is an amazing story telling co-op game I have ever played. I played this game because my friend bought the game and invited me to play together and I played with Friend's Pass. First I thought that the game will be boring but it is not at all what I expected. The story, gameplay, art style, mini games, puzzles, music and soundtracks are unique. And I bought the full game because it is so good and fun to play.The story is about a young girl named  who's parents ( and ) are divorcing and her tears basically turn you into the puppets. You'll need to trying to find answers and rebuild your  :P.The gameplay is pure 2 player co-op puzzles solving and each level is completely different from the last and unique boss battles. There are so many different puzzles and every level requires different types of thinking. And there are also different mini games to compete with each other.The graphics in this game is pretty unique and visually gorgeous to look at, really. The art style is amazing and the environments in this game are very beautiful.The music and soundtracks in this game are unique too.For me, it is a masterpiece, GOTY and amazing story telling co-op game. And I found the lovely heart-warming relationship of  and  in this game. I absolute recommend for players who like to play games in story telling co-op. And if you own the game and your friend don't own, your friend can play and fun together with free Friend's Pass. I believe that everyone should play this amazing game at least once in their life. Go and grab your friend and get ready to fun play this game together ;DAnd thank you very much to my friend who invited me to play this amazing story telling co-op game together.Thank You :)

review: Eh........................... i was just finished this game with my friend, i feel like i can't breathe, this game hit me in the bottom line, at first look of this game at the early of this year i already judge this game like "Wow this new casual game it's looking good, could be on my list to play for fun just like 5-6 hours to finish it" (but look at the time i has played it) but i am wrong, completely wrong, if you never play this game and never seen any spoiler videos, i can tell you this... this game have pretty much everything you'd "unexpected" (in a good way) and fruitful of detaileda bit of warning, a minor of bugs may made you have to restart from the checkpoint, but i believe you will feel like me "i can forgive that" this game is colorful, beautiful, and meaningful, and if you imagine the game play is boring, i can tell you right now, "try it yourself because my hunch tell me you will be surprised" let me say in another way, if you love those great Animations from Disney or Dreamworks, you will feel like you watching the great animation with wholesome story but it also let you be participating and i must confess i voted for RE Village for game of the year 2021 (The Game Awards), but that because i am a big fan of RE series, however this game took place in my heart to be game of the year as well, so if you "just wanna try" you can subscribe for EA play for 1 mouth, and play it with your partner, but if you also want to keep it permanently in your collection, you can purchase it, full price is totally worth it, meanwhile it's your choice to wait for sale, ok i speak too much already but please let me leave the last few words, this game is the world of unexpected in the wonderland Cheers guys, the final mouth of the year is here, embrace yourself by finding something to do with your love ones, this game could be your choice stay safe and stay frosty!

author: Tsubame ⭐
review: Graphics: stunning colorful visuals and models, and great level and camera design. Is really hard to find anything wrong with the game on this department.Gameplay: about 15-20 hours of mostly 3D gameplay, plus extras for mini games and achievements. Co-op only, and best played with voice chat. Only one player requires a copy, if playing online. Puzzles and maps are very easy, assuming both players know what they are doing, yet lots of fun. The optional mini games, plus some of the tools and puzzles the game offers, certainly adds a bit of fun PvP mechanic in the game. That being said, once finished, the game has very little replayability factor.Story: for a game that describes itself in the Steam store as "a universal tale of relationships", this game does not delve deep into this theme, not surprising given the younger audience of the game. That being said, those that do not mind a cheesy and humorous story that invariably ends with a happy note will like the game quite a bit.Music: it is good, not the strongest suit of the game in my opinion, but still enjoyable, and fits the gameplay and the story well. Which may be good as it does not detract much from the superb voice acting that is present throughout the game.Kid friendly? The game certainly is made very easy to play, likely with a younger audience in mind - that being said, beware of inuendo and mature themes.Summary: a fun and great game to play with family and friends. Just beware that it might be rather short, and for the grown-ups out there, on the easy side. 9/10.

author: thoughtfix

author: timɘ_bendeя
review: It Takes Two is indeed a game where it takes two. Having played through it with the wife I can say we enjoyed it both and also both thought it overstayed its welcome about 75% into the game. Playing through it once will take around 10 hours. For this price that’s incredibly long for a co-op game and believe me when I say it tries to keep things fresh all the way through, with new gameplay mechanics and levels. And it always succeeds. Except when you get an item that you don’t really like to use, or just doesn’t seem so fun. My wife frequently got the better/cooler weapon. Now, the game splits the gameplay evenly, so you both get to use your weapon/gadget as much as the other person, just in different ways. And as I mentioned it really takes two. You can’t proceed without the help of the other.Besides the story oriented puzzle platformer gameplay there are also plenty of mini-games to be found and enjoyed, The variety of gameplay here is exceptional and the controls are simple enough that they can be played and enjoyed by anyone. But if you’re the more experienced gamer between you and co-op partner then you’re usually at an unfair advantage. And that makes these games a little less fun unfortunately since they’re competitively oriented and not co-operative like the rest of the gameplay.The graphics and animations are top notch. The characters move lifelike, both in human and doll form and all of the environments look detailed and are made with a lot of love.The voice acting is also stellar, with the exception of the daughter who sounds like an adult trying to imitate a kid. I loved the voice of the ‘Book of Love’.As I mentioned the game became a bit tedious for us near the end, when we had to collect several pages. These segments went on a little too long for our taste. But that’s personal, of course, I’m sure there are tons of people out there who enjoyed it all the way through.So if you’re looking for the ultimate co-op game look no further: It Takes Two is one of the best puzzle/action platformers there is. There’s a ton of variety in gameplay and a whole lot of mini-games. You won’t be bored! At least.,, not for a while.

author: dMn | 데미안
review: It Takes Two is a co-op game in which we play Cody and May, a married couple where things aren't quite going well. Their young daughter, who is watching it all from the sidelines, tries to fix their marriage by asking a magic book for help. Through her request, the parents are turned into dolls and must work together to return to human form. She helps them with this, and basically just gives them advice and introduces humorous elements with her character although some may be annoyed by her manner, the very magic book that is Dr. Hakim. Special attention must be paid to the gameplay. This one is so very accepting that practically every moment we can do something different. As many as 25 different mini-games have been included in the game, which perfectly fill the time while passing the game. It is impossible to get bored in this game, because something is happening all the time. Compared to Hazelight's previous game 'A Way Out' we get much more interaction, the game is longer and in my opinion more interesting, although it is a completely different game atmosphere. It is worth mentioning that we play on splitscreen, so we can watch the other player's movements all the time.It is also worth focusing on the game world. Here, as with the gameplay, we cannot get bored. Every now and then we land in a new location, which are closed, but have a lot of interactive elements. On top of this, the bosses fit perfectly into the surroundings and can sometimes make things difficult. While we're on the subject of the game world, it's worth noting the graphics, which, although cartoonish, look excellent. On top of that, the dubbing is very good and the overall sound design changes depending on the locationI'm sure It Takes Two is the best co-op game I've played, right next to Portal 2. It has all the qualities a good co-op game should have. It doesn't get boring, it's not long, it's cheap if you decide to buy EA Play, but also the usual price is worth paying for this masterpiece. Especially the 96% positive reviews attest to how good this game is. It is impossible not to have fun with this game.

author: Miiau 🌸
review: It's very lovely, had so much fun while playing it with my Sister. "It takes two" is sometimes a bit tricky but with all the mini-games so multifaceted. It's one of the best co-op games that i was playing so far. And definitely quite possible the freshest breath of air that multiplayer experience has had in the past decade. The cutscenes flow very well from the gameplay, creating a seamless narrative that the players feel engaged in. Also the art and Style are very beautiful and you just want to see more ^.^I just can recommend it to everybody.

author: Sato 🧡
review: Game was great, I've always voiced how I wished for co-op games that actually flex the co-op aspect at every turn and it's good to see one that does it justice.  Things are constantly changing so even ADHD players can get through this.  Like Mario levels, new gimmicks or mechanics are introduced, used a bit, and then thrown away before they have time to get too stale.  Very creative scenarios always cropping up.  My only complaint is that the difficulty is overall pretty low, auto-aim is too generous (an option to turn it off would be great), etc.  It'd be great to have a hard mode or at least some extra-challenging post-credits content to try to do, to really push your teamwork to its limit.Overall a strong 8/10 despite those issues for me, and the best co-op experience to date.

author: Loguna
review: One of my best gaming experiences. The love that was put into this game's development can be seen in the design and the incredible creativity of each level. Beyond that, this game holds almost every little thing that my partner and I adore or things that have great meaning to us, and that made the experience even more beautiful.  :')

review: This game is the most sadistic sociopathic game I've ever played. author: gh0stie
review: This game is an ABSOLUTE masterpiece. I picked it up a few months back and played a few hours with my friend, and we had an amazing time. After a few months hiatus, we revisited it and it was still so much fun. We have shared so many laughs and just fun together by just playing and sometimes doing stupid stuff. The story is amazing (we haven't finished it yet!) and the art assets are beautiful. I can tell just by playing this game that SO MUCH effort was put into making it. The music is beautiful. The minigames are a blast to play with and compete with your friends. The story is a little long but each chapter is just a thrill to play. If you're looking for a lighthearted game to play with someone you like or even just a friend, this is it. You don't have to be an amazing gamer or have super duper gaming skills to play and have funWe haven't finished the story yet, but we got about halfway into the town and got to a beautiful city that we literally spent around 20-30 minutes just roaming around having and discovering things in.If you're thinking about getting it. JUST. DO. IT. Play with a friend and you both will have the time of your life.

author: SteemStream
review: A charming game with not so charming main characters. Well at least that's what it's going for. The visuals of the game are quite beautiful. Massive open areas that you can just view and appreciate quite often. The platforming in the game for the most part is rather engaging and is very forgiving when it comes to deaths. It makes failing at a jump hardly a setback, but this game is supposed to be on the easy side. Most puzzle mechanics are very well done, they felt very satisfying to learn how to use and play with. The mechanics are used just enough to showcase just about any unique ability or advantage they offer, and didn't lack in the number of ways could be used. Overall my experience with the game was very good and I would recommend to anyone who wants a mostly relaxed platformer, with a few intense parts sprinkled in, along with a decent story. Also the amount of occasions where you can mess with your friend in this game is what really makes it shine.

author: hollapena97
review: In terms of gameplay, this is a good game. The platforming is tight, the environments are nice and it's fun to have such a co-op focused game. I cannot recommend it though, because while it's fun in hand, the story and characters dragged it straight down. Cody and May are shallow, uninteresting people and bad parents. I can't think of a real redeeming quality between the two of them. May is a... breadwinner? Cody... likes plants? They're not kind or caring in the slightest, tearing through essentially all new toys in their way. I don't remember a point where either of them took any responsibility for their problems. The book is annoying. The child is sad, but also annoying. I couldn't get behind any of them.As for the story, I understand that divorce is hard, but the writing in this game is just so flippant. The big idiot book's solution is just "work it out" basically. There was no subtlety or nuance to the self-centeredness of the parents. None of the humor landed for me. Also the legendary elephant sequence felt bad. I've never been so close to quitting a game just because it felt bad.It's a mechanically fun game. I genuinely enjoyed jumping around and playing mini games and getting my brother killed while he was trying to platform, but most everything that surrounds and encompasses those moments makes playing this game a slog. Leave this one alone.

author: Pouya2010
review: It Takes Two is what a game should be; Fun, entertaining and full of moments that remind us why we all love the magical world of gaming.In a word, the variety of stages of It Takes Two is excellent and these stages are at a very high level in terms of design.It Takes Two is a co-op game and everything in it is designed with such a mindset that the result is a fun experience for both players.Strengths+ Awesome stage design+ Great variety of ideas for game stages, each of which creates a new experience+ Creating the perfect Co-Op experience that keeps both players entertained at all times+ Very high replay value+ Visual effects and eye-catching artistic graphics+ Use of appropriate music and very good voice actingweak points- Some very limited minor bugsConclusion :It Takes Two is the perfect definition of a video game; A work that is made to entertain and does so in the most enjoyable and exciting way possible. In a word, the variety of the stages of the game is wonderful and the design of these stages has been done in an ideal way, the result of which is the presentation of a gameplay that never falls out of rhythm, and on the contrary, until the last moment of the game, not only its charm is maintained, but also new creative features to discover. has it. Complementing this pure and first-class entertainment are excellent visual and audio effects, a meaningful and meaningful story, and a wonderful Co-Op experience that work hand in hand to make the new creation of Haylight Studio a genuine entertainment game, and you can safely, Recommended to all video game medium lovers to experience it.Score 10 out of 10

author: Serieus
review: It Takes Two is an amazing game.  While the thought to force a co-op game may seem strange at first, it is the best concept ever.  In the game you play as Rose's parents who are about to divorce.  Rose cries on two dolls that look like her parents, and the parents turn into the dolls.  The story is led and narrated by a very annoying book that tries to make the parents fall in love with each other again as if he is their therapist.  There are about 6 worlds to go through and each one consists of multiple levels.  Each area offers a different gameplay mechanic where you must work together to pass each level.The voice acting, animations, graphics, and just about everything about this game is great.  Not only do each level offer different game mechanics, but you also play different types of games within the game.  In some areas it plays like a 2D scroller, or another part you play like an isometric RPG, or in another area it resembles Mario Kart, but they all play very well even though they are almost individual games.  Since you are two players, the game is littered with random side games for you to play that has nothing to do with the storyline.  They have a chess board, a slot car game, and so much more just for you to play and have fun and compete against each other.  It is absolutely a blast because there's always something new that you are doing.While the game has a serious tone for the story of two adults thinking of divorcing, the game just doesn't take itself seriously at all, and it is just hilarious.  The script is hilarious, the action is hilarious, it is absolutely great.  For example, in the Mario Kart section, Cody, the father, says, this reminds me of something, but never says what it is.  The Book of Love narrator is annoying, but even the characters in the game are annoyed with him.I'm sure I've said it before, but truthfully it is just fun.  This is what video games are all about....having fun together.  This is a masterpiece, can't wait to see what else comes out from HazeLight.

author: chloo
review: A charming game that continued to win my heart over and over again as I sank more hours into it. The game design of every chapter was so gorgeous and diverse. The gameplay felt super smooth and intuitive, I don't think I encountered a single bug. Every level was so unique, and the different tools & co-op playstyles needed to work together was refreshing. Although the puzzles weren't very complex and the deaths were more forgiving, you can clearly see that the game is centered around HAVING FUN. And boy was the co-op gameplay so so fun. The minigames were a great addition, and I love that you could go off and get distracted by something as simple as taking photographs for 10 whole minutes. I also found myself getting invested in the characters, even though the plot was fairly simple. Who doesn't love a good slowburn?! Game of the year for couples, hands down.

author: Amelia
review: it's a well-designed cute double player game. I played it with my boyfriend, it brought us so much joy and the game is fun and relax, that's all I need and all I ask for a small game like this. Worth getting, but I would recommend when it's on sale, since it's great to play the first time, but not worth your time to get multiple ng pluses you know :) because those puzzles and quizzes are very easy to solve, playing it the first time gave us lots of joy, but play it second time is kinda too easy for adults or even for kids :) Don't get me wrong, I think that small imperfection doesn't swing It Takes Two's status in my personal opinion, it's a flawless mini game, we love it :)

author: BananaJoe
review: In my opinion one of the best co-op games of the last years:+ Great level design and variety of settings+ Heartbreaking story + Cool mechanics for two players (lots of different features which complement one another)+ Game looks very pretty+ Lots of funny minigames, which can be found during the playthrough+ Controls are very smooth+ Has a “Friend’s Pass” so only one player must buy the game+ No obvious bugs+/- Difficulty isn’t very high (if you’re looking for a challenge then this might not be for you; if you want to have a good and chill time with a friend then this game is perfect for you)- Might be a bit short for the price of 39,99 € (~12 h playtime)All in all, a very nice game which is made with a lot of love and an eye for details. Definitely worth buying!

author: Lividra
review: I played this game with my Ex-Boyfriend. We were together for almost four years. We separated two years ago after falling into difficult times, which led us to go separate ways and not speaking for a while. As of recent we have been spending more time together and it made me realize how much I missed this ridiculous guy in my life. We may not be back together, but the connection for eachother is still here. Time does indeed heal and I'm looking forward to what the future holds.This game has brought up many emotions. From happiness to anger, from impatience to feeling proud. Working together while also being competitive in minigames. It's almost a mixture of Little Big Planet, Pixar and Dreamworks. I also really liked that some the of scenes reminded me of other games and movies, which was a nice little touch added to the whole game. You meet different characters and encounter so many opportunities to just walk away from the main story line to explore and interact with things around you. The conversations, the little pokes at eachother, the fighting and the making up. This game has a fantastic balance of everything you need.

review: I bought this because I have three friends who are, or at-least were, interested in the game.First friend has no energy, the other lives on the other side of the planet, the third was juuuust riiight.Great game, & it has a friend's pass so that even if they do not own the game, they could participate & play alongside you.An especially great game for relationships, I wish that book was real so I could teach a valuable lesson with it to those who need it; a lot of people need it!I recommend the game to couples, especially struggling ones!

author: Foster
review: This is by far the best cooperative experience I ever had. I played this with my girlfriend and you get so much content for the price you get, we played casually for 12 hours, a 10-12 hour game! There was lots of laughs, cuteness, competition, and a little dark. With even a few other game references in it for those to enjoy. This game is for everyone to enjoy. There is constantly new, different, unique mechanics in every level.  BUY THIS GAME!I love you, my Angel.

author: PitBullsama
review: My Gf and I have a history of playing amazing co-op games like Trine, We Were Here, Borderlands, and Portal 2 (to name a few). We agree this one is the one of the best ever. In short, we absolutely loved this game. Although split-screen is quite possibly the worst for a PC gamer, it was easy to overlook/get used to, and what came from it was a delightfully charming, witty, and fun game. The well-told story weaved around tons of new and interesting levels, with brilliant and beautiful level design mixed with interesting mechanics for each section of the game that allowed each player to play a little bit differently, and you each get to solve problems using new tools. We both agreed that it was a wonderful and beautiful game, and although it wasn't difficult at all we both absolutely adore the game. The boss fights to me were screaming "raid mechanics" but the mess-ups were very forgiving throughout the entirety of the game which allowed us to never get stuck through any part of the game for very long and for the game to flow naturally as you uncovered more of the story. I will probably forever make my GF laugh by saying CO-LA-BO-RA-TIONNNNN. Turns out we only unlocked 16/24 minigames, so we'll have a reason to play it again and also swap roles so we can try the other half. I was pleasantly happy with the entire game, and would recommend it to anyone. The friend-pass allowed my GF to play the game without owning it, and that is an amazingly cool concept. It makes total sense with the game being split screen 95% of the time. Bravo game with great writing, fantastic gameplay and graphics, and a very enjoyable experience that we won't soon forget for a long while. I know many will compare this to portal 2, but portal 2 is puzzle solving, whereas this is so much more condusive to relationship building - just like the story. 14.5hrs and a wonderful week of smiles, laughter, and solving puzzles together made for a great experience. Would recommend to any two people who enjoy gaming together.

author: Teddie95
review: It takes two is honestly the type of game that reminds me of why I even started playing video games. It has a soul, something that is increasingly difficult to find outside of indie games.Without spoiling much the game is a multitude of genres but mostly a puzzle platformer, new mechanics are added each chapter to keep things fresh, the two different characters also get differing abilities, so its worth playing at least twice to experience everything.While the mechanics are not too deep and the puzzles aren't the hardest, they are always satisfying and clever, in the 11 hour run I have not been bored in a single scene or thought something dragged on too much or was frustrating.Later levels open up for some optional exploration, which is something I rarely do, but felt compelled to find all the neat secrets and easter eggs.Graphically speaking the game is just top notch, it is just beautiful. The human models seem a bit off but you rarely see those. The real stars to me were the enviroments, there is just so much to see and all of it is unique.In conclusion, buy this game and invite a friend with you, in a rare show of good thinking, the game requires only one person to buy the game, the other person downloads the full game for free and can join and play through the entire game. Think of it as inviting a friend over to play at your house when you were younger. If they cant run the game, Parsec or Steam play together is also a decent option if your connection allows it.Thank you for reading my review, I do not usually do them, if it has gotten someone to give this game a try, I consider it a worthy time investment :).

review: ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ where to begin. this is hands ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ down the best game ive played in the past 5 years, ATLEST.This game had environments that are so flushed out and amazing i cant tell which environment i love the most its that hard there like a dozen of em.  no section is recycled or felt half assed they put there heart and soul into this game and the story is simple but perfect because of the characters are so flushed out and the progression arc is so amazing it is way better than any Hollywood movie can come up with. I hate platforming in game and i was pushed to buy this and im ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ pissed i didnt buy it sooner. i am so sad this game came to an end. there was NEVER a single moment i was aggravated or bored with this game, and i hate platforming games. The ONLY thing i hate about this is i had too download the STD known as origin on my computer cause EA wont let ANYTHING be perfect. if not for that this would be the PERFECT game. i spent 40 bucks on this im a cheap ass i refuse to pay more than 30 dollars for any game an i would pay 100 dollars for this. The nostalgia you feel from this is amazing calling back to movies and games ive seen and played. i cant give this enough praise i ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ love it i WANT MORE I NEED MORE I TEARED UP WHEN I ENDED CAUSE I ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ NEED MORE

review: Made us cry, made us have a lot of fun, made us laugh so much! An awesome game and truly a co-op, without your partner you can not do anything at all! Unique and amazing visuals, astonishing simple and resolutive effects. Whole project is a piece of art, in script and playthrough! I recomend it 200%.

author: Akcard
review: This game saved my marriage. She didn't give an eff about me before but now she loves me again!***6 month update! She still loves me! This game is better than any marriage counsellor! This game is absolutely beautiful in every sense of the word. Beautiful art, music, story, character development. It makes your heart go through the roller coaster of emotions from sadness to guilt to hope to happiness with a little bit of laughter and rage (looking at you Dr. Hakim) on the side. Very casual and very forgiving with a few challenging aspects tied to the COOP intense parts of the game. One of the best COOP games I've ever played even if it was a bit short. Will definitely play through it again to play as the other character as each goes through their own route for the split COOP parts.10/10!

I cannot recommend this more to people who want a new co-op adventure to experience with friends, family, or even your significant other!!

author: NSB
review: When I saw the price of the game, I was a bit skeptical at first...Thought it might be a bit too expensive. But after seeing the reviews and some gameplay, I decided to take a leap of faith and purchase it.Right off the bat, the gameplay was extremely fun, unique and really really smooth. Visually, the game is outstanding and the world keeps looking better and better as you proceed. Sound design and music were great too, especially towards the later parts of the game. The mechanics and gameplay are easy to pick up and the puzzles aren't that hard either so this makes it perfect for gamers of any sort, even if you don't have much experience with them previously! Plus the mini games really help to change things up for a bit and have some friendly competition with your buddy!The "Friend's Pass" really sold the game for me because I was able to play the game with 2 other friends separately and all of us enjoyed it. In the end, while the price of the game might seem quite high to many people, I can say that it was 100% worth it for what you get. We played it casually and took about 14 hours to finish the main story as well as the mini games. And you can always just buy the game and split the price between your friends if that makes it more appealing to purchase it! Highly recommended! This game is a must play for all!

author: Hans-VII
review: It Takes Two is a masterpiece, one of the best games that I have ever played. This game has everything you could ever ask for: Heartwarming story, innovative gameplay, interesting characters and world, new interesting mechanics with every new level, amazing soundtracks, and super fun mini-games. Just get this game, and prepare to have an amazing journey with your friend or significant other.

author: Daemonisk
review: Very cute game! Growing up, I have always loved co-op games and this is definitely one of the best cooperative games currently available. Despite the fact that there are many gameplay variety and mechanics, It Takes Two manages to handle just about every mechanic well. There were certainly some that weren't as fun compared to others, but they were all quite manageable.Despite the fact that it is a cooperative game, there are a ton of optional minigames that pit you against your co-op partner. As a competitive person, it definitely scratched my competitive itch and it was extremely satisfying winning against my co-op partner in just about all of them :)With an excellent art direction, memorable cast of characters, quirky sense of humor and a very enchanting adventure, I highly recommend this game if you have a co-op partner to play with!

author: [🐧] Amai_Hana
review: I am conflicted. 6,5/10The gameplay and design of this game is honestly so amazing. You can have a real good time playing this with a lot of different puzzle games and mechanics. (which are on the easier side to figure out but nevertheless really fun)But after finishing the game I feel unsatisfied since the gameplay/design aspects are so extraordinary but the character develepment and story ruined it so much. There is one scene in the game which is disgusting and certanly not "dark humor". It is just f****d up and for me personally it ruined the game experience a lot since I didn't like the characters to begin with and with the storyline being nothing special and the character development going down the drain it just turned into a mediocre game which could have been outstanding in regards to the amazing job the rest of the team did.

author: Ranzi
review: It was a great game to be able to experience the wonders and adventures of the world of It Takes Two with my girlfriend. She may not be the world's greatest gamer but we were laughing and still having fun going through these creative yet dangerous puzzles the game offered us, each level was vastly difference from the last and only gets better as time goes on and some of them have completely different mechanics and some of the levels have really great aesthetics, my favorite one was the clockwork level and hers was the pillow and space level.Its rare to see a true couch co-op game nowadays and this one takes the cake for fun, creativity, and casual yet challenging gameplay. Go experience this game with a loved one; be it your lover, a friend, or a family member and I assure that both of you will never have a dull moment in this game, it might even bring you two closer together!

author: AtlasNova
review: This has passed beyond my expectations for a game. The story, the graphics, the characters, and even the mini games are so different and unique. I fell in love with the game and connected with my partner while playing and we even slightly bickered with each other at times but it was all part of the experience. It was beautiful and it felt like they took their time in every single detail of it, I will never regret spending any kind of money or the time I did on this game. I was so happy with the cute little ending. Thank you for creating another core memory to enjoy and look back on in my life!

author: xheynor
review: Invite your partner or friend for this game and you will be part of a really crazy roller coaster!The gameplay is very imaginative, funny, varied and sometimes hair-raising fast which takes great synchronous work to solve difficulties together!The mechanics and environment of the game are breathtakingly perfect, you can't find any repetitive environmental elements in it, of course the music and sound effects are really lavish too!Overall, one of the best co-op games I’ve ever played and there isn't such a game on the market yet, I can only recommend it to everyone!

author: life waster
review: It's really good, story driven coop game. I played with a friend and it took us a while to find the time to finish it but it was a lot of fun. There are many minigames hidden throughout the game. There's really big variation in boss fights, puzzles and items that let You progress through the game in every chapter and which make every chapter unique. Characters are well written, and some scenes are hilarious, like The ending was really good imo and the final soundtrack hit really well with the scene. Just play it if You have someone to play it with.

author: Ziph
review: This game is from start to end an absolute joy to play! It's like becoming a kid again and going to an amusement park, and enjoying every second of it. Before I bought it I was afraid it was being way too overhyped but... It was just so much fun. Nothing was ever boring or drawn out. It was like a 11 hour long roller coaster. You'll get maybe 11 hours of gameplay, we got a bit more due to being a little too competitive and spending a lot of time with the minigames. If you're looking for a challening game though, this isn't it. You'll just find fun. You're actively missing out by not playing this. Get it and play with your partner or friend.

author: RayneTheSage
review: Hands down the best game I've ever played. The world building/environments are immersive and gorgeous while the level design is absolute ace. Honestly, this game has it all. The wide range of abilities that go hand in hand with the different 'regions' you play in are top notch out of the box thinking and the lighting is believable to make it a cohesive game. Super fun to do a playthrough playing as May and after a few months another one as Cody. The inside jokes and mini games are the cherry on top and the elephant scene was our favorite. Pretty sure I'll pick this up again regularly with new people to introduce them to this amazing game. Definitely well deserved to win prizes as it sets the bar for storytelling to another level. So grab your friends, partner, parent, enemies, grandma and obviously cat to start playing this game.

author: Brodén
review: gud gam

author: Competizione
review: My wife and I love this game. Unique games like these are too few and far between. A wonderful journey to experience together with your partner.

author: Fishy
review: One of the best 2-player co-op games, hands down.My playthrough is with my wife, and we both had a wonderful experience and relatable moments.Here are some comments of this game:Gameplay : Extremely smooth, very easy to understand, satisfying and creative in all ways. Bunch of mini-games and gimmicks to enjoy. Also puzzles that involve both players are well designed, well thought, and challenging at the same time.Story : Sweet, cute, warm, and engaging. The story line is based on family, surrounding a beautiful house with lovely areas. Becoming little dolls lets you see your house, your family, and your loved ones from a much smaller perspective, and allows you to see these ordinary items with a much more meaningful way. The story tries to tell you a story that can happen in any of our real-life, and intends to let us know how to fix it. Truly a fun and amazing story.Optimization: First, I just want to point out that the only disappointing part is definitely origin. Sometimes I just couldn't log in, or I couldn't open the friend list. Other than this, the controls are really smooth, player camera is great, transitions and interactables are well-rounded, and I hardly found any bug. Really well polished.Art style and music: Nothing to complain about. Very imaginative world, fascinating details, and brilliant visual theme designed for each area.Gameplay : 10/10Story : 10/10Optimization : 8/10Art&Music : 9/10Overall score : 9.5/10

author: Alba6rek
review: I played the game with "Friend's Pass" for 11.8 hrs and continued my game in the original after I get it, so please don't get confused with 0.6 hrs <3When personal differences affect their lives to the point of divorce, but they are turned into puppets under a magical spell. Trapped in a fantasy world where the unpredictable hides around every corner, they are reluctantly challenged with saving their fractured relationship.The story is straightforward and there is no complexity in it, the goal of the game is to restore the relationship. But the events that happen around you may teach you more about the characters and different aspects of their lives and the cause of the main problem and why some things in their relationship were torn and marginalized. And do not forget the "Wise" book, which gives a beautiful effect in the game, the story, and the beautiful and funny discussion between them.The game in terms of control is - without hesitation - above excellent. The diversity in the game is very large and not boring, and this diversity is not only limited to abilities... but also in the map, the world, and also in the fights. The game is not complete without cooperation to solve puzzles. Few games with this genre contain this amount of diversity and abilities. There are also side challenges that are quite fun (fun only if the person next to you knows how to play).The game is not complete without the graphics and sounds, and the performance here is second to none. The diversity here is unparalleled. You will see a quiet and noisy world and you will see the life that stems from them as well as the hidden sides in them.- There are some mentions of other games in their game ;)- The game is narrative, and as usual, these games are linear.- You can play with your friend through the Friend Pass feature even if you don't own the game.- This game is available on EA play. You can save your money and try it there at a generous price.	The game is complete in all respects. It only lacks the right person to play with. It is worth the experience with the one you love and enjoy it, trust me you will never get bored of it.aaaaaaaaaand that it <3

author: RATIANA THE YASSIFIED RAT الكارث
review: This game made me feel sick and betrayed. Advertised as "family-friendly" but no amount technical or mechanical fun can erase the fact that you play as horrible, psychopathic, murderous people who are being forced to stay married to each other even though they are deeply incompatible. Mortal Kombat is honest, this game is not.

author: Dr. Peter Lankton
review: This game is awesome, you only need 1 copy to play together. You get to be small little doll people and run around your young daughter's room and play with all the toys when you're real small so the fidget spinners are like helicopters and you can use an etch-a-sketch together and paint. The devs added in lots of little things you can play around with and the game feels so full of stuff to be able to do thats optional from the main story, but still on the main path. Also, at one point the game has a short street fighter minigame where you fight a squirrel army captain on top of a plane. This game is definitely worth more than the $40 price tag.

author: Zorid
review: What an outstanding game. If for any reason you are thinking of getting this game but are debating it then stop! Just get the game you will not regret it. The game play was so good not once did it get boring or repetitive every section of the game gave different mechanics to play with and all are great fun to use.Another awesome thing about this game is the the free friends pass. Yes if you get this game then any of your friends can play this game for free with you by installing the friends pass ;) Any mini games? Yes 25 of them and are a lot of fun to play there may be a couple of boring ones you play once and others even chess that you may play a lot of.The story is well written very heart felt and could be emotional to some no spoilers, it is best you play it for yourself for the story instead of read or watch how it plays out or ends. Would i recommend? YES 1.000.000% even at full price (I would of even payed more) well worth it.Game Play / Sound / GFX / Puzzles / StoryOverall 11/10.

author: fluff
review: Probably one of the best games I've played in a very long time, Every moment was filled with thrilling and tense gameplay. The graphics,scenes and characters were all amazing too and super comical! I played through it with one of my friends and it was just a blast to make memories and just have a bunch of laughs playing all the mini games seeing who's the best at them! I don't write reviews often but I feel like this game deserved it 100%! definitely would recommend to anyone who is looking for a game to play with their friend/significant other! 10/10

author: Malakai*
review: One of the most polished, varied and entertaining games that I've played in years!It Takes Two is the tale of a couple about to get divorced, that needs to fix their relationship and it will take you in an incredible adventure for it. I'm glad to say that one of the strong points of this game is...well, gameplay. The co-op gameplay is always evolving through every stage, and you will have to solve and play multiple puzzles, platforming challenges and well...basically a bit of everything. I mean it. Every stage is crafted to give you a new surprise fun mechanic to work with.Difficulty level is just right to not be mindless but it keeps frustration very low. And the experience is different depending on which character you are choosing so keep that in mind too!Levels are designed with a lot of care (it shows) and there is a lot of side content to find through the journey, and little details and things that can be interacted with just for fun, put there just to satisfy your curiosity or do silly things with your partner.It also has minigames that you can find semi-hidden in levels that can put some fun competition into the gameplay, and they are all quite different!Visually, it can be quite stunning and there lots, lots of incredible looking stages and pieces through the whole experience, and the main doll characters look super detailed too, which combined with the gameplay and store, makes this game feel like some kind of Pixar movie in the best of ways.Controls and camera tend to be as good as it can get in 3D platformers (They are never perfect, that's just how it is) and in general, it just tends to feel super responsive, tight and fun to use (Played with a controller, partner played with keyboard and he was fine with it too)Music and sound are great too and there are some very memorable music, specially towards the end of the game (No spoilers though :) )Overall, I just can't recommend this game enough if you have a good friend, fiancee, partner, whatever you want to play with. It's an incredible, super fun cooperative journey like you have never seen before and it makes me super happy that it got the GOTY award because there is nothing like it, and you can tell the team that worked in it put love and passion into it above anything. ♥♥♥♥ THE OSCARS

author: jam
review: There's nothing else I want in a game other than helping an autistic child rebuild her parent's marriage through a wild, beautiful journey in love and imagination. Not only did my friend Connor and I rebuild this marriage, it really took two when I squirted all over him as we danced the night away. Connor Malcolm, will you marry me? But not in a gay way.11/10 - Everything you could ask for in a game, and more (buttstuff)

author: AdaMia
review: What an amazing experience! During our playthrough, we were constantly surprised and impressed by the diversity of the level designs as well as the gameplay. It felt magical. At times we weren't sure whether the game was leaning toward childish or mature but it seems like it was the golden middle. Some of the levels really brought out that childlike wonder, while the storyline kept surprising us with its display of real-life issues.Throughout the whole experience, we got to interact like in no other game, learning that you're not gonna get far without cooperating. We have not encountered any bugs and the game truly felt fleshed out with a lot of time, effort, and care behind it. I wholeheartedly recommend it. There aren't many games like this one out there and it'll be for sure hard to surpass it. "The spiders were cute"- Just_Memes1

author: kittyyyyyy!!!!! ♥
review: Views on the game aside, I just received an email telling me that my EA account that I created specifically to play this game has been banned, with no reason supplied. I cannot imagine what I could have done to get banned. Perhaps play on Linux? So I guess I can no longer play the game anymore.E: I have contacted EA support and they refuse to elaborate on the issue. Nice customer support ;p.E2: Contacted them a second time and the ban was removed. Still not entirely sure what caused it.E3: you'd never believe it but despite having not touched this game or my EA account since I was unbanned, I have been banned again.

author: The CaT is a lie
review: If you are looking for a quality game with the descent humor where you can spend about 10 hours, that's your perfect choice. The game is quite dynamic with some puzzles to solve and its mechanics change before you get bored. There is no grinding, you'll not be punished for being lame, the checkpoints are quite frequent. Overall, it is a great game, which can be easily called AAA for me, especially after all the recent big title disappointments. You might not like the price till this moment, but it's included in the EA Pay subscription recently, so you literally have no excuse for not playing in it.P.s. Long live her Majesty, Cutie the Elephant.

author: Schnabelschweinchen
review: This game is beautiful. The graphics are amazing. The gameplay isa alot of fun and very engaging, The puzzles are mostly very easy but still fun to solve. The Dialoges and most of the carackter cast is pretty humoures to listen to and watch.The 2 Player integration is really well made and if you play with your girl or boy, that makes it a time well spend together, letting the hours just vanish together. Also sound design, Worldbuilding, the details all around, the levels and and and... its simply beaufifully done and deserves just the bests of praise. well.... for the first 6-7 hours....then suddenly, cody and amy decide like the psychopathic parents they are, to kill their daughters most loved toy... we laughed at the insane conclusion and laughed all the way to her play room.... and then, in a VERY TWISTED way... the two still go through with their plan.. AFTER getting a hug from cutie, after cutie asked then about their feelings and wanted to help them, after chaising her, while cutie was begging for mercy, after ripping out a leg, after dragging her slowly towards a cliff slowly, after listening to her pleads for felt hours, after a needle stapped into cuties ear, pining it to the ground... well... they didnt even pull the needle out, instead they just wanted to drag cutie further, ripping also the ear off... thats there we stopped playing, my girl sad, tears dropping down the chin, after SIX HOURS of fun and laughter... well done dude! who ever got the idea of for this scene in that game is a psychopath, the whole game was not in this mood at all up to this point, it was all fun and games and from yet to now it changed to psychopathic torture scene...Amy: "i am feeling quite evil doing this..."

review: Good game

author: Turtle
review: Was playing with my boy and it's such a  dope game but he went to go play with his wife instead. I wish someone loved me. 10/10

author: Kootlass
review: Almost the best adventure/platformer game which I played in my life. From the co-op mechanisms to puzzles and boss fights, everything well-designed and work very well in this game.

author: MarioDude
review: It Takes Two is a masterpiece of video game art. Typically there aren't many games that do cooperative campaigns well, but I was absolutely BLOWN away by this game. It features 15-20 hours of genuine cooperative engaging enjoyable gameplay, that feels like it was designed to do what it's doing, which it was, meaning the execution is done exceptionally. In the game, you play as either May or Cody, which are married, and have a kid named Rose. May and Cody are seeking a divorce, after some time of being emotionally disconnected from one another. They tell Rose this, and she seeks to find a way to fix it. The "Book of Love" by Dr. Hakim, transports May and Cody to the shadow realm, (not really) but it's a place where they attempt to tend and re-kindle their relationship. The game's mechanics are amazing, smooth, I experienced little to no bugs when playing with my friend, and the soundtrack is AMAZING. There's also a lot of little video game references from other fun video games. Good job, Hazelight!

author: Glandolf le Magnifique
review: I'm not reviewing the game, I'm reviewing the forced integration into Origin master crapware. This piece of junk is infamous, and has been a reason why I've never bought EA games for 10 years now. My girlfriend offered that we play this game, and as she rarely plays, I was excited to try. Until I learnt the game was edited by EA games, one of the most disliked editor in the world. And there are good reasons for this. So you have to install Origin and create a f***** origin account to play. But the integration with Steam is not smooth for everyone. For my girlfriend, it has been a nightmare. Origin would launch, but not linked to steam. And the account creation process has been a mess. Asking for stupid "Recaptcha-style" puzzle such as "find the set of dices which sum is 14", 4 times in a row, in limited time. This is completely insane. A game is supposed to put you in a mood of excitement and relaxation. We lost an evening configuring this piece of creepy, invasive, attention-seeking, extraordinarily unreliable, frustration building f***** pile of sh**** junkware. Frankly EA, you suck so much I would feel an immense relieve if one day you were dismantled.

review: what a wonderfull and miracle game , so much fun and excited , also long gameplay the best coop game in gaming history , need more game like this please !

author: Holyraven
review: My wife and I loved this game. Its beautiful, creative and Heart warming. definitively recommend it!

author: Bamisaur
review: My girlfriend and I grabbed this in a bundle with "A Way Out" another awesome Couch Co-Op game. We absolutely loved this title, it made us think about things in our own relationship. Made us feel sad, happy, glad and sometimes all of them at once. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a game to play with their Significant Other!

author: Luigi-sama
review: It takes two, one of the most amazing games i've played by Hazelight Studios, i can imagine the amount of effort invested in this game, that said, investing in this game with only 30€ is a steal and you get a lot more than what's it worth. This game has a stunning level design, a good story line (not my cup of tea however, still very good).Dr. Hakim appearance will trigger your anticipation as with his arrival, new game mechanics are always introduced.The visual design of all elements are wonderfully crafted.The environments are imaginative and cleverly designed.Only noticed one particular bug during the whole gameplay. As i was playing with friend, he was invisible on my side of the screen in the garden section.Worth every penny.If all the puzzle are solved quickly then it will take about 10h during your first walkthrough. However, the average is set to 12-16h, so if you take in all the mini-games and take longer with puzzle solving.It's pretty lovely to play with your partner, but if you're playing with your bro, it will still be pretty lovely, just consider that there's a 50% chance of you guys dating.From my experience, no grinding was involved.Honestly, this game is highly optimized, impressively so. So i'd say a carrot or a potato from the supermarket should get this going. All the jokes aside, check the PC requirements, they're not much.Honestly, i will want to point the target audience to all ages, however, i think i will be pointing it to adults, as i've never felt so bad about an elephant doll and a girls tears so much. Note: There's a whole bunch of references to other games and movies, like the lion king, a way out, Mario, +++.The variety introduced was a vital piece as it lead to the lack of repetivity in the game. So, VERY GOOD. In one game, i felt like a played soo many games.As said, this coop game is worth EVERY PENNY. Can go from good to eargasm!I'd like to thank the developer and publishers for this wonderful game, the experience that was offered will most likely never be forgotten. I would like to congratulate everyone involved as this game was simple, "AMAZING".Thank you very much (Except for the elephant, that wasn't cool).

Definitely a fun, engaging and overwhelming experience. GREAT GAME

author: crowbar
review: It's crazy how long this game is, considering how much creativity it contains. Every level is completely different, with unique assets and new gimmicks. It's not a perfect game, the book is really annoying, the writing is not that great in general, but it's just pure fun. It can easily be played with someone who isn't THAT much into videogames, because of simple controls and good, stylized graphics.

author: Jin
review: This game has so much going for it, it’s too bad you have to literally mutilate and murder a cute, innocent elephant-child as she screams in agony and begs for mercy. It’s not funny, it’s not ‘artistically challenging’, it’s just vile. In case that’s not enough of a deterrent, the two characters you play as are so unpleasant. Does anyone really want to spend dozens of hours with a bickering couple? I couldn’t care less whether these *%#holes get back together and their daughter would be better off in an orphanage. The game is well-designed and funny and has diverse, satisfying gameplay, but it’s not worth it. Go play something more wholesome and life-affirming, like GTA5 or Postal 2.

I said that at the end of each chapter. I loved how it felt very different it was for each chapter and how very exciting it was. Everything was done with great detail and it really shows. 10/10

author: Raymando
review: This game is not getting enough praise. It's not just one of the best coop games ever made, but one of the best games ever. Period.This score puts it above some of my favorite games of all time, which It Takes Two will forever be a part of as well.

author: aisute
review: Ok, so I'm not the fan of how this game is written, but the gameplay itself is very enjoyable! I really wanted more from the story- more relatable and deeper ending, so it was a bit underwhelming in that regard, but I am really spoiled with indie games that often give us something unexpected. The art is exceptional, the level desing is superb. Some levels truly will leave you in awe and joy! I believe this game will be a great experience for anyone in the family and to be fair, even if the writing is not very deep might still inspire some important conversations with your kids about what it means to be a family for you. Which is really cool.  Looking back, I think I started this game with some kind of expectation, as everyone was praising it so much, so maybe that's why I got so picky about how it's written. I see now that it's created to be more for fun than anything else and they managed to make it work perfectly.

author: ROOT BEER
review: This game is AMAZING ! This is the most unique way to play a game ever (for now) and lot of people are giving bad reviews because of "Origin" but since they are working with EA and stuff I don't personally care about the need to have Origin... Yes you need to have Origin to play this game but the game experience is so amazing that installing and creating a account is nothing, anyway if you been playing Battlefield games you already own a Origin/EA account so it does not matter at allThe most crazy thing about this game (Like A Way Out) is that your friend don't need to buy the game, you can literary having one person buying the game and play together! Now you can tell the dev really care about making games and not a ton of money ! Love you guys!

author: LNX
review: So far, It Takes Two is truly amazing!The levels are well thought out and varied. The sound design is ingenious and underlines all scenes.Gameplay and puzzles are always alternating and surprise you in a positive way.The boss fights are also very creatively designed and thus offer a refreshing change.I can recommend this game to anyone who wants to experience a mind-blowing co-op game.And if you don't have any friends to play this game with, there's no point in just leaving a negative review.Instead, download Parsec, for example, and play with strangers there. Nobody should miss out on this game!

author: LollipoP
review: I truly loved the experience I got from it takes two. It had me hooked from the start and kept it that way till the end, although I wish it didn't have to end.The game is absolutely brilliant, the story line, the voices and the humour all in one is fantastic, they are reflecting a child who's parents are constantly fighting and decided to divorce, turns them into dolls where they stay around their massive house, shed, garden etc as miniatures solving problems together to get to the finish line. They struggle, they fight, they throw insults at each other, but they also come together, they compromise, they work, they pick each others brains and they support each other. It makes you reflect on your own life and relationships with your close ones as the story goes along, and if you're giving it your all to make them work, like you once had.By having the friends pass, only one of you needs to actually own the game, it cuts the cost in half €20 per head which isn't bad for the amount of hours you play and you can play it again but reversed characters so you get to experience the game in a different shape, with different tools. So far I got 13 hours of the game, if I rerun it again it would probably be another 13 or more by exploring every single corner the game has for us.THE GAME GETS 10/10. SOLID ALL THE WAY THROUGH.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------As we played together I will attach my boyfriends review just below as it's only fair given the game takes two ;)It takes two is more of a journey than a video game. You share a vibrant and wondrous experience with someone special, and are both left with a rich memory. The closest description I could give you is being in a pixar movie. The game is a combination of 3D platformer, problem solver, exploration, isometric rpg -- all weaved together amongst the backdrop of a touching story line. The voice acting and animation are brilliant, the humour is conveyed exceptionally well. As a product it demonstrates the future of interactive entertainment experience: a beautiful compound of video game and movie -- not too cut-scene heavy, not too punishing either. Post credits I was left with the same feeling when walking out of the cinema: readjusting to the banality of everyday life.Such a great experience, I not only look forward to playing it again with flipped roles, but to whatever Hazelight create next.

author: Summer235
review: Pros:Gameplay was funBeautiful worldsCons: If you've ever watched a 90's sitcom or early 00s, you'd know the trope "Smart wife, bumbling idiot of a husband" trope. You see it here. Only modernized a little bit, I believe Cody is a stay at home dad. The story wasn't really good and simplistic. I think it would have been better if May and Cody realized they could stay friends and move on, or just we played them as a happily married couple right off the bat. Was a slog in a couple chapters.

author: shifty
review: Hazelight, aka F' the Oscars guy, brings back that split screen couch co-op style in It Takes Two, their second major game after A Way Out. That nostalgic split screen style was refreshing in A Way Out, the game was decent although it didn't push the boundaries too much in the story and gameplay departments. It Takes Two, on the other hand felt more refined, more developed and in general, a total improvement on their craft leading to a more memorable and amazing experience. The overarching story revolves around Cody and May, who you play as, going through a tough time in their relationship and are revealing to their daughter, Rose, they are planning on splitting up. Rose becomes upset and through the power of magical tears, Cody and May embody their daughter's dolls and encounter the Book of Love (Dr. Hakim) who is determined to rekindle their relationship with the help of COLLABORATION.It is definitely a story that is more geared towards couples, but that's not to say it can't be enjoyed by people who aren't in a relationship. I played this with a friend and we still had a great time. The characters that are introduced are interesting, the humour and back and forth between Cody/May and Dr. Hakim is amusing. Overall it's a fun, lighthearted and entertaining time excluding that one dark, out of place moment that made us both feel uncomfortable.At the core, the game is a puzzle platformer while the puzzles themselves aren't overly difficult the game shines in the ever-changing outstanding gameplay. In every new area Cody and May receive new weapons/gadgets, and with them entirely new mechanics. Learning how these tools worked each time made it constantly feel fresh, and half the fun was figuring out how to troll the other with them. Along with the huge amount of variety in genres and settings makes for an incredible experience from start to finish. It'll be a third-person shooter, then a top-down dungeon crawler, then a fighting game, then a rhythm game. Each genre never overstays it's welcome and switches up before it gets too dull. The minigames have a lot of variety as well, and are a nice detour that promotes that competitive fun banter between players. Boss battles are fun and creative, and again vary in their mechanics usually incorporating the mechanics you learnt throughout each level.Graphically the game looks magnificent and has a Pixar-esque style, the animations are well-done, the different set pieces and cinematic scenes are awe-inspiring. The level design is well thought-out and immersive. The split screen really helps the other player see what they are doing, and makes it convenient to convey to each other on how to solve puzzles.The voice acting was decent. Music was fine, there were only a couple of moments that were memorable or exciting but it never nailed it to the point where I found myself checking out the soundtrack, like I had done with other games. The rest of the sound design is great, there is a high level of work that has gone into producing fitting sounds for all the different mechanics, bosses, enemies and levels.Hazelight seem to have found their niche and have put a lot of passion into this. A fantastic co-op adventure game, and I'm excited to see where they'll take us next. If you are even somewhat interested in this, you NEED to experience this game. The friend pass makes it even easier so grab your partner, your friend, a random on the internet, just get anyone! And I just can't wait for my second playthrough when I actually get a significant other and we inevitably get into arguments.

author: Apathetic
review: Whenever I first saw this game announced during the Game Awards, I was excited more so than I had ever been about most games. There was just something charming about it and then have heard that Hazelight Studios was behind it? The people behind a way out? The game that is probably the thing that saved my friendship with my best friend? I had to buy it, I didn't have any real expectations. Though, it did take me a bit of convincing to pre-order it myself. Though, I knew without a doubt without that trailer in January...I wouldn't have thought otherwise about that game. To tell you the truth, I was kinda expecting it to be a bit of a disappointment and kinda dull at times (maybe hitting the same story beats of a way out) like A Way Out. Then I also heard about how you'd end up playing the game on steam and I was afraid of Steam's Remote play. I was afraid that the experience would completely ruined.However, my fears were unfounded as we later found out that the entire experience had a friend's pass just like a way out. I finished the game the day it came out on stream, and I have a lot of opinions about it.I think its a 10/10 game straight out of the gate because of the level design and how they use every single ability to the fullest they can per level. It was balanced, it was clean, it was corny as hell but lovable, and it was overall a much funner game in contrast to A Way Out which had its strong moments. This blew the hell out of it with its vibrant colors, simple tutorials, amazing settings and world building, and simple and fun puzzles. Everything flowed smoothly and there's times we didn't even know we had just done the main story, we thought we were just exploring. It was a really unexpectedly smooth experience. You'd be able to play this game with anyone, the level designs are all extremely diverse. They're all a unique experience and the characters just don't stay the same. Each Level truly shows how they affect them, and how they become more and more attracted to each other. I will say that the collision is weird at times, we were only lagged out once in the game due to EA's server (you have to sign into origin to play this game), and doesn't really have as much choice as a way out did. Its a beautiful game to play on a weekend with somebody, though I definitely don't recommend somebody playing the full 10 hours of this game. Its short, but its better than most games with its 40 dollar asking price and only you have to buy it in order to play with your friends. I definitely recommend this game and it will DEFINITELY stay in my heart for a while just like a way out did.

author: gedankenkind
review: It Takes Two is a co-op adventure by Hazelight Studios, published by EA. The latter is relevant since you will need an EA/Origin Account to play the game and to invite a friend to play even if you buy the game on Steam. The game tells the story of May and Cody, a married couple about to get divorced who are transformed into dolls made of wood and clay by a strange book their daughter Rose found. May and Cody are forced to work together over the course of various levels, getting to know each other and themselves better again bit by bit. You will play with a split screen almost all of the time, which for me took some getting used to. Other than that the gameplay was a lot of fun. The movement mechanics are very nice, I was happy that I was able to use two of my favourite platformer abilities right from the start, Double Jump and Dash, which makes for fun and fast-paced gameplay. During the different levels you will temporarily get new abilities as well. Most of the time you will play a platformer game, but there might be some surprises along the way. In our 15 hours of playtime, It Takes Two never got boring!In fact, it was so much fun that I would easily list this game among my favourite multiplayer/co-op games. I was pretty certain of that very early on and still the game managed to get even better over and over again. The levels are incredibly detailed and lovingly made, and even though the game itself is quite linear, there is so much to explore and discover. But not all of it is fun. Expect to be annoyed a lot by the book that got May and Cody into this mess. Also expect to almost hate the character you’re playing from time to time and to do things you absolutely don’t want to do - unless you don’t have a heart (no judgement here). However, those are but minor drawbacks that still contribute to the overall great experience.

author: Saint Nicholas
review: 10/10 One of the best coop games I’ve played. The level design is very creative . The gameplay and puzzles are so good. Soundtracks are great(especially in the last act) .Graphic is just beautifulBTW Elephant scene :(

author: Creampuff
review: This game was an enjoyable experience all of the way through! It presented a very charming style and game play that I think would be enjoyable to people of all ages and gaming experiences. It has very easy to pick up controls and it is not too easy or too difficult to play, good balance! You have the main story that you can follow, but if you like to explore your environments there is a lot of things to interact with and even mini games! It was fun having little bouts of competition and collaboration between sections of the story with the person I played it through within each of the worlds. If you are looking for a chill and enjoyable game with a +1 then I would HIGHLY recommend this title! (I was able to play this title through remote play, but they have a feature where you may use a 'Friend's Pass' if you do not like how remote play works! Very handy!)

author: ouroboros
review: Full of charm and creativity. If you remotely like co-op, this game is a must play. It's not the most mechanically challenging game but that doesn't mean it's devoid of challenge, the game is more forgiving when it comes to mistakes and is more about having fun with a friend.There are quite a few fun minigames you can play in between levels and there are enough creative ideas in the levels themselves that it was a joy going through them. The levels and their locations are varied and full of little details waiting to be discovered. A lot of care was put into making the locations fun to explore aesthetically and mechanically; Movement is fluid enough that it makes getting from one point to the next relatively painless although it can get a bit finicky at times with ledge grabs, grapple points, and climbable walls.True co-op games are rare these days and as someone who loves them, it's nice to see one with obvious passion behind it. I hope this means the future is a little brighter for games like this and it's easily my favorite game to come out this year so far.

author: Uwe
