author: ironFIRE
review: Be prepared to laugh, cry, and recoil in horror as you bond with your co-op partner.Everything in this game is polished to a shine. The animation feels like it's out of a modern film. Each chapter introduces new controls, and they all feel snappy. Nothing ever feels clunky or unfinished.Like with a Pixar movie, you'll get something different out of the story depending on where you're at in life. The characters are extremely well-developed, and the story takes them through clear arcs that make sense. I actually think I learned something about how I approach relationships while playing through this game.The game can only be played with two people, and it's paced perfectly with that in mind. Plenty of downtime after intense scenes to just let you talk with your co-op partner or separate and unwind, whatever you need. Moments where you're teaming up are interspersed with moments of exploration.Everything just makes for a great experience, one that's even greater than the sum of its parts.

author: Chaos
review: This is a shining example of what happens when a developer puts the quality of the game first instead of trying to make a fast buck. This game is amazing on so many levels I don't know where to begin... * Each level is thought out carefully and is unique * Each mechanic is unique and almost never repeated (except for movement mechanics which makes sense) * The story is really in depth, touching, and thought provoking * The graphics are also amazing, and well thought out * The multiplayer experience is smooth, and largely bug free * In fact bugs? What bugs? Oh the ones my friend and I exploded with a matchstick bazooka?This developer sets a new standard for gaming in an industry that's largely forgotten what it means to make something that's quality and rivals any triple A developer out there.In a word - Brilliant.Oh and did I mention the friends pass? Yeah that's amazing too. Buy the game once, play it with a friend who can play for free...really epic.Worth *every* penny and more. I'd gladly buy two copies but to get one free? ... my mind was blown.

author: eloiselovesseals
review: This game would have been fantastic if it actually worked as what it was supposed to be: a co-op game.I played this with my boyfriend who lives overseas and it started of fine, but soon enough, the game would completely glitch out for seemingly no reason. My character was going through walls, there was a huge timing delay resulting in failing levels over and over again, which meant we had to troubleshoot the game pretty much every single level. We tried Steam remote play which would only allow my bf to play with a controller and not his keyboard, which added extra input lag. This however seemed to be the only way to combat the game's many glitches in normal online co-op. The root of this issue seems to be that it launches through EA's Origin severs DESPITE running through Steam as well, which completely overloads the connection you have to the other player. EA's inability to run a game properly made this game extremely frustrating to get through, and made me question my $50 AUD purchase. Also they make you mutilate a cuddly Elephant to make their daughter cry? Jesus.This game would have been fantastic if not for the awful technical issues you are forced to slough through, making it unpleasant and tiresome to play.Update October 2022:EA seems to have patched many of the issues which were experienced in my review from last year. The game is no longer anywhere as near as laggy as it was, making it much more enjoyable to play. You still have to kill the elephant though.

author: Flourix
review: Thanks Josef Fares and Hazelight, and everyone involved for this fantastic story, game and moment you gave me together with my best friend. The game made me full of love, laughter, happiness and also intense stressful moments that I love, but probably my friend loves more when he hears me scream out loud in panic! I am so looking forward to what you can do as your next game after this was such a big hit - being a fan of A Way Out, and now It Takes Two - I can't wait for the next one. If we're all lucky, maybe it's closer around the corner than we think, DLC content following all the unique characters in each chapter? Spice it up with harder difficulty levels? There is so much things you can do and develop from here. But as we say in Sweden: "Den som väntar på något gott... väntar aldrig för länge". (Good things come to those who wait.)

author: ameyer2o06
review: Very well made coop game.Difficulty is pretty low. This is a casual co-op game that doesn't really require any advanced puzzle or platforming skills. Levels are extremely well made for the most part, with only a few segments getting a little repetitive. Every level has unique powers which are funny and provide a lot of entertainment. Both players get their share of cool moments in each stage. The good:- lots of content, very little reuse of assets or mechanics- good use of coop, the game doesn't feel like a single player game with a 2nd person tacked on- generates a lot of funny moments, definitely entertaining the whole way though.- letting the 2nd player play for free is awesome- 3D environments are definitely above current standards and look unexpectedly good (and continue to do so through the entire game)The bad:- origin service is trash and annoying to set up/get moving- occasional performance problems. I lost frames basically every time the game loaded something or i entered a new area, but this was not a problem in minute-to-minute gameplay.TL;DR: If you like coop games and are not looking for anything super brain-busting, definitely a good buy.9/10

author: ZeroPC
review: Wow. Just. Wow.From the same studio that brought you A Way Out, It Takes Two is a remarkable masterpiece that is exactly as it is described; you can't beat it without your friend.The games story is simple, but easy to follow and get attached too. You and your friend play as the married couple Cody and May that are planning to divorce. Their daughter, Rose, is afraid of them divorcing and wants them to stay together. After some magic and feels moments, poof, you and your friend are now pint-sized-puppets that must navigate through several levels, puzzles, and bosses, while following the instructions of a walking, talking, Mexican book of Love that tries to restore the relationship between you two and make the whole family happy again.The gameplay is really fun and VERY creative. It Takes Two is primarily puzzle focused and captures that focus almost flawlessly. The levels are all designed around different power ups both you and your partner receive and must use those new powers to navigate to your destination. This aspect is wonderful and prevents the game from getting repetitive, always giving the players new ways to get around the obstacles. The game is mostly plat-former (Mario, Sonic, ect.) however from time to time, the gameplay style changes for a bit, referencing other video games (I wont spoil the surprises) which I found funny, fun, and unique for the parts that they took place in.The game is beautiful. Absolutely gorgeous. My partner and I quite often found ourselves complimenting how amazing the backgrounds and visual designs looked quite often. Normally for games like these, I always have a least favorite visual design between all the different levels, but this game is so damn beautiful, I cant choose. One minute you're navigating a tool shed at pint size, next minute you're travelling through space and childs bedroom fort.The story is sad, sweet, and heartfelt. Every now and then during all the levels, the couple will briefly interact about their relationship (both positively and negatively), and look back at past memories ultimately building up to certain points in the game.  Overall I loved the experience this game gave me. I was on the edge of my chair the whole ride, excited for the next best thing in every chapter. I played this game with a really close friend which made the experience only better. If you are looking for a fun, immersive, co-op 3D plat-former, this masterpiece is a perfect choice. And remember, it takes two to make this experience its very best, not just one.

author: Kronoscai
review: The best part is the visuals, it's like playing a Pixar movie except it's longer. 10+ hours of gameplay and the game changes things up every chapter so it never gets bored. The price is definitely worth it for two people. Only thing is that I HATED the Origin platform that came with it. I didn't spend half an hour to download the game only to register an account and have it tell me "Sorry, we are having some technical difficulties" (I ended up asking someone else to register it for me) Not to mention it required an update the second day I downloaded the game. Anyways, good game, buy it, Origin sux.

author: Radiant Wisp
review: TL;DR: A game of missed opportunities from game mechanics to lore. Presents itself as relationship advice, and completely fails at it.I am leaning towards a negative review, although overall impression of the game is "it's okay". I would not recommend it to my friends, and I think there are better ways to spend your time than playing this game.So now onto why part. My main reason is that the game tries to be everything at the same time and it's really bad at it. The mechanics of the game change from chapter to chapter, very frequently, and none of them are used to the full potential.The biggest disappointment in gameplay was the last chapter. It introduces May power to sing and "attack" with voice, and Cody's power to wield a shield or boomerang type of weapon. And then the game just uses these mechanics as isolating button presses. Here is a wire that only Cody can interact with. Here is a bunch of microphones that only May can interact with. This has nothing to do with the power itself, at all, it's just separation of buttons for two players, without use of the actual mechanic.For example, game throws a leading through the maze puzzle, where May is screaming into different colour microphones to control the platform that Cody is on in different directions. Here, you can replace singing power that May have with anything else, at all, and the puzzle is still exactly the same. Her power is completely irrelevant to how you play the game.This poor design is felt through the whole game. Great potential for puzzles, and not used properly.Second great disappointment is the lore of the game. (major spoilers ahead)1. May and Cody murder Queen Cutie III in a brutal sequence with no player choice to cause their daughter to cry, they proceed to bathe in her tears, only to find out that they are wrong about the spell that was put on them. The book steals the letter from May and Cody and locks them into therapy session, in which the first chapter takes them to their vacation place where Cody proposed to May. Here is a thing. Neither May nor Cody never acknowledged that they have just abused their child, and made a mistake. They never mention the murder that they went through, they just forget about it and enjoy the revisit of the vacation. This is awful writing.2. The premise of the game is great. A broken relationship that is about to lead to divorce, and the struggle of the child accepting the situation. The ending is obvious from the start - the marriage will be repaired, that's the goal, family will be reunited. It's fine to have an obvious ending. And then the writers completely messed up on how to get to the ending. They throw in a "therapy" book, and "expert" on relationships, and give themselves a out of jail free card at the very end saying that the book was found in trash. This is an incredibly awful writing, that doesn't explore the actual causes of relationship issues, doesn't actually fix them, and just forces the two characters into romantic setup that magically recovers their marriage.3. Game gives bad relationship advice and ignores the obvious problem: communication issues. The game says that the relationship is restored by addressing:1) time that the couple spends together (more time = fixed marriage), which is not how it works in real life2) attraction between the two, which is not how you fix a marriage that is heading towards divorce3) Cody's passion towards gardening, which is completely irrelevant to the marriage4) May's passion towards singing, which is even more distant from the broken marriageThe game ignores real issues and forces players through a teenager's view of how to fix the relationship. The company that created the game could have just added a single most important person to the team that would make the lore work. A marriage therapist. It's so obvious for the game that presents itself as relationship fixing game, that I am baffled on how a big company did not get a therapist onboard to actually make the writing sensible.There were other issues with the game. There were a bunch of great moments in the game as well. This review is getting long already, so I am going to stop here, even though good moments are worth mentioning, but I bet you can find praise in other people reviews already.

author: armenianarkanian
review: The level design and mechanics of this game are excellent! So much fun! However, the plot and cut scene content are quite terrible. The lack of intelligence-- especially but certainly not exclusively emotional intelligence-- on the part of the main characters makes it feel icky to resume playing them after every time you lose control. They're such dumbass jerks! Every piece of plot that isn't outrageously ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥-stupid in this game is disgustingly trite. Also, the obviously-an-adult voice acting for a child is jarring.ALL THAT BEING SAID, THE LEVEL DESIGNS ARE SO HIGH QUALITY AND ENJOYABLE THAT I STILL RECOMMEND THIS GAME. Just take your headphones off during cut scenes and make up your own dialogue; there's basically no chance it'll be worse than the original.

author: Dragon of the South Wind
review: I am really hard to impress when it comes to singleplayer games, and this game blew my mind. It's an absolute staple of what modern game design should be. The game is so chock full of new, fun and reliable game mechanics that you leapfrog from one type of enjoyment to the next with incredibly well laid out pacing. Its akin to going to a fancy restaurant that has a taster plate of 100 different foods. It constantly surprises you with new flavours of fun you just wont expect. At one point there was just a pile of snowballs with the mechanic to pick up 3 snowballs at a time indefinitely, which lead to my duo and I having a 2 hour long snowball fight.Its just a fantastic experience overall. Also the business model is a rare gem, only one person has to buy and the other just joins with a free client. This eliminates the guilt/awkwardness of trying to get someone else to buy a coop game to play with you.

review: First of all let me start by saying that I have never reviewed a game on steam, but this game truly deserve a positive review.  Generally speaking if you are into two player games and you buy any game this year, make it this one!The gameplay One word fun and extremly creative. The developpers have really pushed it to the limit in terms of creating an ever changing gameplay experience. One second you are playing a plattformer, only to fight monsters RPG style the next. The puzzles are smart and depending on the levels and abilities you currently have the solution is always a little different. Admittedly it is not the most hardcore puzzler, in terms of difficulty, but the atmosphere more than makes up for it. In conclusion, if you want to play a 2 player cooperative game there is currently nothing better on the market.

author: BunseyBunney
review: An absolute masterpiece! There are so many great things about this game but first off I want to start with my favourite part of the game which was the stunning environment design. Each level is so creative and immersive and it is so cool to see such detailed areas inspired by other environments in the game, the exaggerated world and all its quirks made exploring super fun! Combined with all the hidden mini-games and interactions one could easily spend hours just gawking at the wonderful art and design! I was also consistently engaged with the world with each level's newly introduced game mechanics, having two or more new mechanics introduced new ways to interact with the world and each other. Having these systems made every part of the story feel so unique to itself but it was done so well that even with the amount of mechanical content we were introduced to it never once felt out of place in the game. I also loved how with each new ability we were given it seemed to build upon May and Cody's characters, giving us more of a glimpse into what kind of people they are, I played as May and my favourite abilities of hers was the 'DrillBazzer X2000' and her harmonic singing voice. At first I was skeptical about the games story-line as I'm not big on romance orientated games, especially marriages however once I was really immersed into the game and learnt more about the characters and got to see how they interacted and their personalities I basically fell completely in love (ha) with the game in almost every aspect. By the end I was rooting for them! The story was so fulfilling and enriching, as long as you have a buddy to play with, I couldn't recommended this game highly enough in words that can encapsulate my playing experience.

author: Den modiga brödrosten
review: Some of the most fun I've had with a new game in recent memory. It just has it all to make every hour pass by like nothing. Story, puzzles, platforming, action, teamwork and fun. Just some of the major parts of the game, which is stunning from every perspective I can think of. Really have no complaints at all.Platforming was extremely varied with a good amount of familiarity throughout the whole game. The way they made it all fit the theme of the levels made it feel very fluent and so easy to be drawn in. Only so many ways you can change up platforming, I thought. But this really just knocked it out of the park. I never even once felt bored or annoyed at it, as it was seamlessly integrated with the beautiful environments. Works well for both experienced and casual gamers alike. Even the open sections were always fun and interactive so walking somewhere never felt like anything but an enjoyment. As well as that they still were easy to navigate and find your way forward. The game really gave just the perfect amount of hand-holding for you to feel in control, but have something to follow while playing through. The puzzles were spot on between fun and rewarding, as never did we get stuck on anything for more than a minute or two. And looking around, it often made it quite clear. The game kept this nice and even level of difficulty in all regards throughout the whole game, which never made it become an annoyance. So works perfectly if you want to have a fun and casual game together.So all in all, for sure one of the most fun platforming/puzzle games I've played in a long time due to such a balanced feel from minute one until the very end. Adore this game.

author: High_Adjudicator
review: A clever mix of mechanics that do an excellent job of requiring the players to work together without making one feel inferior to the other or allowing one player to carry the other through challenges. You naturally end up cheering for each other to complete your respective challenges. Great game for couples. Though I will say that the cut scenes all feel like we are being forced to go through the couples and/or parent-child therapy of the writers. Could be a fun party game if you could skip the depressing cut scenes.

author: kendallsucks4611
review: Very good game. I bought it when it was on sale, didn't expect it to be so long. I expected some 5 hour game that'll be fun to play with a friend... It is so much more than that. It is full of adventure and is truly a love story. Some scenes in this... man. Some scenes in this are so good, beautiful, even I wish I could be there. But first I would have to get married and have a kid then fight and divorce and have her cry on her wooden and clay dolls then be turned into those dolls. Quite frankly that is too much work, so the creators of the game made it possible! There are so many huge and small details that you can tell took a lot of work. I love seeing them to the fullest. This is truly an amazing game, well done.

author: bonkus donkus
review: On the whole, It Takes Two is a fantastic co-op experience, and one that's rich in diversity with a seemingly endless list of mechanical and stylistic approaches to different sections of the game. There's 3D platforming, 2D platforming, chase sequences, stealth sections, rhythm games, racing sections, incredible boss fights, unique puzzles, and more - and almost all of these different approaches tie into the theme and setting of the individual levels incredibly well, while also being polished, fun, and constantly reliant on cooperative gameplay.The plethora of movement and combat mechanics keeps the main game exciting. The minigames are lots of fun too, and the pacing between the main story and this side content makes for a great juxtaposition between cooperation and competition. And the top-notch atmosphere had me hooked for most of the game - the various detailed environments with unique character and enemy designs (plus great voice acting) gave off the same fantastical, cinematic vibe that a Pixar movie would.Not every section of It Takes Two is equally enthralling - the final level in particular felt a bit disjointed, with less polished controls and a pretty abrupt ending that I personally didn't think was all that satisfying. That being said, the majority of the game blew me away, and the atmosphere, polish, creativity, and variety of It Takes Two makes it an easy recommend from me. 9/10

author: Dark Angel Purring
review: This game was brilliant! I have been wanting to play it for so long, but my partner was a little against the idea as it is a puzzle game. At the end of the day he bought it for me as a gift and it was everything I hoped it would be and much much "mucho" more. Not only did we play for hours on end, complementing each other as we go, but somehow our communication while gaming also improved. This game is really one of the best I have played in a very long time and I take my hat off to the creators, animators and the character designers. Screw it, the whole team! Well done! It was a little challenging, but easy enough to survive the next time and was very engaging. Would definitely play it again!!From: Hawke, my partner, since he could not leave a review on the free version.It Takes Two. Its in the title - and don't be fooled into thinking this is simply a game. This is an epic! The gameplay is smooth, creative, fun, interactve and a balls-to-the-wall coordination extraordinaire. Be sure to play with someone with patience, skill and who is entirely in sync with you. It'll bring you closer to them and will leave you shooting compliments at each other before you realize it.10/10. Perfect score. Absolutely brilliant!

author: jazzeh
review: Very Solid ExperienceI had received the game as a gift for christmas (it had been on my wishlist) so I got to play the game with a friend (it was awesome that only one person needs to buy the game for the other to play it). Game itself is a solid 15 - 20 hour experience, and perhaps more depending on how much of the side-content you do. Definitely a game built for couples but also very rewarding for just two friends. Very impressive visuals and sound design and a lot of emphasis on the small details in each environment of the game, of which there are many (snowy, musical, garden, etc). Some of the scenes could be banger wallpapers on their own. Game is a very teachable experience with great nuggets of wisdom for helping relationships and a great set of memorable characters and mini games, including races, arcade games, and even chess. Highly Recommend

author: Virtuality
review: Had a wonderful time playing this game with my partner and close friends! Such an emotional story and such a wide variety of game play mechanics from dungeon-crawlers to fp-shooters and the combat styles aren't so difficult that it's frustrating but technical enough to put some effort in and resolve a technique with whoever you're playing with. For Approximately 15 hours of game play. With 25 fun mini games and a wide-selection of game mechanics and detailed understanding of a story-line, there are plenty of secrets to find and cute-little set-ups that make players actively look around for the cute, little features. With a sometimes abrasive, gory touch it is an amazing game 10/10.

author: zCody
review: Genuinely one of the best games I've ever played.The main concept might sound boring at first but as you play you'll slowly realize what a beautiful game it actually is. The way this whole game was made and the amount of creativity that was in this, is literally mind blowing. Halfway through this game you will find out more about them and from that point on you won't even dare to stop because it's not repetitive gameplay. The amount of switches in the gameplay style is one of the things that made me still play it. I get it that it was quite boring at first but please if you have the game and didn't make it through the first part - It's so worth it. Even the length of this game is well optimized. I played this in 14,5 hours and was taking my sweet time exploring the area too - meaning you don't have to waste tons of hours just to finish a story game. If you do not like story games that are boring because they have no large variety of things you can interact with - THIS IS THE EXACT OPPOSITE. The amount of details you could explore was incredible - interacting with things you didn't imagine you could is the exciting part aside from the main tasks. Since it's a 2-Player game, makes it even more fun and engaging. Just goofing around exploring the small details is part of the experience, this will sort of automatically give you the urge to take your time and not rush the storyline. This game was an emotional rollercoaster, sometimes you screech because of how cute it is and a few seconds later you're almost crying. One thing I really like about this game, is that you know it is gonna happen but you will still be shocked after it happened, because of the teensy tinsy hope that it doesn't happen. It's the small short voicelines that made me sob. You can see the relationship of the two sort of evolving but not fast at all. The progress of the two realising everything around them that just screams couple goals. Seeing the two carefully warm up to each other after the challenges or when they're just walking around interacting with random objects is one of the best feelings, especially near end game you can 100% notice it. The producers of this game have done a great job and outdid themselves definetely. The fact that you play it with a friend with only one person spending the money for the actual game is THE greatest feature, I've ever seen. In the end I will say that this is THE best 40 bucks I've ever spent on a video game and please do buy it if you have a friend you can play it with. AND if you do play it, please don't rush trust me the exploring is a huge part of the experience.Oh yeah I still dislike that book with those fake ahh eyebrows. - Creds to him tho for fixing the relationship in the oddest way

author: DragonPlush
review: This game is beautiful and the attention to detail on the character models, textures and overall environment is outstanding. Little interactive items around the levels; discovering that each and everything has a personality really brings the whole concept to life. The "abilities" that you and your co-op partner receive feel equal and nobody is the side kick when it comes to the puzzles. Playing this game with your significant other/ best friend has to be the most fun! It's quite therapeutic sometimes to intentionally kill them. Overall Great game, just over half way through at the moment myself.Definitely recommend no matter what type of gamer you are.

author: Sajid
review: A few months ago, I met this girl that I liked a lot. And I invited her to play this with me and hoped that she would take a hint. She agreed to play. A few days later, I actually told her I liked her and after talking about it for a few days, we started dating. We took our time progressing this game instead of rushing it. But today I finally completed it with my girlfriend. We loved playing it together and we had lots of fun and memorable moments in the game.I've been playing video games for almost 25 years now. And I have never seen a co-op experience executed so perfectly. I absolutely RECOMMEND this game to anyone who enjoys playing co-op games, if you have someone you can play with - it doesn't have to be your partner or someone you are romantically interested in. You can play this game with pretty much anyone as long as you enjoy their company.Story:The story follows Cody and May, a couple on the brink of divorce which makes their daughter upset and she asks the "Book of Love" to help fix their relationship. Suddenly the couple get turned into dolls and the Book of Love guides them on their path to returning to their real bodies and fixing their relationship in the process. The story is decently paced. It sometimes felt a bit slow to develop but it's not really much of a bother.Visuals:The visuals are absolutely stunning. Every single scene in this game is breathtaking and beautiful to see. You will often find yourself just pausing and appreciating the view and looking at all the minor details they put into the game.Gameplay:Fresh and creative. Every single chapter of the game brings in new mechanics and fun elements to the game. You get new abilities and so the game never feels stale or boring. The devs really went crazy on the gameplay making it fun and exciting at almost every moment of the game. There are countless elements in the game's world that have literally nothing to do with progressing the game but they are just there to make it fun. You can take a break from progressing the story play a mini-game you find lying around. And I believe that's how the game should be played - Just enjoy the experience without worrying about reaching the end.Co-Op:It Takes Two. You will need to work together with your partner for every part of this game. It's all about COLL-ABOR-ATION. You can't do anything in this game without working as a team. And that's how co-op games should be. You might even become closer with your partner because of how much trust you will need to put in each other.Overall:Loved it. The game felt fresh from the start to the end. The character development was nice especially towards the end. I think the Hazelight Studio really outdid themselves with this one. If you have a person who is special to you - lover, sibling, parent, or even your best friend - You will most likely love this game. My personal suggestion would be to play the game for the experience and enjoying all the small details instead of rushing to the end.

review: Great gameplay and graphics, showcasing so many different game genres in an accessible way. It was a great experience with my wife who haven´t played many games before, especially with a controller. However, some of the platforming sequences are on  the harder side for someone just learning to controll a character and camera at the same time, as some reviewers have noted. author: purplelove
review: I just finished playing this game with my bf. We were blown away. The CO-LAB-OR-ATION required for this game was beautifully played out in the many different levels. The creators said you are going to work together or not at all. Between the GORGEOUS art and design, the attention to detail, and lovely story this game captivates its players leaving a desire for more. The nods to other nostalgia inducing games and mini games peppered through out the chapters makes you feel like a kid again playing games with friends. Several times in our play through we would exclaim how this game DESERVED its 2021 Game of the Year award. I cannot wait to see what this team puts out next and in the meantime we will replay this game again and again.

author: Gurt
review: As a platformer, It Takes Two's mechanics are simple but very polished. For most platformers that would be a neg, but this game works for a co-op experience because of that. The people in my life that I'd want to share this with aren't always gamers. The story itself never blew my mind but despite that, I always felt a connection to the writers and their characters. Soni Jorgensen and Josef Fares are said writers and I feel the depth of a lived life in the way their game scenarios describe love. I don't always agree with the minutiae presented here but I do agree with the overarching message. Love doesn't emerge by existing in the same space but instead by building something together within that proximity. In that way, I feel a co-op game is the perfect facsimile of that journey. Me like game. Give thumb up.

author: McMurphy Man

author: Hunter
review: I've been meaning to play this game for a while and a friend recently reminded me of it and we gave it go. It is quite literally one of the greatest games I've ever played. It had a fantastic story, the controls were very smooth and there was so much that you could do. Every aspect and level of the game just blew me away. Definitely a 10/10, would recommend.

author: Pavel Dyatlov
review: It Takes Two is a truly exceptional game that offers an unparalleled experience for couples. The cooperative gameplay, imaginative world, and emotionally impactful story all come together to create an unforgettable journey.Not only is the game visually stunning, but the puzzle design is nothing short of genius. The challenges require teamwork, communication, and problem-solving skills, making it the perfect activity for couples to enjoy together. The puzzles are intuitive and allow for creative solutions, providing a sense of satisfaction when completed.The story of a couple working through their relationship issues while navigating a magical world is a truly special aspect of the game. It highlights the importance of communication and empathy, which are essential components of any healthy relationship.Playing games like It Takes Two is a great way for couples to bond and have fun together. It provides a shared experience and an opportunity to work together towards a common goal. It's a chance to put aside distractions and focus on each other, creating a deeper connection and strengthening the bond between partners.In conclusion, It Takes Two is a must-play game for couples who are looking for a unique, enjoyable, and meaningful experience. It's a game that will stay with players long after the journey is over, leaving a lasting impact on their relationship.

author: pet mouse
review: This is one of my favorite games in my library because its an experience I get to share with my girlfriend. The storyline has great lessons in making a relationship work, and it's good to be reminded every once in a while. There is great scenery and some great characters along the way. The story is also very long in a good way. There are multiple times I thought it would be over but there is more great gameplay waiting for you. Speaking of gameplay, there is plenty of variety of gameplay styles across all genres making it a great game to introduce your partner to video games. This game is more than worth it even at full price.

Mini-games opcionais interessantes, momentos maravilhosos... e talvez até de quebrar o coração... sim... aquela fase..., Mapas detalhados e lindos... e a experiencia de jogar com alguém que você se importa.Eu tive a oportunidade de jogar ele com a melhor pessoa que eu já conheci em toda minha vida, e foi a melhor experiência que eu poderia querer...  é um jogo incrível, com uma historia boa e momentos ainda melhores.É com certeza um dos melhores jogos COOP já criados e eu recomendo bastante, se tiver a oportunidade de jogar com alguém, jogue... você não irá se arrepender... review: 10/10. Playing with my girlfriend who barely has any videogame experience and we're having such a blast. I've played many, many games throughout my lifetime but no game has ever shown a combination of all the great qualities listed below:- Varied scenery/backgrounds- Gameplay mechanics- Small fun features that have no actual benefit to progressing through the gameplay, just features to entertain the player- Minor details- I have to re-emphasize this point: gameplay mechanics! Holy *** the game just keeps giving and giving.Currently 17hours in at the time of writing this and I am dreading the moment of completing it. We're having so much fun! Probably the best game I ever played and hands down the most fun co-op game I ever played. And yes I played Portal 2. Can recommend this game to anyone considering buying this! And remember, only one of you needs to actually buy it, your partner can play with you by using the game pass.

author: DatFrogKurtis
review: The gameplay, design, creativity, and environment were all excellent but even so I had a hard time giving this game a positive review. Why? Because the main characters are complete psychopaths! They have no concept of mercy, or kindness their instinctual response to any sort of adversity is murder and destruction. Their bloodlust is such that they are willing to torturously murder innocent creatures begging for their own lives.Regarding characters that they didnt brutally murder, for a game about fixing a relationship the characters are incredibly cavalier about the mental health and emotional well being of any other characters in the game including  their own daughter. At the start of the game the characters were unpleasant, however you expect that to moderate or change through the story on their path to reconciliation, but they dont get better, if anything they get worse. About half way through the game there is a scene which made one of my friends quit and refuse to continue playing, and while I continued through to the end, my sympathy for the characters was completely erased.Other than that, the game was great! The environments were very detailed and beautiful, the gameplay was innovative and the incorporation of various household objects as platforming or environmental puzzles was refreshingly creative.

author: Darkwolfhellhound

I played this game with my brother since we haven't had a decent couch co-op game in so many years and I can honestly say this game is up there in one of our favorites. I cannot tell you the number of smiles, fist bumps, knowing glances and laughs we had playing this truly beautiful game. Truly this is worthy of playing and worth praise. I hope you guys make more games like this in the future. From both of us - we needed this game and it warmed our hearts and made us smile. Thank you. PS: that book is our fav - Co-llab-or-ation!

author: GodspeedRos
review: Without a doubt one of the best video games -- and I use the term "video games" very specifically here -- that I have ever played. Plus, I experienced it with the one person in this world that I love more than any other. There's no other way to rate it than simply fantastic. And I'm willing to go into detail! author: Reflexion
review: Absolutely fantastic.  I played through the entire story with my boyfriend, and was stunned at the level of design and care poured into this creation.  First off, the story is much more nuanced than I was expecting, and took several unexpected and deeply emotional turns throughout the game.  It was very meaningful to play through this as a couple and see how the characters interacted, both in dialogue and behavior as their dynamic emerged throughout the story.  I was expecting a throwaway story to move me from one puzzle to the next, but as the story played out I found myself invested in the characters, cheering them on just as much as that rage-inducing book did at each new chapter.Next, the puzzles!  Incredible.  No two were the same, and each was well designed so that each character felt just as necessary as the other, but also just as useless WITHOUT the other.  Despite knowing the story, I am looking forward to playing through again from the other perspective, because each puzzle is wildly different based on the character selected.  In a way, I was almost disappointed in the ending, purely because it meant there would be no more awesome exploration and cool problem solving.And speaking of exploration, this game looks absolutely gorgeous.  My boyfriend and I spent probably just as much time wandering around looking at stuff as we did actually playing the game.  Each level is beautifully designed and a visual feast, and once again I was disappointed when I had to leave because I had so much fun in each area.  During our explorations we found countless easter eggs, funny mini-games and just neat stuff, so it never felt like wasted time.Do you have a significant other?  Buy this game and play it with them.  Do you have a friend?  Buy this game and play it with them.  Do you not have friends?  Get one so they can too experience this game with you!  This will always remain one of the best games, and certainly the best coop game I have ever played.  Enjoy your CO-LLAB-O-RA-TION!

author: Nim
review: Utterly beautiful. The greatest co-op experience since Portal 2. This genre-bending platformer lets you take on a series of episodic adventures, each with a completely different tone and gameplay mechanics. In an unusual premise for a game - you and your co-op partner play as a married couple about to divorce. Early on you meet a creepy, vaguely foreign sounding anthropomorphised talking book "The Book of Love" who introduces you to a wide range of odd characters and props that change how you play the game. The controls are simple and intuitive throughout the game and the puzzles/battles you encounter are clever and unique. It is funny. It is beautiful. It regularly hands out emotional gut punches. It's neither very difficult nor very long. It is absolutely one of the best games of 2021 and one of the best co-op games of all time.

author: Failed to Load
review: This is one of the best co-operative gaming experiences that I have had in a long time. The art direction was incredible, it was positively dripping with wholesome and heartfelt moments, coupled with challenging and fun puzzles through out. The versus mini-games were a huge bonus and a nice change of pace. I was amazed at how often the game play mechanics switched up through out and never overstayed their welcome.

author: water
review: This is probably hands down my favorite game ever!!! If you're thinking about getting it and are on the fence, just DO IT. You won't regret it.The CAPTIVATING art, the GRIPPING story, the HUMOR, and the FUN and SPONTANEOUS mini-games created such an incredibly immersive experience. There are just too many favorite moments to choose from. My partner and I kept constantly screenshotting the game because it was so fun and beautiful, and gives you tons of fun moments to express yourselves and have fun outside of the actual story. I WILL SAY that it can be quite challenging at times and require some epic gaming skills, but nothing some good old fashioned TEAMWORK can't solve! It's co-op for a reason. Dr.Hakim is the best book/therapist/coach ever. Rose is the sweetest. This game has created such beautiful memories for us, I honestly wish it never ended or that we get a second game, or can replay in our human forms. I can't imagine how many relationships it helped. :POverall I'd rate this a million out of 10. You don't need a book of love to tell you that you'll absolutely be charmed by this delightful game. BEST GAME. GO GET IT. <3

author: DraxLord
review: This was one of the best games we've ever played. Everything, from game design to puzzle mechanics to music was so immersive and entertaining, you can tell there was so much love and care put into the story. 15 hours of gameplay and we never got bored of any of the mechanics, just more wonder every chapter we played. The pay off at the end of the game was absolutely worth it.Not only is the story so well written, there is a lot of replay-ability with the numerous minigames added to it. We found ourselves coming back to the game repeatedly to explore past chapters, play the minigames and just goof around with all the small details and fun little easter eggs hidden around. And we both wanted to punch and thank that book consistently throughout the game. Honestly, we found nothing that we could ever complain about with this game. Pure masterpiece.

Varying difficulty of puzzles and equal share of trouble spots between the two characters make this game a very good nightly entertainment for about a week depending on how often you play. Not to mention the mini games scattered throughout that can give you a break from the problem solving and put some competition into the game. Overall, a wonderful find, 8/10 would play again.Girlfriend rates this a 1000/10.

author: Irisirl
review: It Takes Two is a magnificent work of art, and an example of what the videogame medium can achieve when heart and soul is poured into its creation. I’ve never been a fan of platformers or split screen video games for that matter, and when my partner offered me to play I was very sceptical. However, I can safely say that after having finished the game alongside him, this experience has left such an impact I would consider this my favourite narrative game of all time.The game presents a simple narrative about a family going through a divorce and uses said narrative to draw parallels between the dynamics of a healthy relationship and the challenge of cooperative video games. Both players must be perfectly in sync and communicative to solve the many puzzles in It Takes Two. Talking of which, the challenges and puzzles in the game are all expertly crafted and designed. The sheer gameplay variety will have you in disbelief that you are still playing the same game. One moment you will be piloting a plane out of twigs shooting down turrets, another you will be in an isometric POV dungeon-crawler working in tandem to defeat bosses. Each area in the game contains its own progression and storyline, all relevant to the overall plot. With each area the players are also given a set of unique abilities they can use to interact with things specific to the environment. Something to note is these abilities are dependent on each other to be effective, further encouraging teamwork and communication between the players.The game can be quite challenging at points, and if like me you aren’t very good at platformers the game will force you to get good. However, never did I feel the game was unfair in its difficulty. If something was not working; I had the wrong approach or the wrong technique. The game also has a subtle way of teaching the players new mechanics by forcing them to experiment with the environment. There is a clear difficulty ramp throughout the game that made sense and made me feel engaged and challenged at all times. The sheer amount of ideas in this game just boggles the mind. It Takes Two is content-packed, with a solid runtime of around 15 hours. Tons of minigames and side areas to explore; ranging from simple doodle boards to fully fleshed out racing minigames. There are hours upon hours of fun to be had in this game.All of the action sequences gave me chills like no other game. Just when you think the game can’t possibly 1up itself, it will astonish you once again. The voice acting is on point, and the game knows the right balance between comedy and seriousness. It Takes Two has some wonderful writing that conveys lots of emotion. It will have you laughing, jaw-dropping in awe, coping with resentment and even spilling some tears. It's a transformative experience. An incredible journey that will see both players evolve and learn throughout. The art in It Takes Two is frankly some of the best in the industry without question. The environments are beautiful and every asset, every texture, every corner of its world so polished and well made that it’s hard to believe the game was only in development for two years. The music is also impeccable, with adaptive parts mixing together with the player’s actions leading up to climaxes of gargantuan proportion. This game wowed me repeatedly more than any before.I will close off this lengthy review by you how this game was an experience that I will remember my whole life. I had the privilege to play this with my partner, whom at the time of playing I have only been dating for a month. This game made us bond in such a beautiful way that its fictional narrative transcended to become a real learning experience. It brought us closer. Being able to share this outstanding experience with a loved one is an irreplaceable gift. It is without exaggeration that I say: It Takes Two is one of the best things to happen in my life.With that being said, I would like to personally thank the developers for pouring such heart and soul into this game. Thank you for granting the world this incredible work of art.It Takes Two is a monumental achievement in the history of digital media, and a true masterpiece.10/10

author: bottolo
review: There's no doubt that It Takes Two brings the cooperative play to a whole other level, proposing an extremely curated (both in animation and design) linear adventure instead of a soulless open-world game with cooperative elements, which seems to be the standard nowadays.And to think that Hazelight brought this kind of experience to life  seems like an achievement itself. There are many things to talk about, but before diving into it I'll start by saying that I liked the game and I would definitely recommend it, even though there are some things which I would like to tackle along the way. So if you're interested in playing It Takes Two, then do so by all means! You and your friend or partner will surely have a good time. If you want to hear more, then buckle up.One of the things which caught my eye right from the start was the overall  around various levels. Everything feels alive, polished, interesting. There's always something around the corner which will grab your attention and there'll be plenty of times where the actual scale of things will make you appreciate how everything was made.So, environmentally, there's a lot to be excited about. You can clearly see that who created all of this was pretty inspired, technically speaking. In fact, levels feel smooth and balanced: not too long, but not too short either.  is the key, and you'll be traveling plenty of locations across your home. I didn't expect it to be so varied and it's safe to say that I was pleasantly surprised. The constant motion between different "biomes" is what makes the experience refreshing.There's really not much to say about It Takes Two's difficulty: it's really easy, and everyone can jump in and play. In fact, as a more experienced player, I would've liked a mode with more challenging mechanics, but they went the "simplest" route and made everything the easiest way.Needless to say, you'll be able to complete it smoothly and without dying all that much, and that's perfectly fine. Challenge wasn't the main concern here, it was more like a whole package deal for a cooperative title. Commands feel really nice too, I've always felt like I were in control of my characters' every fine movement. So, in synthesis: really easy, incredibly accessible to everyone, even to someone who doesn't play games at all. I've played on mouse and keyboard, while my partner on the pad. It's comfortable either way. You might've noticed I didn't quite talk about this game's plot or characters. Well, this is where things get a bit .I've learned to be quite judgemental of EA, since it's a rich company who really doesn't seem to care about integrity anymore and tends to follow the abruptly commercial way of paywalling even oxygen. But by publishing this game, I've got to give them credit for helping to bring this game to life. A curated, accessible game which proceeds very smoothly. The only things which I really  like were, unfortunately, the dialogues. It's almost as they've got the Disney treatment or something. Specifically, every line said by Cody and May was always accompanied by a feeling of embarassment and unnaturality. Pretty cringy. And that's a shame, since the game is so well made... It's similiar to what happened in BF2042. No one would speak in such manner: Cody and May are constantly pushing out expository dialogue for the sake of talking... and it shows, since it seems written by someone working at Disney or something.Another thing I've noticed for me is its lack of originality. Yes, the environments are really well made, but they pretty much sum up your average "toy room" ambiance or "space" ambiance. Everything, creatively, feels like something taken from an average movie. I wanted to see something more original, design wise. But, ultimately, enemies and animals were kinda underwhelming in their appearance. To put this in context, there's a reason why Alice Madness (which, quite comically, was published by EA) was a big success. You didn't expect that kind of art direction from an Alice in Wonderland game. But it did, and became instantly recognizable. Sure, here you have beautifully made landscapes and really curated environments, but ultimately they lack personality. I just wanted to share my thoughts, as this aspect is a big thing for me. But I've got to give credit where credit is due: Cody and May's designs are interesting and cute, and they're really recognizable. Everything else... not so much.The game is totally worth it. I wouldn't buy it full price, though. I feel like 15/20€ is a justifiable price for this product. As a matter of fact, it still is an AAA-ish title. Maybe we would've got a prettier story, if it wasn't published by EA. Who knows.Until then... recommended. : :

review: This game is extremely fun. It is very intuitive and it revolves around teamwork puzzles that are easy enough to understand quickly, but not so easy that you don't find it challenging or satisfying when you do solve them. There are also minigames scattered accross the game that are separate from the storyline and that make you face off with your partner one on one, those are also very fun. The story is very sweet, and the cozy feeling that the game gives you through its gameplay is superb. Would recommend 10/10

author: Punik
review: Tahle hra je, odezírej mi ze rtů NA-PRO-STO BOŽÍ! Negativa?Musíš to hrát ve dvou. Té celý. Doporučuju to hrát se svým dítětem, nebo se svou přítelkyní / manželkou. Já to hrál s prckem, 9 let, naprostá bomba. Co zažiješ? Naprosto epickou cestu, sbližování dvou partnerů, kteří se na začátku nenavídí, v prostřed nemají rádi a nakonec... Páč spolu prožijete pekelnou dřinu fakt propracovanýho koopu - se budete mít rádi. Hra trvá cca 15 hodin herního času, takže doporučuju plánovat, na každej den jednu část, budete se pak těšit na část další, a další... A můžu říct jedno. Viděl jsem koně blejt, žábu bít pěstí do země jak šílenej vrah a Babiše mluvit pravdu - ale tohle... Tohle je lepší než to všechno předtím. Naprosto geniální příběh, prostředí, ale i herní mechaniky... Takže jestli mohu něco doporučit, vůbec neřeš JESTLI tohle hrát, to je naprosto jasný. Řeš s KÝM to hrát, protože to bude společnej zážitek, epickejch rozměrů. Jo a jestli hulíš, tak si dej(te) brko před každým hraním, myslím že ten trip tě naprosto rozebere na součástky a pak znova poskládá, je to tak strašně milá hra, že milejší jsem snad ještě nehrál. Takže pokud to chceš hrát s partnerem/kou: 10 / 10S dítětem: 10 / 10Zkouřenej 11 / 10A bonus nakonec? V poslední fázi se pohybuješ mezi kazetama a kotoučákama - jestli jsi rodič, tak si to asi budeš pamatovat a je opravdu fenomenální, sledovat svý dítě, jak běhá po věcech, který netuší k čemu jsou a na kterejch tys nechal(a) mládí. :D Takže podtrženo sečteno: Trip tvýho života, kupuj, hraj, užívej - tohle je TEN z klenotů, na který budeš dosmrti vzpomínat v dobrým. ❤

author: Captain Virendar Putin
review: Short Review : 10/10 whole heartedly recommended, Every human should experience this masterpiece atleast once in their lifeLong Review : My friend invited me on Friend's Pass and just after an hour of gameplay, I quickly launched the store and purchased a copy for myself to support the studio for such a marvelous experience. The Mission Design, variety in gameplay, the uniqueness in every location just blew my mind. Every level there was something unique around the world whoch you could interact in a peculiar with your new unique abilities granted every level. Nothing feels repeated, every second of the game showed a new world, new experience, new enemies, new bosses. Storyline was also pretty neat and sophisticated. We never sideline from our end goal despite exeriencing a unique journey. Such lovely experience and created with utmost tenderness. Kid's toys coming alive, playing with toys itself, fantasy world elements, distopian universe...If you finish the game using only 1 character, you can experience the whole journey in an entirely different experience from other character. 2 playthroughs will give you full experience the game has to offer.This game is for all : husband/wife, bf/gf, brother/brother. Extreme co-LL-AA-BB-oration xDDDDD.

author: Prisoner 24601
review: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed this game, which was recommended to us by her mom. Had she not given it such high praise, we likely never would have given this game a chance, and that would have been a huge loss. I'm not much of a review writer, and although I often play more competitive/hardcore games, this title alone is reason enough to consider expanding the genres that I usually gravitate towards.If you have a significant other, consider picking this game up and playing it all the way through with them (I say that because we first played through the first boss fight and them dropped it for a few months after moving house, but we are both grateful that we gave it another chance and played through the rest of the game at a casual pace within a week's time). Had no issues running it on a laptop GTX 1070 and Steam Big Picture makes playing with any two gamepads of your preference a breeze.

author: Jeremiah G
review: The graphics, animation, story, levels, gameplay, and diversity of game mechanics were astounding. Pretty much everything about this game was almost perfect. Additionally, the creators of the game stuck to the story without adding woke BS into it like almost all modern AAA games do, which makes this game even better.I would give this game a perfect 10/10, but I played the game with a PlayStation 5 controller, but the game gave me Xbox controller prompts, which is stupid. The game should either allow me to choose the prompts I want, or automatically detect the type of controller. Lastly, the game requires an Origin account, which is also stupid because it adds more complexity and takes longer before the game launches, when we just want to download and play the damn game. My overall rating is 9.5/10. If they fixed those two issues, I would've rated it 10/10.SPOILERS AHEADA lot of people dislike the game because there is a scene where you slowly and brutally kill a very kind and innocent stuffed elephant named Cutie that belongs to your daughter in order to dance under her face while she cries on you. Personally, me and my friend liked this scene because it was just so humorously ridiculous and f**ked up.

review: Has got to be one of the best Co-op games I have ever played. Myself and Player Two were highly surprised at how much fun we were having on our play through, can not recommend it enough.

I definitely recommend playing it :)The ending was okay but it felt like something was missing. I hope they add additional content! The game takes about 10 to 15 hours to complete. I played it in several 2 hour sessions. If the higher price bothers you, just be aware that there was a lot of time and effort put into this game. There are also frequent sales. I bought it for $31.06 CAD back in January and it was certainly worth it. Everyone that helped create this game did an excellent job.

review: This game, is fantastic, great character development and leaves you not wanting to stop playing so you can see what happens next. review: Fantastic game! Definitely my favourite multiplayer I have played. With new areas to explore, little activities to discover and fresh mechanics to learn every chapter, It Takes Two never felt boring. The story was also fantastic and lent to the game play wonderfully. 10/10 would recommend to friends and couples alike!

author: Dolphin_Splash
review: Wow. All I can say is wow. "It Takes Two" is an incredibly immersive and overall beautiful game in every aspect - from the graphics, to the dialogue, to the soundtrack. Every night for the past few months, I've looked forward to playing this game with my boyfriend of 2 years. We found that we could relate to Cody and May a lot, which made the game even more fun for us. Playing through this game was an experience that my boyfriend and I will always cherish. And as cheesy as Dr. Hakim was sometimes...Okay...All of the time...He served as a constant reminder for us that a happy & healthy relationship entails collaboration, passion, support, and challenges that come in all shapes and sizes, including little clay men and tiny wooden dolls.This game made me fall in love with love all over again, and is a universal reminder that even when love get rocky, "it takes two" to work through it.

author: jemsquash
review: I like that this game provides a unique co-op experience that allowed me to enjoy a game with someone who is inexperienced. However it does feel like things drag on a bit and I was honestly ready for it to be finished when I was just over halfway through. The gameplay begins to feel gimmicky especially when you have camera control ripped away from you and you have to try to discern which of the ant-sized characters on screen is you. I love the visual style and world design and the general movement and abilities felt good. Animation is great. My biggest problem with the game is that the story is weak and shallow and I don't actually like any of the characters. They're so astonishingly unlikable and you get to listen to them bicker and whine about each other for more than half of the game. By the time they start being nicer to each other, I had already had enough of them especially because of "that" part. There was no real remorse or self-reflection and their change from toxic to nice felt unnaturally abrupt. I can't help but feel like parts of the game that would have fleshed this relationship out were cut while what existed was padded to make it longer.I'm on the last level and I can't wait for it to be over with. It started out fun but at this point I'm over the gimmickry and horrible characters. I don't regret playing it because it gave me some fun co-op but the sad part about it is that I don't feel like I could repeat the experience with someone else. Once the puzzles are figured out, playing the other character doesn't really freshen the experience. Ultimately I do recommend the game because it was a bit of fun, but I would only give it a C+. It passes but not admirably.

author: Gle18
review: ~Spoiler Free Review~SPOILER ALERT FOR THE REVIEW - GAME IS AMAZING AND WORTHY OF THE GAME OF THE YEAR AWARD IN 2021 - ABSOLUTELY WORTH THE BUY :)Ok, now to justify this verdict without spoilers.Gameplay - Someone told me about gameplay loops being 30 seconds long and then you just repeat it over and over again with the same mechanics and all. I call that theory BS coz Josef Farez, the director of this game, came up with one of the most creative concepts, if not, the most creative concept of constantly switching the gameplay within the game to keep us more and more hooked on to the game. You can't stop playing it once you've started, that's how good this game is. If I were to put this game up in a list of best video games, yes! It is on par with Witcher 3 (coz 1 its GOTY and 2 It's pretty good and worth your money).But wait! There is one thing that makes this game stand out apart from innovative gameplay.. and that is the price. Yea the game is kinda expensive, BUT, with proper planning, you can easily get the game at 60% off on steam sales (maybe the max would be going down to 75%), WAIT I'M NOT DONE YET! Only 1 Person has to buy the game! You see this! One guy buys the game, and he can host the session. The other player can join the game either online or play with the player locally. In this day and age, where there are greedy developers like Ubisoft and EA who feed off of microtransactions, this is an absolutely amazing thing. One player buys the game only and can play with pretty much anyone who has the friend's pass.Story - No spoilers, but the general gist is - Cody (Player 1) and May (Player 2) are married and they want a divorce, which upsets their (or your, if you consider being in the moment), and she basically cries on a bunch of dolls which causes y'all to like become them and play the game to save your marriage. Pretty cool concept. The ending, was kinda, not that great, but it is good. It's in no way bad, not even close to good, but I feel that the devs could have like, put in a teeny tiny bit of work in the ending and it would be better, but hey, I'm no professional, so take this with a grain of salt. Great Story!Graphics - IT IS BEAUTIFUL and kind of heavy on certain PCs. As long as you have anything past a 1050ti, you are good to go. Optimization - Ok, I hate to trash on the optimization but it's not that good. There is just lag in too many areas which me and my friend had experienced, and he had a better PC than my laptop. Optimization would be that one thing that needs to be really good in video games else, it will be the worst possible game ever. Thank god, this game is not horrible in terms of optimization. But it isn't great either. It's decent - like maybe 6 or 7 out of 10 in terms of optimization.Co op element - My friend is gonna agree on this statement 101% - C O L L A B O R A T I O N. It takes two, remember? ;) See what the devs did there? XD I bet the devs were - Hmmm, how do we make the player not wander away from the other player and play a tiny bit solo? And Josef Farez or someone else, just comes up and says, IT TAKES TWO REMEMBER? Make every single puzzle co op - There is no one finishing this game solo without a second player, and my oh my, this game was worth it! Hats off to the dev team! Oh and there are mini games (25 of them) to find in the world, to play with your friend :)Level Design - ABSOLUTELY TERRIFIC!!!Music - Amazing T_TBugs - NopFinal Verdict - 9.5/10 - AMAZING - BUY BUY BUY BUY BUY BUY (For that one player who wants to host the game, only he has to buy, the other person plays via friend pass) ABSOLUTELY WORTH THE MONEY

author: tramphoeline
review: It's a great game with a lot of challenges and extremely beautiful environments. A lot of the time was spent admiring details and its creativity. One of the best aspects of this game was the fact that you HAD to work together to get ahead, making the effort a shared experience. In terms of game play and enjoyment, it is a 10/10. Fun, interactive, challenging without the overly frustrating feeling of failure, I'd recommend it to anyone. The best part is that you can play this game with someone who doesn't own the game, making it inexpensive if you're buying it at the right time (bought it for $23).If you want to nitpick at details, I'd say that the main characters are annoying and there is no major character development. I would have liked for there to be a two-ending option and maybe a deeper dive into why the divorce is happening other than May being away from home for work and Cody being a SAHD who likes to do fun stuff but is more than happy to let appointments and actual parenting needs slide. Genuinely think the ending needed a negative outcome or at the very least a different perspective on the fact that sometimes divorce is not the worst option on the planet which is what the storyline was preaching. Two approaches to the story would have made it 10x better. The book is also annoying, but again, this is nit-picking, it doesn't really change the fact that the game itself is amazing.The elephant scene was traumatizing. I loved it.

author: Pandariah99
review: This game covers some heavy topics based around making relationships work and also not losing yourself while balancing everything else, while you pretty consistently either destroy things or murder them for no real reason. Your child is going through constant internal turmoil and struggle while her parents lay comatose and ignore her. The good news is while she suffers you get to have fun doing things like; have snowball fights, ride various animals, play rhythm games, and more that you could spend forever doing. Forget your kid AND marriage at this point just play in paint forever. Very good game that has a variety of things to do and different approaches which saves you from monotony. The characters are fun and even the side characters have personalities. Plus, who doesn't enjoy saying "what are you doing?" to someone you're playing with while you watch them fall into a pit for the 74th time? Overall highly recommend especially with a loved one, it's a good bonding experience.

author: SSSSEANNN
review: Hands down the best couch co-op game I have ever played- and I've played countless hours of Splinter Cell: Chaos Theory with my dad!It Takes Two starts off with a clunky animation about divorce, but turns into one of the most delightful variety games I've ever enjoyed. Every stress inducing level or puzzle is met with an intermezzo mini-game wherein the two players can blow off steam by beating the ♥♥♥♥ out of one another. Level design and control schemes change so frequently, and the pacing of the levels is just right. A unique game for our time and I think it sets the bar for what we as gamers deserve from co-op titles.

Different mechanics at different parts of the game and non overstay their welcome and become boring so far. The story is a little cheesy but the game play more than makes up for it. Hope more games are made like this in the future. I think its worth full price but I was lucky to catch it on sale. So far have spent a weekend playing it with the SO and we've both had a blast despite the occasional sync glitch here and there. Would buy a sequel or similar game in the future.

author: Kunzite
review: A must for anyone looking for a heavily cooperative game to play with a close friend or partner :)Gorgeous visuals and an outstanding story!We spent way more time than necessary in multiple locations just to replay the 25 "collectable" more competitive mini-games.The only game I've play where I've felt excitement for cutscenes, out of all things.I just adore the story, it was so heartwarming watching May and Cody rebuild their fallen relationship together.It Takes Two contains platforming, puzzles, PVE combat, lots and LOTS of interactables, competitive mini-games, lovable characters and super fun little hub areas for each chapter :)With steam remote play being mostly a wildcard on whether it'll have delay or not, EA servers were our best bet. EA servers SUCK. We got disconnected multiple times throughout the game, making us have to go through different parts a couple times (luckily the game autosaves rather frequently!).We even experienced an issue where the game server would crash right after hitting an objective, thankfully this fixed itself after a few days. Above issues are NOT for the game itself, these are with EA servers. With multiple puzzles requiring quick cooperative actions, we were not willing to even attempt remote play in case of delay.

review: It takes two is probably the most bang for your buck. I played with my girlfriend and we completed the game over a week. The game aspires to touch both a great story and gameplay. It really doesnt leave a spot of game mechanics out. One mission you'll be fighting a giant squirrel in streetfighter combat, and then racing down rainbow road. It greets you with an actual real world problem and turned it into a comedic and lesson-filled game that for me had a 16$ price tag (not to mention you can invite and play with your friend for free). I think more AAA game titles should aspire to be how great this game was. The game not only offers all this but the replay ability in the form of gamemodes and online play. I would recommend this to anyone with a friend, i would recommend 5/5.

author: Asian Smurf
review: Sometimes EA can develop absolute gems like this. It Takes Two is Hazelight's take on the long-gone multiplayer story-based game that utilizes co-op. A pretty good couch play on-the-go during weekends. There are a lot of variety in It Takes Two as the story branches through a lot of chapters and It covers the strained relation between 2 couples and them reconciling due to the daughter's request. It's a really heartwarming and simple story but there's so much more behind it. This game really relies a lot on co-operation as almost everything takes two people like the title said. The game is beautiful and not very graphic intensive so people can play on a potato. It is really well optimized surprisingly. I read up somewhere that EA only gave it a 5 million dollar budget which is quite low with such a beautiful quality game produced as a result which shows that great games don't take a lot of budget. It's really worth a mention that the game not only has the main aspects but also loads of minigames around the map to explore and find. There are also a lot of interactive elements that can suck up your weekends like a vacuum cleaner. Overall It's probably one of if not the best multiplayer games in recent years. A solid 9.8/10. It's also notable that the developers give out a ' Friends Pass' For friends so only 1 person has to own the game to enjoy the full game. It's absolutely one of if not EA's best games as it's not tainted by micro-transactions. A really great game for what it really is. It's always on sale too which is a steal if you get it for like 60% off.

author: Onion
review: This game is very good. Play this ♥♥♥♥ right now. Buy it, beat it in a week with EA Play, whatever. Comparable to Portal 2 Co-op in goofiness and hijinks, but like 4 times longer. Pretty much anyone can pick this up and play it, and only one person needs to own the game, with the other person being able to download a version for free just to play with you. And hell, if their pc cant run it you can use steam remote play to run it off your pc. They also managed to throw in a story about appreciating family in there somehow, and then actually made it good. Play this game.

author: WhyKevin?
review: While it's expected, it still managed to surprise me that this is a really great game. It manage to take collaboration between two players to the next level with such unique gameplay mechanic. I thought it would be your usual casual adventure game where you have to travel with your friend yadda yadda, but no, there are so much more in this. It has good plot, comical lines, awesome character designs (especially ), gorgeous world designs, various entertaining minigames, and so many hidden easter eggs! The way they forced us to collaborate with our partner is really fun too (well, sometimes tad bit frustrating but tis what a game is!). Highly recommend this for those who want to play with a friend. A great friendship building game BUT not exactly suitable for kids I guess ().

review: Beautiful game. Amazing level and sound design. Playing the game felt like playing 20 other games because every level is so different from each other & has references to other generes and popular culture. Platformer, shooter, MMO, puzzle, you can find everything here, and it all mixes so well.  Astonishing visuals, great sound, everything was truly amazing, for a co-op game this one is very well made.

author: Poppy
review: I played this game with my husband side-by-side throughout the whole thing, so I can't say much about connectivity issues that some people seem to be having, but in our specific context we had no technical issues whatsoever. In terms of the actual game, I want to echo what others have said saying this is the best co-op game they have ever played. It really is for us. My partner and I have tried some other games similar to this like A Way Out and this just blows everything out of the water. The art was great, gameplay was engaging and at the right difficulty level, and in terms of what it made us feel... it made us feel a lot, and with great intensity. We laughed, got angry at certain parts, really sad in others, but overall the game is the good kind of emotional roller coaster and it had been especially amplified by the feelings we had for the person we were playing with. Anyone who wants to feel feels with someone and have fun doing it should absolutely buy this game, even if it's not on sale. Looking forward to any sequels!

author: ₵ħoᶊmⱡϲ
review: I played this game with a friend of mine, and he didn't have to buy the game to play it with the Friend Pass. This already makes it a very wonderful game because that means that only one person needs to actually purchase the game, which is a huge bonus for a game that's uniquely a 2 player experience. The game isn't too very long, running in at about 13 hours of game play with some side distractions like mini-games and snowball fights, but it is a very emotional experience that will last a long time for those invested. For actual game play, each section features a completely different type of game. In one section, you're flying through the air on a bi-plane shooting down bees, and the next you're sneaking through a garden trying to avoid moles that are 3x your size. I absolutely have to recommend this game, even at the full price of $40, just due to the fact that you'll be receiving a product that was made with love and so much attention to detail that it's actually worth the price they put it up for. Overall a very wonderful experience that is going to stick with me and my friend for years.
