author: _c
review: Bought this game on a whim, and boy am I glad I did. This is, by far, the best gaming experience I've had in a very long time. Each level in the game has it's own unique theme and gameplay style. The environments are gorgeous and very polished. The sound is immersive and of course the story is interesting, yet easy to follow. I ran into one bug during the entire campaign (bugged out volley ball minigame near the end) that had no bearing on my ability to move progress. There are quite a few competitive minigames games throughout that offer a nice change of pace from the co-op grind. In terms of difficulty I'd say it's a great game for younger kids; the puzzles are pretty straight forward and a many interactions involve various forms of button mashing, however it is a platformer so you'll derive a lot of the challenge from that aspect alone.I don't think I've ever left a steam review before, but this game really impressed me and it's definitely a worthwhile purchase if you're on the fence. 10/10

author: Roy Nash
review: Undoubtely, It Takes Two is a co-op masterpiece as expected.Before It Takes Two, I played "A Way Out" from Hazelight Studios, this game just provided an awesome way of playing a co-op with the old fashion split-screen effect.It Takes Two and A Way Out are extremely diverse gameplay is held to such a high standards from the start to end. The visuals are amazing, priceless and well designed.The story itself is immersive and the sounds are memorable. The guys from Hazelight has proven it again that split screen can be used in modern gaming.Pros+ Detailed Visuals, Objects and environment+ Simple controls and easy to understand+ Lovely Minigames to have fun+ Good amount of hours are needed to finish the game completely+ Story Line is well done and realistic+ Realism from A Way Out and Mechanics of It Takes Two being the perfect matchCons- Aim Assist. I hate it, i more likely call it aimbot.- You can always respawn during boss fights, sort of god mode.- When u have 3rd part object like boat, the health doesn't decrease when u hit something such as walls

author: Ulurzi
review: It Takes Two has to be one of my favorite co-op games ever played and that's because it has a different kind of thinking its not just a logical puzzle game its not set with just one set of tools or power up its has multiple where you have to think outside the box sometimes and really play to your tools strengths. A nice feature is the friend pass because the game can be a bit pricey if your buying for two people so personally it was nice knowing the creators thought about the community and all. Something though that really drew me to this game was that the story starting off kinda lures you in to wanna know how this will end. you may think yeah this is just gonna be a make up scene at the end but that's not all that's so interesting the cut scenes throughout give a crazy adventure that you couldn't even imagine its unrealistic and absolutely wild. This game is full of colors and variety no lack in the team work department so definitely lives up to its reputation.

author: BobTheBox
review: This game is AMAZING.I can tell a lot of work went into this. It's absurd how many different mechanics this game has.At one point, you're throwing nails at walls, at another you're walking on walls and in the next you're shooting syrup everywhere.Every chapter has it's own mechanics and the 2 characters rarely share the same one. And let me tell you, there are A LOT of chapters. You're constantly introduced to whole new mechanics and have to use them to solve the puzzlies. Those puzzles can't just be beaten by 1 of your powers. It takes the 2 of you to beat them.The game is pretty, there are a lot of well designed puzzles and mechanics. The dialogue is entertaining and the game just feels very polished overall.It took me a little while to try out this game, because, quite frankly, I don't trust EA, but the game didn't seem to have suffered from their influence.

review: Cody: Game was amazing 10/10 would recommend. The boss battles were all balanced and were extremely fun to play. The parkour was difficult for my wife at times, so I had to carry her ass through some of it. The puzzle aspect of the game was just hard enough to be fun and rewarding when solved. Love the story, love the game, love the characters. `P.s love the wife, but still rekt her in the mini gamesMay: Admittedly, my wifi lagged out multiple times during boss battles and mid air (as it should i suppose) and at the best of times I died many many MANY times during simple jumps. BUT this was easily one of my favourite games and unique experiences I've had with a game. As someone who's not so well-versed in gaming and who stresses easily, this game was a nice balance between stress and fun. The characters, stories, levels, game mechanics and art were so breathtaking. You could see all the little love and details put into the game and there was a lot of emotions throughout the story. I highly HIGHLY recommend this game for anyone looking for a good time ;3 and a real bonding experience. I also appreciated beating him in the racing games multiple times :) 10/10. I can't wait to experience the replay <3

author: elementalAV
review: We love this CO OP only game . I play with my wife and she says it must be designed as couples therapy. Taking on serious grown up subject matter from a child like perspective. It has accessible game-play that does require some 3D platforming and aiming skills but mostly requires player teams to figure out the co op puzzle of how you pass each section. The levels are very imaginative and each one reveals a fun new team based game-play mechanic.    The visuals are great with specially impressive effects like the swarms of bees and other particle effects and surface shaders. We have yet to complete but it is definitely a recommended two player same screen experience especially if you have a special someone to play with .

author: Splinny
review: This game was so much fun to play with my bf, and you don't have to play with your significant other just because it's about a relationship, to enjoy this game. If you Ignore the story and just focus on the good voice acting, the pretty design, the intuitive movements and game mechanics, and it's mini games within the game it's so much fun. It not only has very original ideas for two player fun, it holds some of the nostalgic game logistics some of us grew up with like swinging from ropes/vines , rail grinding as if you were in a Donkey Kong mine kart or playing tony hawk lol. There were also things that felt like you could have playing Banjo Kazooie. I could go on, but between the old two player feels of N64 days....and the new ideas they implemented, this game is definitely worth playing. Bought it on sale, would pay full price.

author: Wherewolf
review: I think this dethrones Portal 2 for greatest co-op game of all time, which is nuts. The amount of care put into the level design and the sheer number of creative co-op mechanics blows my mind. I think the story is rough, especially at the start, but it grew on me by the end. Literally every other aspect of the game is stellar. Shockingly good.

review: There's a good reason this won Game of the Year. Don't be put off by the somewhat janky 'real world' cutscenes at the start - the magic happens down at the scale of the puppets. Absolute must play with close friends or partners.

author: Lovelara.xo
review: A great bonding game for my spouse and me! I loved the aspects of being able to watch your partner's screen in case they weren't sure where they were.  I also think the book, Dr. Hakim, has some great tips for helping make a relationship better, and we're trying to apply them to our marriage. 5*'s!I hope if/when they make others games, they add in different endings you can get based on how much time you took for the environment of the levels. For instance, what if the two characters decided to get a divorce in the end, but it was because both players tried to speed run the game? I totally understand the effort and amount of dedication and time that would take. Just some feedback!

author: minimally
review: I gave this game a 10/10 based on my 57.4 hours of gameplay. Even if I bought it at full price, I still think it is worth it. I do not regret the money I spent at all. This game has been selected for Game of the Year. Although you may already know that this is a fantastic game, I'd like to share some of my thoughts and experiences from the two times I've played. Intro: When personal conflicts impact their lives to the point of divorce, they are magically transformed into puppets. They are grudgingly tasked with saving their damaged relationship since they are trapped in a fantasy world where the unpredictable lurks around every turn. The Story: This game's story is simple to follow, makes sense, and is heart-warming. For myself, I've played twice and don't count the time I watched it on a steamer. This game's story continues to fascinate me. Even though I know how the story will end, I am still able to enjoy the game's journey. Because there will be a message or word in every cut scene in the game that makes me think and realize that it is true and can sometimes be applied to my real life. Gameplay: The main goal of this game is for you and your partner to work together. Although you may need to separate and complete the task on your own at times, you must collaborate with your partner in the end. And the game's tasks aren't difficult at all. You will instinctively know what you need to do for each task in the game, or you can simply explore the map, every corner you can hide in, every shelf you can jump on, and try to play everything they have included, and you will know what you need to do. However, passing the task sometimes necessitates the ability to jump (kind of like parkour), move quickly, and press buttons quickly. I play through some checkpoints 10+ times to pass them. However, if you play it for a while, you will learn the proper timing and your jumping ability will improve for the rest of the game. Graphic: Beautiful scenery can be found throughout this game! This fact may go unnoticed at the start of the game. However, the scene becomes more beautiful as you play more. This game was played on my laptop, which isn't suitable for gaming. I'll have to turn down the graphics, the shadows, and everything else in the game. But it did not ruin my mood at all, I swear. However, if you're playing with someone who has a better computer, I recommend that the person who has a better computer be the host. There's a scene that makes us disconnect from the game. It was fixed when my friend (who had a better computer) came to host instead. Extra note: -I recommend you to explore every corner in the map because you may find the achievements with surprise -You can play with your friend through the Friend Pass feature even if you don't own the game. I hope you have a great time playing this game! Best wishes. <3

There is so much love and heart in this game, it's incredible. It's like an interactive movie, but on a whole different level than any game ever before. This is a new generation of gameplay, cannot describe it differently. It's sooooo much fun, do not miss out on this. Play it, there is NO way you will regret it. The gameplay changes constantly. You dive, fly, jump, run, ride, slide... there's a ton of epic mini games in the game, a ton of jokes things to see, discover, marvel. Wow. Just Wow. author: rottenhunt
review: This is my boyfriend's review:fifiq's review of it takes two :imaginative and brilliant level design combined with constant new ideas makes this game a joy to play--especially with your partner. The game always introduces new ideas without ruining the core experience, namely the co-op part. You are encouraged to communicate and work together and it's done beatifully and naturally woven into the gameplay and the themes. The levels are getting pretty lazy though when reaching the end, because it suddenly feels like a list of chores to complete, rather than a natural journey. Won't lie though, it's still pretty funSadly the story is not on par with the gameplay. The story often feels disconnected with the game itself, and sometimes reality. While imaginative, i don't think the Cody and May relationship was explored well and because of that, sometimes it feels unnatural how they develop/fixing their relationship.Overall, play it with someone, and dont take the story too seriously because...yeah, it's not told well. My girlfriend actually the one who told me how bad the story is and i agree. Shout out to my super detailed and observant girlfriend. Ton of fun playing this with her <3And this is mine:Overall it's an enjoyable game. But I guess I kinda have a curse when it comes to jump-dash section of the game. I will never forget the unlimited tries that I had done with da frogs. Man... it literally gave me PTSD. The bug was really bugging us (you don't say) but thank god it's still playable, only sometimes, I and my boyfriend needed to redo all the game section because we have to restart the game so we can get rid of the bug and it's annoying and ofc wasting our time tgt. I gave thus game 6/10 it should've 7 but i cut one point bcz of the gruesome cutie scene. It made me and my boyfriend had some arguments back then but thank god my boyfriend's so wise that we'd resolved it! Thank you and ♥️♥️♥️♥️ you Josef Fares for making this game.

author: johan
review: The gameplay is incredibly improved from Away Out in every aspect: brimming with inventive and the most diverse gameplay IMO. In each chapter, you will definitely never see repetitive or dreary gameplay. they'll give you a new gameplay mechanic for each chapter, which has become so rare these days. It was really exciting in the first place, but anyway, there're still a few chapters that are not well creative and kind of bore me out.  (To me, the snow and the wasp map, etc.) it's still not perfect in terms of balancing the fun between each map to me: it was very fun in the first 1-2 maps and it dropped so hard and became fun again and dropped, this topic is kinda subjective tho. But with today's standard this game really stands out in its own way and it's top-notch, I must admit it.All in all, there's a thing that let me down the most: and that again, the story: drags so much, I don't see that there is any change in the relationship between the two characters at the end of the game, I just can't feel the development of characters to that extent. feels like the story itself, writing or something can't properly represent what is the true relationship or being good parents to me. Not including the performance and the connection server makes me go crazy.-7/10-

author: kula124
review: I don't review much but I'm making this one.I played this game with my gf and she is not a gamer. In fact, she doesn't enjoy video games that much.I was quite surprised when she started asking me to play this game with her. If you are wondering if this game is for non-gamer players (or girlfriends) the answer is YES!As for the game itself, it is a gem. These kinds of games are what the gaming world is missing right now. The story, level design, bunch of mini-games (including an actual game of chess) are top-notch. There are tons of puzzles made in a way a single play can't carry the game, it takes two (yap) to get through the level. Design is simple, intuitive, and beautiful at the same time. Each time we would get into a new section of the game we would say "okay, this is the best section so far" and this would repeat up the very last section. Each time you think "okay they (devs) played their best hand, doesn't get better than this" you are wrong.The amount of creativity, passion, attention to detail, and love that went into this game is astonishing. What impressed me the most is the creativity. Someone behind this game has crazy and rich imagination that I envy right now.From a technical perspective, the game runs great. There were minor drops in certain areas that I overlooked (plus my laptop is a 5 y/o smart toaster so I don't judge) and I still had a smooth ride. By the amount of care, details, and love it feels like an indie game but with a big budget and big ambition. Yet, it's from EA. I just hope this is not a one-time thing and that EA gives us more of this type of game. With the focus on imagination, creativity, simple, smart, intuitive but beautiful level and game design that is welcoming to new players and enjoyable for the veterans. This is what game developers enjoy making the most and what gamers enjoy playing the most: finished, well-made, creative, no-♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ games. Friend's pass is a blessing, thanks for that.To everyone involved in the making:thank you for this one guys, and I hope it's not one of its kind.

author: ELRIIC
review: 19h for 100% Achievements By far the most enjoyable experienced we had on a local coop game. There is so much variety in game mechanics, set pieces, and overall ways for two players two interact with each other and the world. In addition to the normal playthrough, there are many minigames you unlock and can revisit at any time, driving some friendly competition with your partner/friend.Story is serviceable, and even though it wasn't the highlight for us, it was pushing us forward.Overall a great package, a must for local coop fans!

author: Stabot
review: TL;DR Very good gameplay. Fun and engaging. Also good for people who aren't platformer enthusiasts.           Story is quite infuriating if you care about believable relationships...Long Review:The mechanics are really solid and make for great co-op fun. It's not a super difficult platformer so noobs like me and my gf can play it just fine with the bosses especially still being quite exciting. The minigames were a blast. I think there were maybe 1 or 2 games we didn't play multiple rounds of. Overall for the co-op gameplay this gets a strong recommendation from me. The story however...*BIG SPOILERS*Seriously. I'll spoil the entire story. You have been warned.May and Cody should get a divorce or talk about the *actual* issue at hand. May is overworked and doesn't have time to spend with the family. Really the issue isn't that Cody doesn't fix the garden or that May isn't singing anymore. The real issue is the time management of May between family and work. This is never really addressed. You have a time themed level but at the end there's no resolution just this weird last second rambling about PASSION and invention of Gardening and Singing problems.So after solving the frankly made up problems, Dr. Hakim and Cody came up with, their relationship is apparently fixed. Cody is very needy REQUIRING his overly stressed wife to cheer him on so that he can engage in *his* hobby otherwise f--- it let the garden rot I guess. It's entirely possible May doesn't really have a choice in working long hours all the time. Cody is presented as the poor neglected partner but is really inconsiderate of what May wants or how she feels. May doesn't want to sing but Cody and Dr. Hakim badger her into doing it anyway. It's always about how Cody (and Rose supposedly) feel abandoned even though Rose only ever complained about them fighting.  The real issue of time management/Cody not caring how May feels are never even remotely addressed. The only real reason why they would stay together is because they have a child together. Is raising Rose in all the inevitable conflict really good for her development either?In the end, May is if not explicitly at least implicitly, always portrayed as being at fault "You never have time/You don't support me" but Cody having no understanding of how May feels or not seeing the importance of May being the sole breadwinner of the family is seemingly not only lost on Cody but the game itself. Also the fact Dr. Hakim wasn't burned at the end (or eaten by a wild animal) is a tragedy. F--- that book. "Therapist" my a--

author: Alexicon
review: I am genuinely blown away.No, seriously, I thought... A way Out wasn't great? How could this be very good, it's the same devs, same sort of idea...I picked it up, and my girlfriend used the 'play with friends' pass. Neither of us knew what to expect going in, and the first level was kinda... so-so. We finished our first play session both a little lukewarm on the game.By chapter three we were in love. By chapter five we didn't want to stop. By the end of the game both of us were just speechless watching the credits go by, and later we were messaging each other over how incredible it was. So what's the secret?I think my girlfriend said it best: It reminded both of us of the magic of games of our childhood. New mechanics come and go, beautiful sprawling worlds that are completely seperate from reality, and have their own rules. It was all different but all part of the same whole.The writing is lovely. The moment to moment dialog is fantastic, while the over-arching story is... so-so, it drives the plot. The cartoony artstyle fits this sort of game *way* better than the more realistic style of 'A way out'. It means that the silly moments work and the more serious ones still have the right gravitas needed.If you have a partner who enjoys games, don't do any further reading on this, just go ahead and pick it up and delve in. The whole thing took us about 10 hours or so, and we did a lot of the side content and stuff.

author: DevilsDaughter
review: Wow. If I could give this game a standing ovation I would. Amazing soundtrack, stunning graphics, and a very clever use of multiplayer storytelling. It seamlessly weaves split-screen with solo and cut scenes. it had my bf and I laughing, crying, singing throughout the entire 14 hours, and somehow we only discovered 12/25 mini-games, so we will for sure be going back to find the rest and replaying a lot of them. The collaboration did not feel forced, and the puzzles/bosses were just challenging enough to make you think. Plus gotta give cuddos to that book....had us laughing/crying with his humour.My only complaint is that it took a lot of fussing around with origin/steam linking-I had to create a new origin account specifically to get the game to launch. But once it was setup, multiplayer was seamless.

author: Carnival Of Stupid
review: got the game on sale after seeing it only require one of the 2 player to buy it. after playing with a friend for a few stages, I can definitely see why it won so many awards. the story is funny but still manage to deliver the serious message. the game is very innovative when it comes to the co-op mechanisms. as long as both player are a little familiar with playing platformers and action/shooter games, you can actually play it without any voice chat at all. of course, if you can do voice chat while playing, that would be most ideal. the only thing I don't like about the game is it forces you to sign up for EA's Origin launcher, since it still have to be play through there. Origin is simply terrible and way worse than Steam and being force to use it just make this more obvious. but in the end, I think It Takes Two is worth the trouble of using Origin, it's that good.

author: Level 27 scouter
review: Easily the best Coop game I have ever played.The world design is amazing. Almost everything you see in the background you'll end up visiting, sometimes many stages down the road. The world itself looks absolutely stunning and is thoughtfully created. I was amazed time and time again by the creativity of the dev team.The music is also fantastic. It's always beautifully integrated into the gameplay (especially in the last few stages). There were many moments where I just wanted to sit down and listen to the music while looking at the beautiful world around me. The story is also very well written. I paid attention to every cutscene because I was so invested into the story and character development between both characters. There was a nice balance of serious and emotional moments between the characters but also funny lines and jokes which always felt in place.All in all I absolutely recommend giving this game a shot, given you have a partner to play with!

author: xxTHExONExx
review: "It's Toy Story from parallel universe with tons of comedy and magic!."A game that is nothing short of an animated movie. If there was ever another Toy Story game, it would be just like this one. It is a game that gives a whole new meaning to coop -- a game that requires you and your buddy to work together at every step along the way and both of you need to be skilled, it is a very challenging game.Developers have put together ideas and concepts of different games to come up with a masterpiece that won't let you down in your 15 hours journey through awe-inspiring environments, ingenious level designs and some mind bending puzzles.Apart from the fundamental gameplay, new powers are assigned to both the characters that drastically changes the gameplay and keeps the experience refreshing throughout the journey.Throughout the game, I couldn't help but feel the nostalgic vibes of the old Toy Story 2 video game with mix of Bugs Life, Mario, Sonic and many other nostalgic titles.The storytelling experience is nothing short of an animated movie and will keep you entertained till the very end. (CONCLUSION)It Takes Two will take take you on a nostalgic ride through different magical worlds that leaves nothing short when it comes to storytelling, gameplay and level designs.A worthy game of the year that is truly a masterpiece. One of the best games of all time.(Masterpiece 10/10)

author: Coldglnce
review: I had a great time playing this game with my girlfriend. We both shared lots of laughter and joy playing through the almost 12 hour-long story, together. The game is very simple, so she and I had no problems progressing, the puzzles are easy, and the movement is smooth, the only time we had delays was when she'd use the intractable environment moments to kill me (can't say I didn't do the same though), which we both thoroughly laughed at. The environments and scenes were our favorite part of the game, especially the snow section, as it reminded us both of the city of Leavenworth, WA. That section of the game also had the best moments in the soundtrack. I recommend this game to anyone looking for a cute story co-op game, that is simple but fun. However I must say It is enjoyed most with your significant other!

author: bErNdAn
review: This is simply one of the best games I have ever played. This game literally requires two players, and although this could be played this with a friend, I'd say its really in its element when played with a significant other. Its fun, lighthearted, and even inspirational at times. The game will be challenging, at first, if you or your partner are unfamiliar with playing platformer style games, but don't let that intimidate you. Despite the moments of challenge, the game is very forgiving and saves often, so you are never set too far back from mistakes. And if platformers, "aren't your thing," I'd say don't let that be a deal breaker. This game nearly explores every game genre throughout the story. From racing to puzzle solving to overhead fantasy RPG, so there is something for everyone to enjoy. it really hits all the genres except for maybe horror and FPS. The only thing I have against this game is that the ending came a little unexpected, and unfortunately too fast. However, all story centered games have to come to an end, so its hard to fault it for that. I simply cannot recommend this game enough; its an adventure for everyone involved.

author: Creub

author: DracheKonig
review: TLDR: The game is really good. You should get it and have fun with a good friend. I played through this game with my wife and here is what we had to say. First off, I LOVE that we only needed one copy and could both play together. The friend pass works very well. This game has it all. I was amazed at how many different modes of play it had, and how smoothly it shifted from one to the next. 3rd person platforming is the bread and butter of it, but it has: "cart" racing types, snowboarding, driving a ship, mortal combat style fighter, plane flying, top down movement, puzzles, tower climbing, and more. It was fantastic. All this is set in a charming story with adult conflict. It is themed for adults for sure with a few swear words thrown in. The language is not terrible, and is natural like two adults who are at odds would talk to each other. Suitable for most kids without issues, but just be aware that there ARE some swear words if you are particularly sensitive to them. The scenery is amazing, and often times beautiful. Each environment has something new to look at and is well made. The music score matches each environment well, and the sound effects match without any problems. The combat in the game is not overly challenging, but can be difficult at times with more than one death along the way. But regardless of whether a monster killed you, or your own misstep off an edge, there is never a feeling of stress. It is not meant to be a hardcore game, and the penalties for failure are relatively minimal. Which brings me to another point. The overall game-play design is amazingly well crafted. There is barely any tutorial at all no matter what new mechanic or tool you are introduced to. The closest you get is a button prompt once just to let you know what to call the new thing you are wielding. Despite this, we were never stuck on any area for more than a minute or so before figuring out what we needed to do. No matter what the puzzle was, there was no hand-holding, no guide, and barely any prompts. But it was intuitively designed and was not at all frustrating. Or at least, we never got frustrated at the GAME, but occasionally at ourselves for the failure. The hardest part about the game honestly is the co-operation. Getting in sync with the other person is a challenge at times and led to more than a few accidental deaths. Most resulted in laughter as we learned better what to do for the next attempt. This was by far the single best co-op game I have ever seen, let alone played. Not because of the challenge, of the false need for two people. But because of how it is made to encourage you to work with your partner. All that above is positive. But what about the cons?The forces split screen is hard to get used to. And it would be great to disable it when playing online. Even if just for the over-world travel when you don't need to see what the other is doing. The controls were pretty good, but could use some adjustment with how easy it is to overshoot your jumps sometimes, and how some jumps force a ledge grab when it should not be needed for the area (EX: climbing stairs. Most don't need a ledge grab, but some do.) Couple that with some of the swing-shot points not latching quite right, and it led to some frustration. Even if it was minor. The story falls a bit into both categories. The overall theme is great, and it is paced well. But the conversations and banter between the two main characters, Cody and May, often feel forced or scripted and unnatural. And the little girl, Rose, speaks like an adult who does not know how to voice or write for a child. Rose spoke in a slow, deliberate, and basic manner and honestly came across as very hard to believe for one her age. She was written like someone who does not had kids sat down and wrote out her script with the singular thought that "Kids are dumber than adults. So I just have to write like I'm stupid."All in all, the cons were reasonably minor with how much fun we had playing through it. I would not hesitate to suggest this to anyone who is considering it. 9.5/10I truly do recommend this one.

author: Dogiboi
review: Spoiler freeThis game is absolutely incredible. I completely see why it won GOTY now. First and foremost: If you're reading this, and you have a PS5/Xbox Series X (Or PS4/XBone), it is better to play on those simply for optimization. This game will ultimately run just fine on your top notch machine, but due to some poor coding, there will (possibly) be mild moments of stutter and frame dipping. Good news is it passes quickly, and runs 60FPS otherwise (assuming you have good hardware).+ Tons and tons and tons of gameplay adaptions per world, per area, per segment, per this entire game. You keep thinking they can't add more AND make it look good, but they do+ Visuals are stunning and incredible to look at from start to finish+ Teamwork REQUIRED and different between both characters+ Definitely recommended to play if you're in a struggling relationship. It won't fix it, but it may highlight things that could be tackled to help remedy a problem in a relationship. Who knows+ Voice acting A++ Motion Capture A+++ Music and sound A++++ Consumer service A++++. Having to only buy 1 copy for 2 people is very generous in this age of greedy game publishers and developers. I DO NOT give any of that credit to EA. ♥♥♥♥ EA. All that credit goes straight to Hazelight Studios+ And in my own personal observation, when it comes to the environments, I just love all the little details that area in the ENTIRE GAME. Every area that you may only see and explore for a couple seconds max probably had hours upon hours of work thrown at it. The love behind this gem is astoundingly good- Optimization stuttering from time to time. Internet claims shaders are the reason. dx12 mode helps immensely, but doesn't fix everything.- No collectibles other than the base achievements. Every area feels like there should be collectibles, but it's more or less get from point A to point B.Very excited for their next entry, and I hope it retains the same split screen online format.

author: cali
review: Probably the best game I have ever played.You can really see the pure passion put into this game by the developer right from the first moment you boot up the game. The art style of this game is truly captivating with its succinct simplicity and its joyous minimalism with its classic terracotta coloured background, adorned with the fishtailed mirage of beige setting the scene for perfect little plains of lush grass and soft dirt that we are so familiar with in real life. for your characters, the scenes have been laden with tasteful pleasures of dark mocha platforms for our lovable duo to hop to and from in eternal bliss.The deep story portrayed through this game really inspired me as a gamer, journalist but most importantly a human! This game teaches us to work around obstacles put in our lives by helping each other Finally my only criticism is that there simply is not enough of this truly fabulous piece of modern media and design - I speak for all gamers and consumers when I say we want more!

author: WorldExplorer
review: 和男友在今天通关了，断断续续玩了一个月才玩完，但每一次玩都是非常快乐的时光，仿佛回到了童年大家肩并肩一起玩小霸王的时光。首先游戏设定团队是用了心的，能够明显感受到男女双方的特性补足了父权社会下各自的家庭缺位——女性主外工作赚钱，游戏里主要承担输出。男性主内照顾家庭，游戏主要辅助。这种角色互换会更让玩家理解家庭互相的难处，达到Dr.Harkin所希望的二次therpy。其次是章节的设置丰富多彩。我最喜欢的章节是最开始的钉子配合、中间小可爱王国的格斗和最后的音乐梦想之旅，每一次都会重新审视自己对关系的处理，比如对应起来是是否给过充足的耐心、是否be a adult means no more empathy、是否拥有passions for life。包括游戏模式，从rpg、3d、2d、像素格斗应有尽有，小游戏也设置的丰富多彩，能够感受到无尽的创意，也诠释了家本身的多样性和丰富性。必须要提一下我最爱的动作模式双墙跳，每次都感觉自己是忍者！开飞机真的很变态每次都很想笑。最后，谢谢这个游戏给我们带来的欢乐时光，最开始玩是嘲笑互相手笨、还有一些奇奇怪怪的脑洞笑到飙出眼泪（特别是飞天科迪成就懂的都懂），到后来更多是思考家庭的处理模式和共情，这很难得。会推荐身边的朋友们玩，特别是遇到合适的玩伴快乐加倍。至于和哥们一起玩的，希望你们通关后仍能保持纯粹的感情，不变色不变质不变味（手动滑稽）。

author: Thrumond
review: I'd like to start this review with the fact that I don't usually play story driven games. Most stories don't hold my attention very well. This was a big exception, and I'm happy to say I played the entire game to the end. I'm writing this review right after finishing the game. I don't write reviews often, but I do for a reason.It Takes Two is a game that can be very odd with it's tone, especially early on. However the entire experience is fun and exciting. The story's premise isn't very complicated, but I think it does a wonderful job of fleshing itself out as you go. The creativity showcased on both the environments and the gameplay is remarkable.It Takes Two, literally. Almost everything in the game requires the cooperation between the two players. In a lot of the game, each player has a unique tool or ability that they need to use together to progress. No two of them feel the same and they all play off of one another super well. The team dynamic along with the super smooth movement and platforming make for a very fun experience. The game isn't super difficult, but that doesn't mean you won't mess up a few times. Thankfully the game isn't very punishing and lets you keep trying until you figure out what to do.The world that you explore across the journey is fantastical in every sense of the word. It takes the concept of playing as a pair of toys and runs wild with it. There are so many fun little interactables and mini games that you can play as you go through. A lot of them trigger extra dialogue and information about the story. If you play, don't be afraid to explore. It's worth it. The maps are much larger then you would think at first, but that isn't a real issue. Most of the game is fairly linear, leading from one puzzle to the next. Later on, there are a few areas that let you tackle puzzles in whatever order you like, and these areas are full of even more personality and little interactables then anywhere else.I don't want to say any more, because I would need to go into more detail then I want to. Not because I can't, but because I want you to experience it for yourself. I went into this game completely blind with a friend and it was worth it. If you want to play this game, please try to avoid spoiling yourself before you do. There isn't anything super dramatic, but the magic and wonder of everything wouldn't have felt as good if I knew what was coming beforehand.If you want to play this game, find a friend or loved one and play it together with them. You don't need to buy the game twice to play, only one person needs to own it. (My friend didn't know it at the time when they bought the game for both of us.)In short, if you want a fun, not too difficult co-op experience with someone, I don't know many games that will give you a better experience.

author: Sgt.LMAO
review: Wow! That's all I can really say about this. I absolutely love it. I love the scenery, the story, the characters, the gameplay, absolutely everything.Sure, the graphics might not be up to RDR2 standards, but given the more linear nature of the game you can really tell that the devs put that extra care and attention into making each and every environment pop with vibrant colors and a thick atmosphere. The outside areas are sunny, bright and inviting. The inside areas are incredibly dynamic, but each and every one is as beautiful as the last.The story is spot on where no line feels unnessecary. The characters frequently make snarky remarks towards one another, and aren't afraid to assess the absurdity of the situation they're currently in. It has that kind of Sunset Overdrive-esque tongue-in-cheeck approach to it all, and I love games that don't take themselves too seriously. The NPCs are wonderfully cute and endearing, similar to how they were in Banjo Kazooie back in the day, which just warms my heart. The story's bottom line/end goal is pretty clear from the start, giving you a wonderful sense of just how every step and every action in the game is orchestrated to help the protagonists reach it. The gameplay... I don't know how they did it, but they made even the menial task of getting from place to place an absolute blast. Grinding on rails, flying through the air, GLIDING through the air! It's so incredibly polished and refined, all paired with wonderful scenery to take in during your traversal. The minigames and easter eggs that are scattered around are great fun and a tremendous asset to the game as a whole! The toung-in-cheek approach is prevalent even in this aspect, with the game featuring a plethora of funny mechanics and concepts (such as Mortal Kombat style fights and fun ways to utilize the cooperative aspect of the game) that are introduced rather frequently.If I had to list one complaint about this game, it would be that I think it could have aimed for a lower age rating. It's currently PEGI 12 (ESRB Teen). Sure, a lot of the violence has a purpose and carries the story forward (and is definitely quite fun most of the time), but being strapped to a chair and repeatedly killed by wasps in a cutscene, or being able to partake in an optional 'minigame' where you can torture the other character really doesn't fit the style of this game, according to me. It feels like it includes some of the more violent aspects simply as a way to pander to the mature audience and give the illusion of not being a kid's game, whilst still being an excellent, fun and heartwarming family friendly game at heart.In any case, it's so refreshing to see a game made by people who seem to have a genuine drive and motivation to make games that deliver the best experiences for the player, and to have that reflected so well in the final product. Hats off to Hazelight studios for yet another fantastic co-op experience. You make me proud to be Swedish.

author: xOrbOfDeception
review: It Takes Two is a charming 3D co-op puzzle platformer. The story is engaging, the graphics are great, the levels are varied both in difficulty and style, and the game is overall a lot of fun to play. Most importantly, you need to use CO-LLA-BO-RATION to succeed. Additionally, I think regular gamers and not would enjoy this game about the same amount. It was also nice that both characters felt equally important/relevant in completing each particular puzzle/section. I enjoyed the A Way Out Easter egg which was unexpected and cool to see. The only thing I disliked is that I found May's character to be kind of annoying/irritating, which I don't think was intentional.A few neutral things to note:Overall, I can see why this game won GotY - it's not the most incredible game ever, but it's certainly worth a playthrough and I highly enjoyed my own.

author: [LL] MochaRaf
review: I will keep this short and sweet, this game is absolutely stunning in every way. This game is an absolute masterpiece and definitely one of the best games (definitely best Co-Op game) I have played in quite some time, the game just kept getting better as the story progressed.  I highly recommend finishing all responsibilities/daily tasks prior to starting this game, as you will undoubtedly want to finish it in a single go. As for the pricing, the game is on sale quite often but even at full price every cent is worth it (especially since the game has the "Friend's Pass" which only requires one person to actually purchase the game). Oh and before I forget, make sure you find a trustworthy Co-Op partner as your lives are quite literally depending on each other which opens up endless opportunities to mess with one another.

author: c0mmanderKeen
review: Perhaps the most diversified gameplay in a single coop game to date, this one just keeps throwing fresh ideas and environments at you. Almost all of it sticks, and succeeds in a big way. The game is not very challenging for seasoned gamers, but the adventure is worth every minute and every € / $. Story wise it's ok, there's one very... surprising and rather terrifying moment which sees no story pay-off or consequence (and really should have) but I think you will only be disappointed if you *only* buy this for the writing. The characters are fun, the world is gorgeous, the gameplay fresh, it's pretty lengthy (longer than A Way Out) and I absolutely recommend this to anyone looking for a game to play with a friend, or significant other - it's perfect for that, and can be an introduction to gaming (but be aware that some of the bosses will frustrate complete beginners).Excellent stuff! More please.

author: Kookaburra
review: GREAT game! I highly recommend it. It's definitely my game of the year for 2021 (nothing really came out this year, looking back at it). It is extremely beginner friendly - would highly recommend playing with your partner through this heartwarming tale of rekindling lost love. This has some of the best and most innovative level design I have ever seen in a video game. The soundtrack and story are both on point - it's like playing through a disney movie. Plus, when it's on sale you only have to buy one copy of it to play with a buddy of yours. I played through the game in 9.7 hours with a friend of mine in one sitting, but this could easily be broken up into several sessions because of the way the game is structured. The only downside is that it's really not that replayable. Once you figure out all the puzzles it just doesn't make sense to go back and re-do them. Another drawback is having to deal with Origin and connecting to EA servers to play. With that, this is one of the best games I've ever played and will hold a special place in my heart going forward.

author: Dinkibell
review: What an amazing game! First of all, the decision that only one player needs to have the game purchased is great, since this is a co-op game only, after all!The game has so many good levels and so many different gameplay designs, it never gets boring! Just as you're introduced to one mechanic and enjoying it, you are introduced to a new one (the previous one gets removed), keeping the game fresh always!I can't even begin to describe how fun these levels are and how quickly the gameplay and levels keep changing. There's also a lot of mini-games that you can find for you and your co-op partner to compete in, and every single one is fun and amazing, and can be replayed endlessly!The story is nothing special, but it ties itself to the gameplay nicely enough. The gameplay is where the games shines and it literally does not need anything else!A must-play game to play with your friends, siblings, parents, significant others, etc.

author: Konrad Bobrowitz
review: No wonder It Takes Two has won GOTY 2021, because it's absolutely amazing. I don't know how they managed to do this, but the game is nearly perfect. Although I have one problem with it, so let's get get that quickly out of the way.The game runs mostly smoothly, but man the frame rate tanks in some locations. I remember seeing dips bellow 20 fps on an RTX 3080 and R7 5800X. Don't get me wrong, the game looks astounding both on a graphical and creative level, but drops like these (and they weren't infrequent) for longer periods of time just suck.Now that the only objectively bad thing is out of the way, let's get to the important part. The gameplay is just simply fun. It's approachable, easy to master and perfectly fits the level design and progression. The levels are propably the best levels in a platformer I've ever played. Nothing here seems out of place and everything works as it should. The characters are well written, well acted and most of the time funny - of course that depends on your sense of humour tho. The thing I find the best about the dialogue, is that it makes it understandable for kids, but adults won't be bored, because just like in many fairytale movies (for example my favourite - Shrek) the dialogue gets a new meaning from the perspective of an adult. The bossfights (and there is quite a few of them) are serviceable. They aren't perfect, but the best thing about them is that they need to be defeated by both of the players working together. Of course the same applies to the levels, but during boss fights, there is not as much time for decision making and both players need to cooperate and communicate well to defeat them. And again the biggest achievement regarding the bosfights was, that even tho they were deffinitely not easy, they still were beatable for all age groups. The thing that left me speechless when I finished my playthrough was, how creative and interesting the individual environments were. The designers and writers must have been on some good sh*t to make all of this happen. Every single level is different, every puzzle is somehow not repetetive and all of the environments are so inspired that I just wanted to stop for a few seconds to admire them. There are so few games that make me stop and take in the beauty of what the developers have crafted and this one made me do that nearly every chapter at least once.There isn't enough praise I could give this game in a review. It is a must have, not only for couples that need a bit of couples therapy (where it has the potential to actually help sometimes), but also for basicly, well... everyone. I don't see a single person that wouldn't like at least a part of this game. If you like shooters, there is some shooting, if you like puzzles, threre is some puzzle solving, if you like story, the story is amazing, so on and so forth. And also did I mention, that you only need one copy and one system to play it in co-op? It might seem like I'm exagurating a bit in this review, but the only way to find out is propably to just go, play it and see for yourself.

author: Link
review: It Takes Two takes you on a journey where you need to fix the relationship between Cody and May - a husband and a wife who lost the passion and love in their relationships. Their daughter wishes for them to learn to love each other again - and all of a sudden her wish comes true - kind of: her parents get transformed into tiny dolls and they must solve challenges in the tiny realm - by working together.And that's the core premise: 9 chapters - you must play Co-Op with a friend. The two player must work together. Each of you will always be given a special ability whether you choose May or Cody and neither of their abilities will be able to complete a chapter alone - but together, they can do it.Singleplayer is thus obviously a no-go - you can play together in front of the same monitor/TV or you can play remotely online. If you go the online route: fear not, only one player needs to buy the game, the other friend can join via Friend's Pass.I have played this game a short time after it was released with a friend - back then I was participating via Friend Pass - my friend has already played it once as May and felt they would get a different explerience if they played Cody - so back then I played as May. And now as I write this (December 2021) I bought the game because I really enjoyed my time back then - and now I invited another friend - where I did the same - now I played Cody, and my friend played May.So I can confirm: yes, playing as Cody gave me a different experience. I knew the story - but I had another role in it. So well, some people down there argued it's a one time experience. I would disagree - it's a two times experience. However, I would recommend to keep a little time between both playthroughs.But yeah: visually this game is a masterpiece. Every area in each chapter is lovingly designed - so many little details - so many environments. There is a lot of love and heart in the environments. Everything just looks like a dream - or nightmare. Even if some areas like the 6th chapter (cuckoo clock) can be really frustrating here and there - it's just a beauty to look at - never will I look the same way at a wall clock anymore - I toally want to buy such a clock now. Just to think of the game. Same for other chapters - they are just inspiring.The music: it's not overly special - but always fits. It never feels off. It's just a narration for what you play. So at that moment again: they just got that right.Ultimately the story: the main premise is obviously predictable. Right from the start you know - Cody and May would find each other again. But what's well executed - you learn about Cody and May. You learn about their first vacation, their hobbies, how they proposed - this gives them a great character depth. They also talk a lot about how they see each other as parents and how they rose their daughter (Rose).Ultimately: a little master piece - and in my opinion a well deserved Game of the Year 2021. I can recommend it to everyone who loved to play something together with a friend - and work together with them. COLLABORATION!

review: Brings us back to the Nintendo 64 retro feel, but with upgraded graphics. What a fun game to play with friends. Well deserved. It's a longer game than I thought it would be, also. Can't wait to play some more.If you own the game, another friend that doesn't own the game can just play for free on your account. But, your friends won't have the ability to just play with anyone else, unless they buy it - but you will be able to, because you bought it.Note: Controllers have issues if you Invite a friend through Steam AND Origin. They will overlap. Just invite through Origin only. The overlapping issue causes your friend's controller to control your character. Weird. Resolved by just inviting your friend through Origin account only.

author: playprime04
review: .🔸Story A simple story of a relationship, yet an unforgettable journey.Cody and May are no exceptions to the rule that everyone has a relationship problem. Their fractured relationship is about to break and is on the edge of divorce. Rose, their daughter, does not want them to split up. She expresses her concern to her hand-made dolls, Cody and May. This somehow transforms both of her parents into dolls. Cody and May must now find a way to break the spell and travel into an unknown world, accompanied by Dr. Hakim, a talking book. .🔸Gameplay Endless fun with tons of gameplay mechanics.The gameplay takes place in a split-screen, third-person perspective, allowing you to see the actions of both your controlled character and the spouse at the same time. As the game progresses, the variety of different gameplay will never cease to amaze you. The developer has taken the old couch co-op game to new heights and may have already set the new standard for next-generation cooperative gameplay. .🔸Conclusion Kill hundreds of birds with one stone."It Takes Two" excels in Story, Presentation Elements, and Uniqueness & Creativity. The lighthearted storyline of this game will warm your heart. Each stage's distinct co-op gameplay and a huge array of minigames will bring you closer to your loved ones. It's not an exaggeration to say that It Takes Two has already become the new benchmark for the couch co-op genre.Highly recommend !

author: AdvanceLAMP
review: Buy the game. There's no need to read the reviews, it's an absolutely fantastic game!If you're wondering if you can play this alone, the answer is no. You need a friend, but fortunately you only need one copy of the game, and the friend pass, which is 100% free. You can do this over the internet or locally on the couch, it's your choice!For the longest of time, Resident Evil 5 was my favourite co-op experience. Something to have dumb fun and to try new ways to play the game with my friend. But now, this game may have taken that title and ran with it. Incredibly fun, gorgeous visual, genuinely funny jokes and writing, and gameplay that constantly keeps changing and is a joy to play every time, for a very lengthy 14 hours of game time. The story is simple, yet takes you on a huge adventure to solve these couple's quarrel. The world truly feels massive (Mostly because you're very small), with everyday appliances becoming obstacles, tools, and even bosses to overcome. The game cleverly uses areas from around the house to transport us to completely new environments without feeling shoehorned in for the sake of a winter world or a water world, they feel like they belong in this game.The characters are lovable. The main two protagonists have witty banter, throwing jabs at each other during platforming, the minigames that are sprinkled across the whole game, and slow moments where they remember some of their past times together. There are times where they have questionable decisions to fix their problem, and the easy solution to their problem they can't figure it out until the end of the adventure. Of course it's for the sake of story telling, but it does irk a little bit. This doesn't ruin my experience with the two characters, I think they're enjoyable when they're having fun, and are silly when they get competitive or argue with each other.Another character who I enjoyed is Dr Hakim, the talking book that sends you on this wild goose chase of an adventure. Wildly entertaining and animated, the developers waste no time to make it obvious who Dr Hakim is. From his goofy expression to his overly energetic dances and movements. There's never a dull moment with this book, specially when the couples argue with him. These characters will leave you smiling when they're on screen together.The gameplay as I mentioned before, is constantly changing. New movesets and tools are given to you right after another, and they're constantly coming up with new ways to use these movesets to solve creative puzzles, challenging platforms and boss fights. Just when you thought they've ran out of ideas, out comes a new tool! And then another! Without spoiling too much, the first tools you get is a hammer and a set of nails. The hammer is typically used to break down things like glass bottles, but is also used to swing across platforms, catapult off of springs, and pulling up nails to create new paths. The set of nails I found really fun. They're used like javelins where you throw them at walls to stick them, allowing the player with the hammer to swing across pit falls. They're also used to hold down platforms to move across, or even to hold down enemies for an open attack. What I really enjoy about these tools is one small detail. Generally in games, something like a hammer is given to the heavy weight character, and something agile and light like the set of nails, is given to characters who are slim and fast. So to see the slim female character carry the hammer, and the large male character use the nails was a breath of fresh air, to have broken a trend like that.It Takes Two (at the time of writing this review was the name of the game) is a beautifully crafted game that was cared for, and wasn't blinded by unfinished deadlines, the use of micro-transactions, or hiring big name voice actors in hopes to sell the game. It stood on it's own feet and truly shows that the team put in every love and talent into this game. I was looking for a game to play co-op with my friend, and instead of having a simple fun game to try out, I ended up discovering my new favourite game of all time. Without a doubt The Best Co-op experience I have ever played, and I think it's going to be difficult to find a game to top this one. There's something for everyone in this game; it's got great platforming, beautiful scenarios, classic jokes, fun silly side minigames and interactions, and a heartfelt story that ties this whole game up with a lovely red bow.Game of the Year, hands down.

author: Gergolot
review: The game is amazing. Probably one of the best co-op games I've played and definitely one of the best games I've played overall for some time. The story-line is pretty average and the sub-plot just gives an excuse for the gameplay, but it's really not important. The main plot between the player characters is enough but it's the gameplay that keeps you hooked. The sound and level design is just fantastic - and every area of the game feels unique and different to keep it fresh for the entire 15 or so hours it takes to complete. The game is very funny and had me and my friend laughing constantly. Lots of little mini-games for some PvP and there's a good amount of challenge across the game for experienced players if wished.Highly recommend this game.Rating out of ten -10/10For the more quantitative of folks - Graphics ☐ Beautiful☑ Very good☐ Good☐ Bad☐ AwfulMusic / Audio ♬☑ Beautiful☐ Very good☐ Good☐ Bad☐ AwfulDifficulty ☠☐ Baby - holds your hand the entire way☐ Easy - minimal challenge☑ Average - normal difficulty of most games, some challenge but mostly easy☐ Difficult - a good challenge to the player☐ Hard - game can be painful at times and hard to complete for a casual gamer☐ Pain - this game will make you rage, not for the faint of heartStory☐ Fantastic☐ Very good☑ Good☐ Decent☐ Minimal☐ Poor☐ Non existentGeneral Game-play ⚔☑ Outstanding - hard to fault and near perfect☐ Very good - smooth and enjoyable☐ Good - largely enjoyable☐ Average - as expected☐ Okay - nothing special☐ Rubbish - more bad than goodGame Length☐ Very short (0 - 3 hours)☐ Short (3 - 8 hours)☑ Medium/Average (8 - 20 hours)☐ Long (20-60 hours)☐ Very Long (60-100 hours)☐ You'll grow old together (100+ hours)

review: Easily one of the best games ive ever played. very well done storyline, can confirm that i cried.the gameplay is phenomenal. the way the game seamlessly swaps between genre of games all while being just an absolute blast... but by far the best thing about this game. it was made with one thing in mind, just simple honest fun. theres so many simple things that are unnecessary that they added to the game because they could. i spent hours just running around not even continuing the game because i was riding a toy train and playing darts where i was the dart. Idk its hard to  put into words other than to say that they made this game for the player and so the players can have fun. its legitimately ironic that its published by EA because this game goes against literally everything EA has stood for for over a decade lol.

author: frogfrogfrog
review: ᴛʜɪꜱ ɢᴀᴍᴇ ɪꜱ ꜱᴏ ᴘʀᴇᴄɪᴏᴜꜱ. ꜰᴀɴᴛᴀꜱᴛɪᴄ ɢᴀᴍᴇ ɪɴ ᴀɴʏ ᴀꜱᴘᴇᴄᴛ, ꜰʀᴏᴍ ɢᴀᴍᴇᴘʟᴀʏ ᴛᴏ ᴠɪꜱᴜᴀʟꜱ. ɪ ᴅɪɢ ᴛʜᴇ ꜱᴘʟɪᴛ ꜱᴄʀᴇᴇɴ ᴀɴᴅ ᴏᴠᴇʀᴀʟʟ ᴅᴇꜱɪɢɴ ᴏꜰ ᴛʜᴇ ɢᴀᴍᴇ. ɪᴛ ᴊᴜꜱᴛ ʟᴏᴏᴋꜱ ꜱᴏ ᴄᴜᴛᴇ ᴀɴᴅ ꜰᴜɴɴʏ ᴀᴛ ᴛʜᴇ ꜱᴀᴍᴇ ᴛɪᴍᴇ, ᴡɪᴛʜ ꜱᴏᴍᴇ ʜɪʟᴀʀɪᴏᴜꜱ ᴀɴɪᴍᴀᴛɪᴏɴꜱ ᴏɴ ᴛᴏᴘ ᴏꜰ ɪᴛ. ᴛʜᴇ ʙᴇꜱᴛ ᴘᴀʀᴛ ᴏꜰ ᴛʜᴇ ɢᴀᴍᴇ, ʙʏ ꜰᴀʀ, ɪꜱ ᴛʜᴇ ʟᴇᴠᴇʟ ᴅᴇꜱɪɢɴ. ɪᴛ'ꜱ ꜱᴏᴍᴇᴛʜɪɴɢ ʏᴏᴜ ʀᴀʀᴇʟʏ ᴇxᴘᴇʀɪᴇɴᴄᴇ ɪɴ ʀᴇᴄᴇɴᴛʟʏ ʀᴇʟᴇᴀꜱᴇᴅ ɢᴀᴍᴇꜱ, ᴀɴᴅ ᴛʜᴇ ᴄᴏɴᴄᴇᴘᴛ ᴏꜰ ᴡᴏʀᴋɪɴɢ ᴛᴏɢᴇᴛʜᴇʀ ʟɪᴋᴇ ɪɴ "ᴀ ᴡᴀʏ ᴏᴜᴛ" ɪꜱ ꜱᴏ ᴄᴏᴏʟ ᴀɴᴅ ʀᴇꜰʀᴇꜱʜɪɴɢ. ᴛʜᴇ ᴅᴇꜱɪɢɴᴇʀ ᴛᴇᴀᴍ ᴡᴇɴᴛ ꜰᴜʟʟ ᴏɴ ʙᴇᴀꜱᴛ ᴍᴏᴅᴇ ᴡʜᴇɴ ɪᴛ ᴄᴏᴍᴇꜱ ᴛᴏ ᴄʀᴇᴀᴛɪᴠɪᴛʏ, ᴀɴᴅ ᴛʜᴀᴛ ɪꜱ ᴡʜᴀᴛ ᴍᴀᴋᴇꜱ ᴛʜᴇ ɢᴀᴍᴇ ꜱᴏ ꜱᴘᴇᴄɪᴀʟ. ɪᴛ'ꜱ ꜰᴜʟʟ ᴏꜰ ᴜɴɪQᴜᴇ ᴍᴀᴘꜱ, ʀɪᴅᴅʟᴇꜱ, ᴘᴜᴢᴢʟᴇꜱ, ᴀɴᴅ ᴊᴜᴍᴘ ɴ' ʀᴜɴꜱ, ᴘʟᴜꜱ, ᴛʜᴇ ᴀᴛᴛᴇɴᴛɪᴏɴ ᴛᴏ ᴅᴇᴛᴀɪʟ ɪꜱ ɪɴꜱᴀɴᴇ. ᴛʜᴇʀᴇ ᴀʀᴇ ᴀʙᴏᴜᴛ 25 ᴍɪɴɪ-ɢᴀᴍᴇꜱ ʏᴏᴜ ᴄᴀɴ ᴘʟᴀʏ, ᴡʜɪᴄʜ ᴀʟʟ ꜱᴏᴍᴇᴡʜᴀᴛ ʀᴇʟᴀᴛᴇ ᴛᴏ ᴛʜᴇ ᴄᴜʀʀᴇɴᴛ ᴛʜᴇᴍᴇ ᴏꜰ ᴛʜᴇ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀ ʏᴏᴜ ᴀʀᴇ ɪɴ ᴀᴛ ᴛʜᴇ ᴍᴏᴍᴇɴᴛ. ᴛʜᴇ ᴇɴᴅɪɴɢ ɪꜱ ᴀꜱ ᴇxᴘᴇᴄᴛᴇᴅ, ʙᴜᴛ ᴛʜᴇʀᴇ ɪꜱɴ'ᴛ ʀᴇᴀʟʟʏ ᴍᴜᴄʜ ʀᴏᴏᴍ, ꜰᴏʀ ᴀ ʙɪɢ ᴘʟᴏᴛ ᴛᴡɪꜱᴛ ɪɴ ᴀ ɢᴀᴍᴇ ʟɪᴋᴇ ᴛʜɪꜱ ᴡɪᴛʜ ꜱᴜᴄʜ ᴀ ꜱᴛᴏʀʏʟɪɴᴇ.10/10

review: Best game I have played ever.Me and the GF started this bad boy up and travelled trough an amazing story with fun and interesting tasks for us to complete along it. It was both fun and sometimes difficult and took alot of cooperation to complete the game, which I have never seen before in any other game. author: Gokki
review: An incredible game that gave me heavy nostalgia for the old days when all games had split screen co-op. Now that everything is online you rarely see co-op games or modes especially from triple A developers, and much rarer are dedicated co-op modes where you need the other player to advance. This kind of design always has the two (or more) players working together and makes everyone feel like they are crucial for success. It feels magical to connect with someone through a game this way, and i heavily recommend playing this game with your significant other or a close friend. Game is accessible to all skill levels so anyone can have fun. Worth at full price and a must-buy on sale, its a sin to go without playing this gem if you have someone to play with.

author: Chan the Master Baiter♂
review: The long distance part of a relationship was def a little bit tougher than i remembered. The woman is having some problems dealing with life and i was not to happy to be the witness of that. I ran into some problems booting the game up to the point that I almost gave up and called it a night.Oh boy, was I lucky to have persisted.This game brought a childish grin on both of our fat faces. it reminds me of the days we'd take long hikes to get icecream or gotten drunk and taking a sh*t together on somebody's roof. Maybe the vodka and cheap beer helped, but it feels like casting in a Disney/Pixar movie but still retaining your personality as an adult, the game never tried telling you who you are, it just showed what you can do, and we loved that.Its been months since we had a gaming night this fun, and I usually abhor platformers.Get this game, play with somebody that matters, and prepare for a night in which you'd feel you are too young to f*ck.20/10, would def pay double for it. I love you my little extra chromosome.

author: rkiwtir
review: Best coop game of the year. Every chapter is interesting and has a different gameplay element/theme which feels fresh and doesn't get boring or grindy like other coop games.  Well paced game, worth playing once or twice. Also has really cool mini-games.

author: Nycteris
review: I wanted to nominate this game for almost every Steam award this year, it's that good. Ever wanted to be in every Pixar movie ever, while doing a co-op game that has not only replay value (at least once per character!) but also stunning graphics? Caveat: I'm writing this review before having played the entire game myself, thanks to a computer fry halfway through (hence the short playtime). However, I have seen the entire thing a few times via various Let's Plays, so do know the entire plot.It has amazing sound/music, incredibly innovative gameplay, wonderful graphics, and of course you can't even play it alone so it's definitely better with someone else. The story, while occasionally silly, is heartfelt and memorable. And some parts will stick with you forever (RIP elephant). I can't say enough good things about this game, truly. It's FULL of tiny Easter eggs and references; FULL of neat secrets; and not only is the gameplay fun but all of the tiny little things you can discover that aren't even part of the game just add that much more magic (the Zelda reference, anyone??), from little competitions to fun retro nods. Not a single part of this game is boring. I haven't had so much fun playing with someone else in ages. 15/10, will love it forever.

author: carraway
review: One of the best co-op experiences ever: organic gameplay progression with fun mechanics and enough variety to keep things interesting for players of all skill ranges; great level design; a decent premise and narrative framework (though the best aspect of the story is the metanarrative of how you and your co-op partner get through the game together).

author: markomanolios
review: The good- Awesome 3d graphics with fantastic details, high res textures, atmospheric lighting, various visuals effects and gorgeous chromatic pallet. There are some really artistic places and sequences.- Fantastically designed world with so many unique regions to explore that you will never get bored. The use of scale and the integration of all these magnified daily objects at the level design is really creative and gives you a whole new perspective of the world.- Except of the main path, there is a big amount of activities, mini games and easter eggs scattered inside its world. Although the game is linear, it gives you at some regions an open world feeling. You will spend a lot of hours wandering around and playing with them.- Good gameplay and flow. Control mechanics are simple but effective and all your commands feel responsive. The game has great pacing too. Fast and slow sequences come one after another, so it never gets boring.- It offers a fairly decent cinematic experience. Some sequences are really well directed and the photography is always at a high level.- Characters acquire different abilities at each chapter which alternates the gameplay enough to make it even more interesting.- Great, smooth and quick characters' animations. Running, hanging and double jumps can be extra pleasant.- The main characters are interesting and well designed. May and Cody are adorable. Hakim is a character to remember.- Nicely designed enemies. There is a big amount of unique bosses to beat. It is really creative of how daily objects have been transformed into evil creatures that want to kill you- There are many puzzles with some good ideas here and there. Unfortunately they are too easy and a bit childish.- Mini games are extraordinary. You will have some really fun pvp time in a game that is considered to be mainly co-op. A very clever addition.- Incredible music. It always fits the action and enhances the game's flow and atmosphere.- Good, convincing voice acting performances.- Great sense of humor. Although it is generally cute and childish it packs some adult jokes and some, kind of, violent scenes that form a surreal result.- It offers some emotionally strong moments, although the story is a little bit cliché.- It packs a friend pass which you can use multiple times, so you can save some money to your friends. Nice.The bad- Action sequences are way too easy. In fact the whole game is too forgiving and unchallenging. When you die your character respawns exactly at the place of death. Even at boss fights if you lose the game restarts sometimes from the middle of the battle. You don't lose unless both of your characters die at the same moment, which rarely happens. You can easily lose your interest and do things mechanically (especially at some sequences where your characters run automatically and you have just to press the jump button). If you consider that there are no difficulty levels, It is like the game is made mainly for children.- There are a lot of puzzles but you won't ever need more than a few seconds in order to figure out the solution. After a while they get a bit repetitive too. I expected some puzzles to be more complicated and clever.- Many minor bugs and glitches that will force you to restart the game. Sometimes your character will stuck inside a random object, some others the UI will disappear for no reason etc. Also the issue with all these EA's client apps (EA Play, Origin, Steam's Origin) is unacceptable. If you and your friend are not both running the game through the same client app you will probably need some time to figure out how to play together.- In tight or rotating places the camera angles can be frustrating giving you no clear view to play the game properly. - The story is shallow with many clichés. Except of the first and the last cut scenes it doesn't really evolves though the actual game. Also many things of the plot make no sense at all (why there tubes with liquid candy inside a snow ball that you need to reactivate?). Nevertheless it is true that this kind of platformers don't really need a strong story to support the action.- I felt that sometimes it tries too hard to be cute.

author: Aniche
review: Absolutely stupendous game in every sense of the word. I can't explain to you how much I enjoyed this game, it's so good!!First of all, this game really leans into the co-op aspect and is so much fun as a result. Literally every puzzle needed some form of collab between me and my friend, and it was so fun when we got things right and hilarious when either of us messed up. Most puzzles were challenging enough to make you think without being so hard as to slow down your momentum.Every new environment introduces several new gameplay mechanics, and they're somehow all really well-implemented. It never felt like they were running out of ideas or got lazy, and each new mechanic led to a whole new paradigm for puzzle solving. Not to mention, bosses were so much fun in this game. Like, SO MUCH FUN.The visuals are an absolute delight. Everything is just bursting with colour, life, energy. You go from a treetop to a toy room to a space station thingie, just to name a few. Every new area had amazing presentation with weird and sometimes surreal level design. Every single level is just so insanely creative.The story, while fairly simple, is elevated by some great writing, and the two protagonists are very interesting and distinct characters. I never for a moment felt one outshone the other, and the way the story addresses the flaws in how they manage their relationship was charming and heartwarming, without being overly preachy or cheesy. Not to mention, each level has fun minigames and literally hundreds of interactable items and elements. You get to explore entire miniature towns and villages brimming with toy characters, and there's silly little activities that both players can do together. It genuinely felt like I was playing with a box of toys, and everything that looked like I should be able to interact with it let me do something with it, however inane or pointless.All in all, I'm astounded at the sheer polish and attention to detail lavished on every aspect of this game. In a world where it feels like every AAA game releases with a clusterf**k of bugs or unfinished content, this game felt like it was tripping over itself to give you more, more, more. I was expecting to finish this game in 5-6 hours, I did NOT expect it to have this much content. And all of it was so good??? Seriously, if you're reading this, BUY THIS GAME. This is not a drill.

author: ىchmiloff
review: I have genuinely put this review off because I feel it really deserves an in depth breakdown that is almost impossible to put into words.  This glorious game is one that just keeps on giving, from the second you launch this beauty you are bedazzled by the effort that has been put in by the creators. I have never experienced a game in this genre that provides such a ‘bang for buck’. I honestly feel ashamed to have bought this at a discount, the game is underpriced as it is.  This review will explore the major selling points for me and try to include what extras I can along the way. Firstly, I’ll cover the typical cliché yet surprisingly engaging and well-delivered story. Secondly, we’ll explore the level of detail taken to create such an immersive digital world! Finally, the gameplay and how it not only incorporates cooperative play well but how it adapts throughout the game.Now whilst this is a ‘child makes a wish for their separating parents to sort their ♥♥♥♥ out on a fantasy adventure’ the quality of a cliché structure does not diminish the story whatsoever. Ironically, structured much like a child's movie, this game reinforces the cliché by adding some outrageously bad pun humour whilst also sneaking a few in for the adults as well. The story is genuinely beautiful and engaging, the emotional rollercoaster just keeps on going! I have 12.7 hours of playtime and the majority of that does not include too much time invested into the 'side extras' provided. It takes two (ITT) goes above and beyond to create such a beautiful world that provides such realism in a fantasy world. Without spoiling the story too much, the main characters are turned into dolls that adventure through the house and garden through several terrains. The way the game is structured typically changes the abilities/gameplay available to suit the terrain making each stage of the story different, fun and unique. Additionally, whilst providing such a large variety of worlds for us to explore the creators do not miss a second of detail throughout any of them. For example, the subtle yet significant attention to detail with such things as a kids road rug in the bedroom or battling a vacuum cleaner in the garage. Not to mention the quality of the graphics is superb!! ITT is created for cooperative play and whilst other games like  and  are similar in that sense, I feel this game sets such a high standard that future games will find it difficult to live up to. This cooperative game can be played split-screen on the same device or shared split-screen online (which only requires 1 copy of the game). As mentioned with terrain, the gameplay is forever changing and adapting to the environment, not once throughout the game do you feel "oh this is the same repetitive crap". In certain parts of the story, there are hidden extras and minigames you can verse each other in as well. Additionally, the progression of the changes throughout the game add consistent difficulty changes however, you’ll never feel like the game is unreasonable in expectations. To wrap it up, I can not fault this game and developers should take note, this is the targeted standard for a co-op game. This game is appropriate for all ages, you’ll get an immersive story that you won't want to put down! Aesthetically pleasing whilst going above and beyond that craving you have for a platform coop adventure. If you don't buy this game, you'll never be truly fulfilled in life. If  and  aren't already working on a sequel... WE RIOT!!!!!!!!!

review: Since i saw the trailer, i wanted to play it, it looked so fun, even though i've never played a co-op game like this one before. Then it came out and took a while to convince my boyfriend to play it, but he finally got convinced. From the start you feel that you are really helping each other to beat the game, you never feel that you're competing, instead you really need to coordinate with the one that you're playing with. We even had fun making mistakes while trying to beat the challenges that the game put us through, but maybe not everyone reacts like us, 'cause we even saw the other reviews were they were fighting with their girlfriends.The storytelling in the game matches a lot with the scenery, the way they portrait the story it's viewed a lot in all the decoration and the level or part of the story you're at. There's also a lot of minigames in between the story that you can play and have fun, so you always having fun. I'm amazed of how the developers brought everything together into one package, it feels nice that they brought something different into the gaming industry. Me and my boyfriend loved it♥ 250/10
