author: Hey Its Griz
review: I never really leave reviews for games and when I do it's nonsensical, but this game is special to me. I bought it a few weeks ago for me and my girlfriend, for our anniversary date so we could play it together when it did roll around and, it was truly a blast. The story was great, the game-play really did bring us closer, excluding when I would win in all the challenges (she wouldn't let me lose). We had to think as a team and no one did all the work while the other one did nothing, you HAVE to work together. The "Snow Level" was by far our favorite, we roamed the level, exploring and just doing things together, laughing, by the time it was over it felt like an actual adventure, it was definitely sad it was over, and I'd do it over with her a thousand times if I could force myself to forget it after every time we played it. This is truly an amazing co-op game that I recommend not only to couples, but truly anyone who wants to spend time with a someone they care about. Easily a 10/10 game for me.For whenever you check my reviews and find this, I love you, thanks for playing this with me, it will be a memory I'll think of fondly.

author: Bad Clown
review: It's a good game. 100%-ing the game took me and my friend about 10 hours. Achievements apply on both friends (given both own the game) so if one person finds something, the other person technically finds it even if they don't interact with it.For the actual game, it has great cartoon graphics and is quite well optimized. It references several different game styles and each of the different world levels are just so interesting and interactive. There are many small decorations that are interact-able and overall the attention to detail is just satisfying.Story caters to couples but I had fun playing this with my homie.Soundtrack is aight.I haven't experienced any major bugs except for some minor clipping here and there.It's a shame that there is no replayability because I would love playing this with multiple different people.

author: Odey555
review: Just finished playing through it with a friend, fantastic game! I really truly hope more coop games like this come along in the future. The only minor gripes I had were sometimes movement didn't seem to register or  you got stuck, and the changing perspectives got a tad bit confusing or nauseating at times (). Other than that, highly recommend this! Plus, if you want to play with a friend online only one of you needs to pay for it, a gigantic plus.

author: Zmaj
review: Probably the best pure co-op game I've ever played. Every step of the way you're doing something new. It literally never gets boring, and never runs out of creative ideas and game mechanics. Great voice acting and some amusing jokes thrown in there too. A real joy to play.

author: uumoky
review: Amazing game for couples. Not too hard to pick up. My girlfriend had very little experience with games, but she thoroughly enjoyed playing with me and we still come back to play it again, especially the competitive minigames. This is an extremely relaxing and fun time for us and it's just an amazing game. This game also has no business being as beautiful as it is, it's really weird how beautiful this game is and it's screenshot worthy many a time. Each 'world' has a different game mechanic and it's just so so so damn creative how they thought of all of this. It's honestly really impressive how much thought and effort they put into the gameplay experience. Death is always funny and comedic. Cooperation is rewarding and it never feels repetitive. I can't remember how many times I've said to myself, "this is so damn creative, how did they think of this?" and i'm an avid gamer that has played many games. Sure some of it isn't entirely original but it's never been done this well.

I love miniature words. I had NO idea of what the story was about going in but man was that a lovely story.Graphics are great in the miniature world kinda funny in the outer world but you dont spend much time there.Voice acting is great! So many mini games that are so fun! So many play styles!This was my partners first PC game  ever and she had a blast!If you read this honey, I LOVE YOU!<3

review: Pretty much the best game ever - it has every other game in it, so you won't have to buy any other games.A great choice if you want to introduce someone to gaming. One minor annoyance though - you can't switch sides of the screen if you want to keep playing with the same character.

author: gazza
review: If you're looking for an enjoyable and light-hearted co-op game, It Takes Two is one that I would definitely recommend. The storyline is very good, and the main characters are likeable and easy to relate to. The gameplay is fun and interesting as well; with each level you get new abilities that let you work together and solve puzzles to advance the story. There are even fun little mini-games where you can go up against your partner, which adds a slight competitiveness to the game and helps to break up all the co-op gameplay a bit. I was actually a little sad after I had beaten the game and realized that it was over. All in all, this is a great game if you like co-op puzzle-solving with a nice story - especially if you have someone memorable to play it with.

author: BaseModelRacer
review: Bought it to play with my girlfriend, who doesn't have much experience with platformers, but the challenge and occasional puzzles the game presents were simple enough for her to follow and accomplish, but fun enough for someone like me to enjoy.  It really is a game best enjoyed with someone close to you, like a family member, partner, or close friend.Each level presents a diverse theme or setting that maintains its consistency throughout the challenges you encounter. The mini games that have you go head-to-head with your partner are a very nice touch, too. I liked the level of exploration present in many of the levels, there are a lot of easter eggs and extras to find. I might actually come back to the game to finish all of the achievements.I did not experience any significant bugs or performance issues, and it was easy for me and my partner to connect via Friend's Pass. Overall, great game especially at the price I got it at, but equally worth it full price.

author: Drogoriff
review: I had an absolute blast!! Make sure to play this with someone close or special and you will be in for an amazing, funny and delightful bonding time:3The amount of attention to detail the developers put into this game is outstanding! I loved the Easter-eggs, the great work with the voice acting, the plot, the graphics, the variety of scenes, mechanics, puzzles and challenges, the many rewards for those exploring outside of the path... and don't even get me started with the music and sound effects!Everything looks very polished and optimized! I am so glad I got the chance to play this game, and even more grateful for having the best game partner to play with, after all: It Takes Two! -sorry for the cheap pun heheBuy and you won't regret it!<3 Keep it up the good work everyone involved in the development of this precious game!

author: Resident Red
review: Probably the best cooperative game in recent years, designed with a great deal of love and attention to detail.+ The fantastical replaces reality in an epic adventure to remember.+ Stunningly colourful environments through a wide variety of levels—from garden shenanigans, to the inside of a snowglobe.+ Wildly diverse set of puzzles, as well as minigames to get competitive about.+ The little things, even if it's a simple interaction with a prop that, despite not progressing the game in any way, is still exceptionally fun to waste time on.+ Built specifically for split-screen play.+ Movement feels amazing, especially with how fast-paced certain segments are.+ Decent enough story with an interesting message behind it.+ Requires one purchase, second player gets access through the Friend’s Pass.- Characters can be a tad annoying.- Cutie, the Queen of the Magic Castle, didn’t deserve it. A must-play for couples, friends, family, or just some random off the street. Opinions are my own and reflect my experience.

author: Brownie
review: This game is an absolute masterpiece, hands down. Not only is the story the best from any games I have played in a long, long time, but everything else about this game was perfectly made. The gameplay was varied and never repetitive. Not only that but each character has a vastly different role throughout every single part of the game. This would allow you to replay it and get an entirely different experience. Let me say, I held off on this game for a while, trying to determine if it was worth my money. If you are still holding back on this game, trust me, it is worth every cent of your purchase and every second of your time. Please play this game.

author: Widoch
review: Absolutely wonderful and beautiful.- To start with, the story grabbed me. I have kids and I was hooked and felt for the main characters. They are real, likeable, and fun.- The humor. It's a funny game with visual and written humor all around. I chuckled a lot playing through it.- It's fun visually. The leaves are creative and eye pleasing. The the graphics are perfectly fine as well.- The music and sound design add a lot to the experience. They're really well done and add rather than subtract.- Game play is fine. I nothing special but it works. I the controls make sense, it's easy to figure out, the movements are snappy and we didn't find any game breaking bugs.- Entertainment. Honestly, the puzzles are easy. It's bog standard platform stuff. It won't challenge you, but it'll entertain you because they're creative and well paced. It never drags and the cut scenes are just enough to keep the story moving.- Cooperative play is seemless. My friend and I never had lag or connection issues. Worked juat fine.- We used discord for voice, so I don't know how the game voice server works.Great game, go get it and have some fun!

author: sweetporkbun
review: Normally I play FPS, and once in a while I'll give games like this a try. And thank god I did.-Top class graphics. Could've been a Nvidia demo and I would have believed it.-Friend Pass. I bought this game and played with my friend who didn't own the game. Giving players this ability makes it so easy to try this game with any of my friends.-A sweet story. Its a straightforward plot but there was a specific mission where my friend and I felt emotionally invested...Not something we've felt about a game before. We had no choice, Queen.-Creative gameplay and . Man, I don't remember the last time I felt a game was just plain fun. No caveats. No 'frustrating but fun', or 'buggy but fun', its simply fun. For example, I expected this game to be a monotone style of a third party adventure, but there were many missions that surpassed my expectations. They had missions using mechanics gamers will be familiar with from other genres like stealth or traditional RPGs. A balanced variety and necessary in keeping the gameplay fresh and surprising.-Favorite Mission:  -Lack of bugs. Nowadays it feels that every game, regardless of its budget, is plagued with bugs. However, It Takes Two was bug free in my experience (except for the friend pass situation). And a modern game being bug free and well polished deserves a commendation by this alone.-Only con I had was the fact that using the Friend Pass required my friend and I to launch the game through Origin. I would bet that most people buying this game on Steam would be happy to keep Origin off their computer. Unfortunately if we launched via Steam, my friend couldn't join me. Meh.-*Nitpick* I really wanted to replay with the MPC portion, wish I could've gone back without having to redo the mission from the beginning.In summary, I'm a FPS head and I love this fun game. If you're looking to give this game a try I would have a hard time giving you a reason why you .

author: Bardz
review: Its been a while since I've played a game where I really can't wait to get back to it and see what happens next. It Takes Two is one of those games. Is it perfect? Nah. But somehow, despite its flaws, It Takes Two is still one of my favourite games of the year, and perhaps my favourite co-op game of all time. The +ves:- It really is a co-op game, and like the name suggests, makes good use of both players to complete each level- The voice actors for the main characters are good, and the banter between them is great- The worlds and powers are reminiscent of banjo kazooie and psychonauts;- Every level feels different and there are a few entirely different mechanics to play with- Rose's Room. Especially the bit with the Queen...The -ves- Rose's character always felt slightly annoying instead of endearing;- The 'real world' models have just a bit of uncanny valley to them;- As it is designed to be couch co-op, you have to connect via discord to communicate if you are playing online. Also no handy ping system a la portal 2 to point at what you want them to do. Unfortunately if you don't have a second person, you're going to miss out. I strongly suggest finding one and then playing this with them. It's worth the cost at full price, and if you see this one sale - really don't miss out.

author: Peacheenie
review: (Played as  and owns the game):Well, I've got to say I was incredibly surprised with all of the things this game managed to accomplish considering its simple starting premise of "we're getting a divorce"! When first starting, I had no idea what to expect from It Takes Two and both me and my co-op partner went in completely blind which was probably the best call because we found ourselves absolutely blown away with the amount of game styles secretly packed inside this innocent little platformer; if you're looking for variety in your game then It Takes Two takes the CAKE with every level having it's own set of abilities and game mechanics to shake things up when you least expect it with the levels acting both as open world exploration and generic platforming interchangeably!The level designs themselves are chock full of life and character; the art design pushing itself to the limits with the beautifully rendered scenery and gorgeous details with everyday objects seamlessly implemented into both the background and foregrounds with lots and lots of things for you to interact with whilst you're exploring. If there's an object in your path you can usually do something with it and it makes for such a wonderful experience feeling like a kid again when you stumble upon a spinning light you can mash the button to spin or some paints and crafts to make actual art with; the actual amount of creativity and game play mechanics in It Takes Two is INSANE and the developers really went all out to make a memorable experience when they really didn't have to! I really can't say enough how much I adored this games design and premise of "everyday objects but reimagined to be used in completely unique ways"; there's literally so much packed into this game that my review would probably be about 20 pages long if I tried to list it all!Last but not least the story and it's characters were very interesting despite it's simple premise! Dr. Hakim was at first quite annoying and brash but towards the end I genuinely liked him and what he was trying to set out to do for the main characters. Rose was very endearing and I constantly felt bad for her situation considering what she would have to be going through but what I found both Cody and May is that they have a very deep and troubled relationship of which I don't think I've seen represented so well in a video game before- it feels . Their relationship feels incredibly normal and human and oh so relatable of which is why I found myself growing on these two people and rooting for them to try and work it out and get back together despite their ever growing list of reason on why they should end it and split up. I'm glad the ending is open ended on this however because it shows that even if you do work things out together, not everything has to be perfect and sometimes it is just best to separate from your partner to be healthier and happier in the end.All in all I'd definitely recommend this game to people mainly for its gameplay because it's seriously one of the best co-op games I've ever played and it REALLY doesn't skimp on the co-op at all- you  need to work with your partner throughout and get used to depending on them and that's why it's so special!- (Played as  for free via Steam Remote Play):Right so firstly, THIS GAME IS BLOODY BRILLIANT!!! Legit, this game is probably the best co-op experience I’ve ever had playing a game. A Way Out was fantastic in itself, but this game takes the idea of a co-op game and just goes completely wild with it! So much creativity and imagination is on display throughout, be it from the levels’ designs themselves or from the various gameplay gimmicks, that the game never ends up feeling boring! Every moment has something new to offer and enjoy and once me and Emm were finished with it, I legit didn’t want it to end… My favourite areas in the game were probably the space themed area, the cuckoo clock, the snowglobe and the music-themed area but legit every area has something cool and fun to offer,, bloody great soundtrack too!!Plus, not only is the game constantly entertaining through it’s gameplay, the story is rly bloody engaging too! Even though the game has constant wacky setpieces after the other, it’s incredible how throughout it tells a legit really personal story about two people just trying to fix their broken relationship! Cody and May start out the game legit unlikable at points because of how toxic their relationship became and how oblivious they are to how it affects their daughter Rose, which results in one specific section of the game that was so surreally dark that it left me nearly tearing up over how guilty it makes you feel. The game rly is all about identifying the problems in relationships and ultimately working together to make it better again,, on top of just being rly funny 😂😂 . Dr. Hakim especially has so many quotable lines and moments throughout! (RelationSHIT to RelationSHIP!!)SO YEAH this game was great! And it was so much fun playing it through with Emm!! Cannot wait to see what Hazelight and Josef Fares do next and if they’ll even be able to top this!! Till then tho,, adiós 😀!!!!

author: KHFan20
review: Great game, Hazelight has come a long way from Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons (which I reviewed negatively). A Way Out was leagues better, but still a bit rough around the edges. It Takes Two has some of the best game design to come out within the last 10 years, the game is oozing creativity and innovation. There are many moments that made me say, "I don't think I've ever seen this in a video game before."With each new gameplay element the developers introduce, there was always that worry in the back of my mind: "is my ability gonna be as fun to use as my partners?" I'm happy to say that that moment never came where there was a "bad" section for either player, and the devs do a fantastic job of balancing out the co op abilities where one power doesn't really feel "better" than the other. They also managed to turn infamous annoying levels in video games (ice level, underwater level) into actual fun tasks to complete.The game sits at about 15 hours, but we had so much fun with it, it felt much shorter. A must buy for this year and many years to come. Grab your significant other, closest friend, hell, even your mom, I guarantee you'll have a blast playing this game with anybody.

author: pastelagave
review: It takes two is a beautiful exploration of a failing relationship and the effects of divorce on the family unit. The game explores the selfishness of the characters as they neglect to see the effects of miscommunication and unspoken expectations. The mastery animation, level design and attention to detail within every chapter is noticeable to the player. The co-op of this game truly relies on both players equally. There is plenty to explore and lots of hidden easter eggs that can be easily missed if you rush through the game. Disclaimer: I played for way less than 32 hours. I just happen to leave the game open for wayy longer.

author: Simply
review: Where do I start. Such a phenomenal game. A true masterpiece. From stunning quality of the background to the intricacies of the characters. Such a beautiful and wondrous story to back it up absolutely everything about this game I recommend. Throughout the whole experience my friend and I could not stop starring and gawking at everything. It really brings out the best in you. 10/10 would play 1000000 times over again.P.S.The daughter looks like a hobgoblin. Made the game still enjoyable :D

author: Red Hot Charmander
review: Played this with my wife, what a fun and well designed game. Its not mind blowing game of the year(or is it?), but its sure great at everything it does. A meaningful real story, level design and details were awesome, and length of content was not short, but not too long either. Lots of interactive fun things in each level. Something you and your current/future wife/husband can enjoy together without stressing out with high level skilled play. I played "A Way Out" with another friend, also a very solid co-op game from the same developer. Gonna be hard for them to beat "It Takes Two" though, this has set the bar for the 2 player cooperative game for me now. Can only wonder how Hazelight can outdo themselves on their next co-op adventure. I can't wait!

author: Muobman
review: Never have I hated a book like I have in this game. It Takes Two is the story of a husband and wife who are planning a divorce as they have grown apart over time. In a bid to save their marriage at the wish of their child, a magic book traps them in a nightmare dimension, where they inhabit the bodies of two dolls. In this realm, they can feel pain and die, but death does not offer an escape, the book can and will revive them until his unholy task is complete. The task in question? A gauntlet of deadly obstacles based on features in and around their own house. As they complete tasks, this malevolent deity periodically appears to torment them, and remind them that there will be no respite until they reconcile. The desperation of this scenario causes them to go to terrible lengths, and I found one scene in the game genuinely harrowing, so be aware that there are emotional gut punches in this game.In gameplay terms, this is a co-operative platformer that introduces new mechanics frequently enough to stay fresh, while also occasionally dipping a toe into other genres to further add variety. While many mechanics are a little shallow, all of these gameplay segments are carefully balanced so that nothing overstays its welcome, with new rules and mechanics introduced as soon as you have explored the full depths of the previous set. The game also contains a plethora of competitive minigames, which provide a nice breather and sideshow from the main game every now and then.The game is mechanically sound, and I encountered no major bugs while completing it online with a friend. The game and online functionality runs through EA Origin, so be aware that you will need to make or have an EA account in order to play it, as will your co-op partner (assuming you play online).This game is charming, funny and great fun to play through with a friend, and with the friend pass meaning that only one of you has to own the game, you owe it to yourself to play it.

The graphics are stunning (it lagged a little when I played with mouse and keyboard - but not with controller)It also gets pretty emotional (I cried a little)I can only recommend it, love it.

It's rare that I'm speechless but this is really a masterpiece of story-telling and game development.I bought it to lure my other half into playing games and despite her not having played anything before she really took to it. It helped us both work together and grow closer so honestly this has been one of the most rewarding games I've ever bought!Only downside is that I wished it never ended!

author: Krissi
review: I never review games and I just wanted to come by and tell everyone this is THE best co-op game I have ever played. Period. I always thought Portal 2 would never be dethroned but this takes the cake. The game never ever had a dull or slow moment. Every level a new mechanic is introduced. Every single character was unique. There were times where I was grinning from ear to ear with some of the stupid jokes that were made. My partner and I had a blast going head to head with the minigames scattered throughout the worlds.Please get this game. You can tell this was 100% a passion project and it's probably going to be on my mind for a LONG time.

author: Chubbs
review: THIS GAME IS AMAZING! At first I thought it was a little cringe, but I soon realised that was part of the game..... it comes across a little childish at the start bus that doesn't last long. This is my first steam review and possibly my last, I just had to do a review to show my respect for the hard work that went into this game. If you are looking for a CO-OP game, I couldn't recommend this enough. Trippy levels, great humour, awesome game play and beautiful graphics. Every time you get to a new area it feels like a completely different game so there is no risk of getting bored. The challenges / puzzle are at a good difficulty so new and experienced gamers can both enjoy. The best part about this game is how long it goes for (12+ hours), and when you do finally finish the game you can play it again as the opposite character..I played this game with my girlfriend who is currently in Spain and I am in Australia (can't really get much further away). Even with her bad quality internet we experience no lag or any issues which straight away is a big plus for me. Get this game, you won't regret it.

author: i go i go
review: probably the most fun cooperative game or game in general like i dont even remember when was the last time i laughed and enjoyed this much playing video games. everything is so on point with the mechanic constantly changing to keep things fresh, engaging and not boring or repetitive. despite the cartoon art style which is usually not my cup of tea, my friend and i were in awe at some of the work that felt very much real and captivating that we had to literally stop and take a long look at. and finally the soundtracks - very much gives me the vibe of those old disney cartoon, somehow balance with the intense gameplay with its calming, chilling feeling. absolutely chef's kiss!

author: Crypher
review: I have played this game with about 5 other people. What's truly amazing about this game is that only one person needs to buy it. Your friends can either play locally or online through the friends pass.There is a very diverse range of game mechanics throughout the game. Each chapter introduces new obstacles and tools for you to problem solve with making each chapter unique. The puzzles required to solve are challenging enough to where you can still enjoy the game and not get frustrated on your first playthrough. My first playthrough took about nine hours. However I have easily spent another 10 hours of playtime just playing the minigames with the same friend. I have discovered something new each time I've played. Whether its a new mini-game, easter-egg or small detail. They are always a wonder to come across.The game is  and runs smoothly despite having to render two different perspectives most of the game. There are very few instances where I experienced frame drops.

author: MastaTGT
review: Get it. Its fun.This games story is not the best thing. The characters in the game are memorable however. Each section in the game is new, creative, and makes the experience all the more enjoyable. I say the story isn't the best thing because it just feels strange. The book you meet in the game is probably the most entertaining character I've personally encountered in quite awhile. The game does have moments that make you question the parenting skills of the characters you play as.The gameplay is the most enjoyable part about this game as it is super creative and diverse. You are taken on a journey and the game is basically sectioned off throughout this journey so you are in many different settings. From being in a toys view of a childs room to having a streetfighter-esque battle with a squirrel on a toy plane. It's pretty fascinating how the maps change and my favorite setting was definitely the space area. Each section gives you the tools you need to complete the area and the tools are always used in creative ways. The game makes you not only think through the puzzles your faced with but forces you to work with your partner/significant other/friend to get through the game. It's pretty fricken rad.The graphics in this game are great. Not amazing and not terrible. The designs for the characters are super cool and you can definitely see the creativity that went into the designs for each stage in this game. I didn't have any issues with the controls throughout the gameplay. Audio was great too. The voice acting in it wasn't as cringe as I've heard in many other games. The ONLY confusing thing about the game audio for me was the childs VA. Music was great in this game, They even bring you into an old school juke box which was super cool!!I have to recommend this to anyone looking for a co-op game to play with someone. I don't think anyone should be discouraged from playing this game just because of the stories "relationship fixing" topic. It is worth playing. I want more games like this. It was just fun. There's plenty of games that demand skills, teamwork, and have in depth customization's and rich stories which aren't bad things but I do miss just being able to pick up a game and have some ridiculous fun. This game allowed me to do that and I appreciate that feeling.Rating 9/10

author: Odu_Wan
review: Having said that, if you can swap the story away to the background, and consider it a slightly ill-chosen set-up for an adventure, then there's a lot about It Takes Two to enjoy. This is a rare kind of co-op experience, with an energy and imagination and playfulness that sometimes rivals Nintendo's. As a toy, it can be a joy, and it will create some co-op moments to remember.

We had a lot of laughs and even some deep moments while playing. I would recommend to everyone + the graphics, gameplay, and storyline where amazing!! Thanks for making this is. review: Really good game!Played it with a big friend of mine and we had a lot of fun, has a lot of different gameplay mechanics and it's really able to surprise you when you thought you had already seen it all! Overall a great game, has good graphics and a catchy and fun storietelling.I really like that only I had to buy the game, my friend played the free version that only requires one user to have the game, I think more games should have the same tool, since the game is so expensive (and they have all the rights for it because it's a great game and wasn't surelly cheap to produce)I do surelly recommend it, it's really fun when you play it with someone close to you! Have fun!PS: Only downside to it is that after my computer bluescreened once I lost all my in game progress but thankfully was able to find help on reddit! If the same thing happened to you, feel free to message me and I will happily help you!*Only had around 5 hours in the game when I made this review, ended up beating the game twice with different people just for how fun the game actually is, on my now 32 hours playtime I can say the game got everything I was expecting right and proved to be even better than what I hoped it to be! I recomend it for sure!

author: butcho
review: Ok guys, here's the thing...listen up: If you have someone that you really care about, wife, fiancé, girl friend, best buddy, doesn't really matter as long as you are in good company when this person is around. So if that is the case I highly recommend you get this game and have the time of your life. Insanely fun experience.

author: Feral
review: 15+ Years on Steam, with 400+ games, and I have never written a review before until this game. It is absolutely a magical experience to share this with your significant other. It's wholesome, beautiful, fun, and tugs at your heart strings in all directions. The detail and love that the team has put into this game is an absolute treasure. Every chapter, every sequence is unique. The little details in each biome, even if it played no significant part in the story shows how much they wanted to bring this world to life.   This is a game that will help break the barrier to entry into video games, to show how beautiful the art form can be. Nothing but love for this game as it has made a foothold into my heart as one of the best co-op games ever to be made.

author: Insane Crash!
review: This is an amazingly cute game :) the graphics are really beautiful, with many different sceneries covered, and with each scenery comes a pair of mechanics for the two characters that complement each other. It's not that difficult, but that makes it accessible for non-players as well (so you can play it with your partner even if he/she doesn't play video games frequently). The mini games against each other are hit and miss, some are fun, some rather not. Racing in high speed across icy cliffs or rails is a lot of fun. And the fact that one player can buy the game for around 40 bucks and another player can join for free, is awesome. So awesome, that I felt compelled to write this review :) try it out.

author: Chalupacabra
review: It's honestly practically perfect. It's a co-op masterpiece.It's emotionally poignant, absolutely hilarious, varied in its set pieces and gameplay, with each level being wholly unique. Nothing feels recycled. It's just point blank one of the greatest games I have ever played.Do yourself a favor and pick this up.

author: yourOceanman
review: This game is literally my dream game. I've been searching for a game to play with a friend and this game was perfect for it. The game is filled with action, fantasy and very fun mini-games that can distract you for hours itself. It is so creative and interesting. Even the graphic design is so beautiful. The story is funny and emotional at the same time and captures you. It is a game with jump-and-run elements but it has so many suprises. I cant express my love for this game enough. Thank you for making this game. Thank you for letting me and my friend have the best time ever.

author: Albino Gorilla
review: Fantastic co-op game, can't say enough good things about it. The co-op mechanics were clever and inspired, the level design was great, and the environment and character design was truly excellent. They put a ton of thought and effort into every minor detail and interaction, and it shows. The dialog and characters were a bit weird at times, but in a charming kind of way that worked - like Hakim was so annoying it became kind of endearing after a while. Having the friends-pass was also a great choice, even if it meant only selling one copy for every 2 players.

review: One of the best co-op games ever.The game feels like a Disney/Pixar-esque movie, stunning visuals.The game-play mechanics are constantly refreshed so it never gets old.The Friend's Pass system is pretty neat, so only one of you need to purchase the game.

author: Rgalls
review: LOVED this game so much. I was sad when it ended because my boyfriend and I could play it forever. Great team building co-op game. We could play together on one screen, on different screens in the same room, or online when we weren't together. Made for fun versatile play. They somehow incorporated practically every game style in one short game from rail grinding to Mortal Kombat style fighting to Portal reminiscent puzzles. Loved to find all the mini games as well (makes for some replay-ability).Our only issues come from technical issues. I wish that game studios would allow their developers as much time as needed, because there are definitely known bugs. The biggest of all being our save file disappeared one day. Luckily someone has their completed save file uploaded online that we were able to download so we didn't have to start over. But we did lose all our recorded wins and losses in the mini games. There were also some glitches with the boss battles where we had to start over because things weren't showing up on the screen. Other than that though, we had loads of fun and would definitely recommend to any couple or or couple of friends who love co-op games.

author: Matt
review: This game was a blast of game mechanics and changing gameplay! I played this with my girlfriend and we both agree that this game is and was awesome. The level design and how everything looked, made you want to look around everywhere and just explore. The minigames and little things you could find in the levels were lovely and a lot of fun!! I would deffinetly reccomend this game too those that like platformers and Co-op adventures! This game in my opinion is by far one of my favorite games ever, and the best game i have played this year!

author: -J3SSEJAMES-
review: Absolutely love this game, it has a very strong story-line and I love how the Friend's Pass is free! I played the full story with my husband then again with my cousin-in-law! At first the split-screen is odd considering we have our own screens, but it becomes very natural after the Prologue and it's actually quite cool to be able to see what they other player is doing - it's also a nice concept for anybody spectating your gameplay. Would highly recommend, great story, great gameplay, hours and hours of fun, you will not regret it!

author: chakster
review: I've played about 75% of the game so far with my gf, and it's probably some of the most ingenius level design i've ever seen. Each level endows the two players with different abilities, and you can't progress without working together. I love the puzzles, and more so, I love the sense of movement in every scene. There's a certain joy to it I can't explain.It's not... perfect tho. The storyline is so-so (it tries too hard sometimes). But most annoyingly, you can't switch the splitscreen positions. May is always on the left, and Cody on the right. We have one controller, and my gf prefers mouse and keyboard, so i have to sit on the left, but control the right screen. @Hazelight, please release a patch for this simple issue!

This masterpiece of a game has such a high standard of game play and has kept my levels of enjoyment to the maximum from the beginning to its conclusion. The game's story is immersive, the visuals are breathtaking, soundtrack is great. Can't help but give praise to such an amazing game and its totally worth the purchase.

Non-stop new mechanics to keep the game interesting. And on top of all of that I learned how to have a COLLABORATIVE relationship! Its's a must have.

author: SiN
review: It takes two is a strong contender in this year's The Game Awards. The central plot is easy to emphathize and works to promote the game's main feature, coop. You and your partner will control two characters that must help each other in other to overcome hardships, both physical and emotional.The gameplay is smooth from start to finish, packed with highly polished mini-games that help push forward the intricacies of the plot.Visuals are stunning, from lush foliage environments to incredibly decorated and colorful bedrooms, you will almost always have something interesting or beautiful to look at.Sound design is immersive, with the OST pushing and pulling at your heartstrings as needed.This is a must play for people of all ages, find yourself a partner, jump into it and you will not regret it.10/10.

review: Easily one of the best co-op game I've ever playedEach level's difficulty were perfectly balanced with insane details to the ambienceAll puzzle and boss fights were rewarding and satisfying go throughAlongside with all the minigames you get to compete against your partner were fun and easy to adapt toThe length of the cutsences were never too long or boring to go through and the graphics were just stunningOverall, this game is 100% worth the money for the amount of efforts and time the game develop team has put into

author: Muffin Shamwow™
review: I've not finished this game yet, but I'm far enough in to give it my opinion. And boy...This game is incredible. Usually I'll play a game and appreciate it for certain aspects like the art style, the soundtrack, gameplay etc. But with this game, I'm constantly thinking about how creative the developers must be to come up with some of the concepts, level designs and story telling. It's awesome, the boss fights are fun, the puzzles are clever, the story in fascinating, the world building is incredible. I really love how this game has turned out to be, my expectations were somewhat high based off what I heard and they exceeded my expectations beyond what I could've imagined :OI massively recommend this game, it's really enjoyable :)

author: FiBiE007
review: I first heard of this game on Twitch where I watched a bit of gameplay. I checked the steam site of it and was surprised what hides behind this rather plain presentation. Quickly I decided to play It Takes Two with a friend who is also into coop-games.The graphics leave nothing to be desired. Textures are super clean, the lighting looks almost too good for standard rasterization and the cut scenes are well made, even though they lack a bit behind the gameplay (third person) graphics quality. The game looks great. All areas create a very distinct atmosphere which lovely portray custom art styles and themes. It is just a pleasure to look around and explore the levels.This one is a weird offset (not quality wise) to the otherwise consistent experience. There are no spoilers included. When you first look at the game it becomes clear that the main story is oriented towards a younger audience. In combination with the graphics and the general goal of the game, one would imagine the story to be not shallow but also not too deep. As it turned out at two specific points in the story it is quite macabre, even brutal. If there was an uncut version for adults, this could well be a horror game sometimes. How the main goal unfolds gives lots of opportunities for the game to show its potential. It is a linear quest line, but well, sometimes hidden, placed minigames are a welcome variation. Playing through the levels makes a lot of fun. A 100% run by exploring everything and playing all the minigames takes 15 hours.The biggest strength of It Takes Two are the coop mechanics. The whole game is a series of coop passages and parkours. All coop elements fit perfectly into each theme and range from an easy to lower-moderate difficulty. The controls feel responsive which makes the fine-motor parts an ease to handle. Some passages demand more coordination and others not as much. Not a single coop passage feels out of place - quite the contrary. Sure, not all of them are particularly sophisticated but none is tedious. It Takes Two shows perfectly that it does not take much to have lots of fun. Sometimes the little things and this one specific detail that makes one smile make the difference.I really recommend playing it. Only one of the players must buy it (the other one can play via the free Friend's Pass). On a weekend with some time, you will have a nice memorable gaming experience.

author: SteadFastLee
review: YES! YOU ONLY NEED TO BUY  TO PLAY IT WITH SOMEONE! The other player only needs to download the co-op version for FREE.*Highly recommend for people looking for a co-op game. *Tight controls and puzzles that are a good challenge for anyone who loves platform/puzzle genre. Lots of silly references sprinkled everywhere. *Filled with throwbacks to many types of video games but with stunning visuals that immerse the player in the game. Some parts look like the developers took acid for inspiration but in a cool way.*There are fun mini-games to find hidden around the game and navigation by jumping between chapters gives you an opportunity to find them all.*The driving 'support character' is obnoxious as f*** but you can skip most cutscenes (can skip all that involve that annoying character). It's obvious to the point where there is a hidden achievement you get for skipping all cutscenes that involve the said annoying character.*The game is only somewhat symmetrically balanced in terms of challenge. If you're playing as May, you usually have the harder side of puzzles. If you're Cody, you're usually the unga bunga side of puzzles.

author: MXK
review: Ok so this game was absolutely insane. Best game I've ever played in my life. Find a good friend or significant other and play through this game, it will bring you so close together. You will laugh, get mad at each other, and cry together. The controls are absolutely perfect. The graphics are so beautiful. I was mad at first having to spend so much on a game, but best 30 bucks I've ever spent. Game on average will take you about 12 hours to beat. It will throw you back to many memories from sonic, mario, crash bandicoot, little big planet, and even mario kart. 5 stars all the way, you've really set a new standard for co-op games.

author: Phishie
review: Every facet of this game is perfect. The graphics, story, characters, the movement, everything. It's all flawless. There are no bugs that I've come across too. It's like playing through a Pixar movie including the stellar modern graphics. The designers clearly studied and beautifully mapped every environment and thought out every little detail present. The dialogue is fantastic along with the voice acting. It perfectly revolves around its concept of requiring two players, in the most fun way possible.Cannot recommend this title enough, 10/10.

author: AfronTheDon
review: I'll start by saying this, the game is a 10/10 masterpiece. It features some of the best story pacing/writing and character development in recent history. The game-play is never uninteresting with its diverse and expansive worlds, free for you to explore and enjoy mini-games with your friend. The attention to detail is like watching a magnum opus unfold, from little things like snow footprints to the characters models looking supple and feeling soft to the eyes. The abilities the protagonists use through the story are always fun and interesting never lacking in creativity. The game introduces you to Hakim which is one of the best characters in the story especially for comic relief, the action in the game is fluid, the somber tones are impactful and accompanied with an amazing score. The calm moments divert your gaze from the characters themselves to the world around you, where the more you look the more detail you'll find. The puzzles were never difficult enough to hinder the experience while still leaving room for you and your duo to have light-hearted fun in figuring them out. The Easter eggs are impressive referencing older games, music, and events; there's even an Easter egg about the devs previous game A Way Out. And lastly the mini-games are in no way a driving factor in the main story but they still feel like something you should do, due to the massively explorable world; They offer solace, a good challenge, and competitive fun for you and your friend. Over all rating 10/10 If you want an experience that will stick with you this is the game to buy.

author: headsho111
review: The game is THE best co-op game i ever played.No wasteful stuff you are forced to do. Simply progression. We completed 2 chapters by now and there is no repetition. So you will have 9 chapters of non-repetetive game play which is like ~20h game play for 2 people. The chapters are designed in a similar way. in the beginning each player get a tool/gadget/weapon which he will wield for that chapter. These stuff will interact with the equipment of the other player and you need to work together and talk to each other to solve the puzzles and progress further. Each chapter seems to have an endboss, which needs to be defeated with these tools.Every action, every control a player gets has a weight behind and its so much fun to fulfill each step and see the other player succeed in his/her tasks. Most of the game is in split screen. and you can track, what the other player is doing, which sounds clunky, but adds to the fun.100% recommendation!

Thank you for this experience, truly a work of art.

author: Keaton901
review: It Takes Two is a truly fantastic co-op player experience. Across the 15 hours it took my brother and I to complete it we enjoyed an array of various puzzles, challenges and boss fights. Every section introduced new mechanics and I can definitely say that at no point did the game feel like it was dragging.The world looks great, and the story was perfectly serviceable. Actually, I enjoyed it more than I expected to. All the characters were well voiced and interesting, and Dr Hakim was a lot of fun when he got involved.I would say the only downside is that the game can be quite easy - but since we were always moving through new environments so quickly that was never much of a downside.We also never had any problems with the origin launcher. Overall, if you want a very fun, fairly long co-op experience than you should definitely try It Takes Two!

author: Balakae.Exe
review: Oh, my god. This is easily top 3 of my co op games I have ever played, I have a short and long review.Short: If the book did not exist this game would be 2 minutes, 10/10Long: This game is truly a beautiful masterpiece, first, the ability that our friend play free is a true gift from the devs, seriously thank you for that. Second, the graphics in this game are superb, they are beautiful and never fail and my computer ran 60fps 24/7. Third, cut scenes, I normally hate too many cut scenes, but this game was perfectly binded with them, they were AMAZIMGLY animated and looked so smooth to where it looked better that some actual movies animation. Fourth, story, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ the story is incredible, you see these two people who almost hate each other really change throughout the story, god I was so heart warmed by the end which I normally am not since I am a lunatic :). Lastly, Mechanics, this game shows how mechanics can be combined to really make a game, this game gives you new mechanics and trades them out fast, but not too fast so they are fun to use but never get boring. Also the soundtrack is amazing.This game is easily a 10/10, get it even though it is a bit pricey, it was 100% worth it, Thank you for this masterpiece, It was a lot of fun.

author: Whaels
review: This game is just amazing, everything about it. The areas were all very creative and different, the fights were all tough but rewarding, the music and sound design was on point. The platforming and puzzles were tough enough to make you think but not hard enough to be stuck for hours on one puzzle. The platforming was also very smooth and felt very good jumping and swinging around the areas. I cannot recommend this game enough.

author: Moh1110
review: It Takes Two has gotten a lot of recognition and very positive feedback and reviews. But let me tell you something about this game. This game is way better than you will think. Going in I knew it would be good but I didn't know it would be this great. I got this game mainly to play with my gf and so far we have had a blast playing it. It's definitely one of our favorite games now and from start to finish it brings nothing but joy and laughter throughout the entire journey. We have shared so many laughs and since we can even see each other's pov it brings lots of joy watching your partner fail something so easy. The mini-games are just purely fun and enjoyable to play and to be competitive with. We haven't finished the game just yet but we definitely will. Overall this game is phenomenal down to its core. It feels like a new fresh game, the visuals are beautiful and colorful, and laughs are guaranteed. It Takes Two will definitely create great fun memories and also brings back a certain nostalgic feel to you. 100/10!

author: Lunaurora
review: Cute, creative gameplay! Does require you to have an Origin account in order to launch the game, but that wasn't a problem for me as I already have one. The cinematic nature of the game is beautiful, and the different cooperative puzzles are clever and original. Haven't finished it yet but my partner and I both love it and are having lots of fun exploring together!

I can't wait to see what their next game will be. They've had my curiosity and they now have my full undivided attention.♥♥♥♥ the oscars btwReview (or update your review) for a game you've nominated

author: LuNaTiCPuffs
review: This game was absolutely amazing, it's an adventure story-wise. Co-op is so cleverly made and makes it really enjoyable to blend each other's abilities to progress through puzzles. Really don't have anything negative to say from my experience of the game. Stirs some emotions, makes you think about relationships a little deeper. Overall huge amounts of fun, extremely well thought out levels, awesome game mechanics and multiple styles of gameplays. It works very well and I really recommend to play with a friend or sibling or spouse or whatever, just go have fun with someone!

author: Onimari
review: Literally the most gorgeous game I ever had the opportunity to play through. It contained such smooth transitions and wonderful dialogue. I never felt like there was a major dull moment! It entirely helped because of who i played with as well! We had a wonderful time together and enjoyed every bit of it just bouncing back and forth off each others energy in every scene. Definitely recommend getting this game if you want to enjoy a touching story and wonderful game play! couldn't recommend this game any higher ~! 10/10 where is It Takes THREE??

author: Slumber
review: Wow, where to begin...I don't normally ever write reviews for games I play since I feel it's kind of a waste of time, but It takes two is that once in a lifetime exception.This game is by far one of the most beautiful, touching stories I've ever had the pleasure of experiencing. Each act has a fresh perspective and the mechanics you're given to work with are simply yet extremely satisfying to use. Even more impressive when compared to most other games released in this day and age was how polished everything felt. I've done QA years ago and have an eye for finding bugs or mistakes, but this game had hardly any at all and even then those found were just minor cosmetics more than anything.Story wise, everything is just so well thought out, nothing overly complex, just a deep understanding of core emotions we all go through on our day to day. The build up to the end doesn't feel rushed and you can feel the story grow organically which again, is seldom found in this day and age of quick release games.You'll laugh, you'll cry, you'll be amazed at everything this game has to offer and if you play with a loving partner, I can guarantee you both will come out the other end feeling even more admiration for each other.Hazelight, makers of "A way out" and "Brothers", has added another masterpiece to their library of masterpieces and I look forward to what comes next.10/10A+++A story all should experience once in their life

author: Kronos
review: A fun, engaging, story driven game perfect for couples. It has beautiful graphics, witty dialogue, and a great variety of gameplay that is just challenging enough to keep you on your toes while still being a casual game to enjoy with a partner. My girlfriend and I love this game.

Novice players that hasn't used a WASD before may have some troubles. It looks like it's casual-player-friendly but it's not. Both players has to have a tiny bit of video game experience. You wont be able to play it with your grandma for example.Also, there's no replayability unless you change your girlfriend/boyfriend and play with the new one lol :)Just kidding, buy the game already.

author: Eebz
review: Amazing storytelling, fantastic and creative use of art / assets and 'being small in a large world'. This game impressed me and the lady all the way to the credits.The parents are a bit cringey and dare I say, 'horrible parents' in general, but man this title is definitely one of the best coop puzzler platformers I've played.The coop gameplay never stagnates as you are constantly changing roles and scenery throughout.Pick this one up! With the Friend Pass, you don't even have to buy a copy for your partner!Enjoy!

author: TTV||Cdog_
review: It takes two is a delightful look into how we all felt, and what we wish we could have done to our parents when they told us they were getting divorced. The puzzles demand both players work together to achieve the goals in the level. You might be asking “how do I know if I should play this game?”    - Do you and your significant other fight a lot? Play it   - Do you have father/mother issues? Play it   - Do you have a friend whose parents got divorced? Play it   - Are you and your best friend fighting a lot more now days? Play it   - Did you already get divorced and want something to do with your kid? Play itPersonally I am playing this game with my partner, and it has been a really fun experience. We never tire of trying to find new ways to kill each other in Coop games. This game is no exception. If you love this genre I’d say pick it up right away, and even if you don’t it’s still a solid buy for gamers/non gamers alike! It Takes Two gains a solid 9.5 broken families out of 10

author: badonkers

Definitely a good way to see how well two people work together and how similarly ya'll think. Great story line and all together a great game, hope to see more games like this one.

It Takes Two is full worth the money and I would highly recommend it for anyone that wants a great story game to play with a friend.

author: Down Bad
review: Awesome game. There was basically nothing bad I could find through my playthrough. Definitely worth full price if you're a fan of a good story and puzzles. The puzzles in the game are simple enough to figure out for either a casual or more-hardcore gamer, but still challenging enough to make you stop and think for a moment. It may be difficult at times but the game is very forgiving to players. There is lots of variation in each chapter so it's fresh and fun while generally not long enough to become too repetitive.It took roughly 12 hours to complete with a friend, including messing around at many points and trying out each minigame. The main story, at my estimate, would take about 10.5 hours to complete.Pros:- Nice story- *Excellent* game design- Fun puzzles and minigames- Lots of variation, keeps it very fresh- ONLY ONE COPY OF THE GAME IS NEEDED> And more.. that I can't currently name. Lots of positives here.Cons:- Requires a second player (BUT ONLY ONE COPY IS NEEDED!!), so you're missing out if you can't find anyone- Goes through the Origin platform/EA servers (EA servers seemed to have gone down at one time)Bugs encountered:- Controller was stuck vibrating right before end scene (might've been my problem; fixed when tabbed out)- Shield bugged out and wouldn't deploy at one required section, had to restart section (annoying but no biggie, checkpoint real close)Overall, one very solid game that I could put on a list of favorites. Wholesome, though can be dark at times. No spoilers. Just play it.10/10

author: Brondo765
review: By far one of the best co-op experiences ever created. It is just too good not to play with a friend or significant other. The amount of in-game mechanics is mind boggling, every level feels unique. The story, albeit simple, is a very fun and gratifying ride to experience. Over the course of the game Cody and May strive to return to their normal bodies. However, they are side-tracked constantly by their new bodies, personal disagreements, and "The Book of Love" AKA Dr. Hakim. With each passing stage/level, Cody and May attempt to fix their relationship by overcoming physical, emotional, and mental challenges. Each level introduces a new notion/spin on how to remedy a problem that could occur in a love-based relationship. The biggest problem Cody and May face is by far communication but there are a ton of other real-world lessons that you could incorporate into your own personal/future relationships.I don't want to reveal a ton more as I believe you need to experience the game without any prior knowledge to truly appreciate the level design, game mechanics, and story.Overall this game is a solid 9.5/10, it has the right message and great gameplay to keep many people engaged over the course of the entire story.

author: ttv.TENAXIS™
review: This game, is just wow, this game is an easy PERFECT 10/10!! Just a brilliant game! Easy contender for my choice for Game of the Year 2021. You MUST play this game, this is one of those games that I will frequently revisit and I will always have fond memories of my adventures in this game with my partner. This is what it would looks like if Pixar made a game: lovely art, lovely story, brilliant characters, amazing gameplay.First thing first, the smartest they did with this game is that only one player needs to buy the game. The second player can simply download a friend pass and able to play by joining the player that bought the game. That is just AMAZING, especially coming from an EA published game.Secondly, this game is VERY non-gamer friendly. It is PERFECT for those who have a partner who is not familiar with gaming. It is THAT well designed and welcoming. On top of the amazing art direction.As the title suggest this game is MUST be played with two players. This is a platforming game with an incredibly heartwarming story. The levels are built brilliantly surrounded by creatively designed levels and smart puzzles. The characters are well written and there isn't a single unmemorable character, including the bosses you face throughout the game.On top of the amazing levels, the game also have mini-games scattered throughout the game where you and your partner can face head-on against each other. Creating fun little detours for you and your partner.If I list all the things I love about this game, that review will be able to serve as a thesis for a PhD. This game is just brilliant, get it, play with a friend/partner and go on the amazing adventures that were laid out by the developers. This is an instant classic.

author: Mosquito
review: Truely a game that showcases the dedication and hard work that was put in it. The story and plot, the characters and voice-actors, the gameplay and mechanics, the settings and environments... and last but definitely not least, the MU-SIC...!It all harmonizes so well and I think that's because they were not afraid to use all of their inspiration and put that in to their creative work. The friend's pass is really something that should be embraced by more companies that create co-op games within the industry, as it gives you that "hey, wanna come over and play some videogames"... type of vibe, and we all deserve that treat sometimes. I bought the game and had the full experience with a friend, who undoubtly enjoyed his treat, aswell.I honestly cannot wait for the future releases from Hazelight, they've really taken it up a notch with this one. Hands down, this game offered one of the best co-op experiences I've had in a few years.

The only downside is that sometimes it did not save the progress so we had to play the level again. The story is touching and very fun to play. I am really excited for the next game from this studio.

author: b00n96
review: COOOOOOOOOOOODDDYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYNot even done and this game is amazing. I would say it's my top  5 favorite games of all time after Portal 2, Breath of the Wild.Every idea made me want to come back and play moreI have to say, May is the better character in terms of gameplay. She gets all the better weapon/gameplay mechanics

author: Agent Zero
review: I can't put into words how incredibly PERFECT It Takes Two is! And honestly, I was quite sad to know that I finished the game...I haven't enjoyed a game as much as It Takes Two in a long time. I can easily say that It Takes Two is the BEST game of 2021. I would even go as far as to say that it is one of the best games I have ever played. It is literally the perfect co-op game. Everything about it is amazing: great and emotional story, beautiful graphics, breath-taking world design (and especially a great variety of locations), characters with unique personalities (Cody, May, The Book of Love, princess elephant and many more), humour, fun, incredibly good gameplay, etc. It's just awesome from start to finish. And the friend pass from EA makes it possible to play this game with another friend. Great idea.The best thing about the game is really how varied it is. The gameplay is constantly changing, for example by giving you new abilities, changing your perspective, the environments are very different (which made me want to explore every corner of the game. Something I haven't done in a long time), mini-games, etc.For once, this is a game that is worth the full price (if not even more)! Absolutely recommended purchase. BEST GAME 2021 and BEST COOP game I have EVER PLAYED.I really don't know how the developers and writers got so freaking creative.

author: Tayte
review: I played this game with my Girlfriend. She is rather freshly into video games, I have played several thousand of hours. We both think it wouldn't do the game justice not to leave a review. Simply put: This is the best game we have ever played.There are so many different references, so many different mechanics, so many beautiful sceneries... To be able to explore all that together with someone, in such a cleverly designed way. Marvellous.I would without a doubt recommend this game to anyone looking for a joyous, exciting and breathtaking adventure. Just keep in mind - it does take two.

author: BiGDaDDy
review: Made me realise how the industry is sleeping on fun entertaining linear co-op games. There was never an instance of boring game play or levels being too mundane or unimaginative or unpolished.  Can't think of anything to nitpick upon.

author: Enitya

author: SurprisedPikachuFace
review: A masterpiece of a game! A feast for the eyes and ears in terms of graphics, atmosphere and music. My best friend and I kept saying during the entire play through, "Wow this is a gorgeous game!" "Wow this is so much fun!" It is well worth the $40 to buy it, plus a friend can play for FREE!!! Thank you Hazelight for making this amazing and unforgettable game! I hope this will earn a game award of some kind at the end of the year, it would be well deserved!

author: Joetatoes
review: A few hours in and its already easily one of the best co-op experiences my partner and I have ever had. This includes previous titles the publisher has made which we also enjoyed, but this new game blows them out of the water. The humour and gameplay compliment one another fantastically. Never have I felt areas were too repetitive, which is rare/unheard of for a platform game. This is achieved through each new chapter introducing it's own gameplay mechanics assigning both players their own specific roles which require teamwork and communication to coordinate together to achieve success. It has great replay value too in this sense, as replaying as the opposite character will give a new experience with different gameplay mechanics. It's a really clever new IP and I recommend this to anyone looking  for a fresh and fun co-op experience. It's honestly raised the bar for co-op and platform puzzle solving games for me and I hope other developers look to this game as an example of how to excute this style of game well.

author: Lachigan

author: Risechi
review: Charming game with lots of polish. Do be warned, it isn't a particularly hard game, so if you're a challenge seeker it's probably not for you. If you're fine with a laidback game then prepare for an awesome ride.

author: Lukewarm_Chowder
review: My girlfriend and I split the cost of this game and played together using the friend's pass while she has been at home for the Summer. Overall I can only give this game a positive review. The cooperative game play was fun and exciting, the mini games (that we found) were competitive and enjoyable to experience, and the story was fantastic! Each level gave us fun new abilities to play around with that worked off of each other to provide an awesome two-player collaborative experience.I will say that we did experience a few bugs throughout the experience that caused a hiccup or two during our playthrough, but nothing game-breaking!Also it is important to note that even if you are playing together online, the game forces you to play with a dynamic vertical split-screen. This wasn't a problem for us, though, as this was definitely intended to be a part of the experience! It was actually rather helpful at times! 10/10 best divorce simulator on the market

author: Same Desu
review: This game is incredible.Gameplay- 10/10 smooth, responsive, and extremely creative. not once did the gameplay get dull or repetitive. it always introduced something new.Visuals- 10/10 this game is stunning. there are so many parts of this game that look incredible, not only that, but the places and setting they drop you in are all amazingsoundtrack 7/10 fit very well for all of the portions of the game, however there were only a few moments where i truly loved the music as much as the reststory 8/10 just a classic story of a couple fixing a marraige, but its done very well. the progress they make seems real and unrushed. all in all this game has incredible visuals, incredible gameplay, a great soundtrack, and a great story. to top it all off, this game has some fantastic references to other franchises and titles. all and all an absolute banger of a game. definitely worth more than 40 bucks and if your friend lets you play it for free, you should suck them off. 9.5/10 (the .5 deduction is for inducing rainbow road flashbacks. you know what you did game)

author: Julianne Stingray
review: An unmatched co-op experience that focuses on different abilities and how they compliment each other. The art direction and sound design for this game are incredible, especially with such a small team. The game is around 8 or so hours, where no moment feels slow or unnecessary, and the constant action and touching moments leave you wanting more.

author: Dr DJ Cheese Wiz
review: This went from divorce simulator to how to be a bad parent real quick. Fun mechanics. Interesting story. Play games with your friend (if you have one) 9/10EDIT: WARNING!! SPIDER!EDIT 2: TWO BIG SPIDERS!that is all.

author: Dungeon
review: By far the best coop game I've ever played with around 9-10 ish hours of content. You, and the person you play with, do not to be super into games to have an amazing time. There are several chapters, each of which introduces a completely new environment and game mechanics for both of the 2 main characters that are so well implemented, they could have made an entire game alone off of some of the mechanics. The story, despite being linear and basic, was pulled off really well and I can't help but feel that this was a passion project that was lucky enough to thrive: especially given that it is a game developed by EA. The game is a bit pricey but once u consider the fact only 1 person has to buy it and the other person only needs to install a friend pass to play for free, it becomes a reasonable value proposition.10/10 highly recommended. I would be VERY surprised if anyone disliked their time playing this game.

author: sickserenity
review: As a lover of co-op games that has a boyfriend who is NOT a lover of co-op games who also gets very frustrated very quickly, this game had both of us playing non-stop! The entirety of the game is so creatively thought-up. The story is simple, yet extremely well executed. The voice acting is superb with dialogue that really draws you into the characters. The game doesn't punish you for dying, it simply allows you and your partner to have fun, laugh-off your mistakes and encourages you to mess with one another when the opportunity is given. The mini games are so unique compared to anything I've played before, while catering to each area you're in to make them fit that part of the story as well as utilizing some of the tools you currently have equipped. The game is beautiful, charming, unique in just about every way I can think of and perfect for gamers of all levels. I typically don't go towards puzzle based co-op games like this, I usually go for shooters or RPGs, but this game pulled me in completely with how different it looked. Absolutely worth the money, especially since you can play with someone with only one copy of the game! Kudos to these developers! I look forward to your next co-op title! <3

author: Jas_Hol
review: Where do I start with a review of this game? I guess the best way would be to go by my own initial impression & despite really good reviews, my first impression wasn't good, I had no attachment to any of the characters & in fact some initially annoyed me. However! Once my friend an I started playing & pushed past the initial slow start the game started to reveal it's true beauty, not only is it graphically gorgeous, but the co-op mechanics are by far some of the best I've ever experienced in any game! This is an absolute GEM of a game to play with a friend, boss battles are intense & so satisfying to complete & because you play such different roles it has replay value too.10/10

author: Jan-Klaas vom Deich
review: I don't remember the last time I had this much fun with any game. It Takes Two is an absolute masterpiece that has everything: innovative and varying gameplay elements, loveable characters, a charming story and tons of references to different video games and genres. I particularly loved the amazingly inventive boss fights and, of course, Dr. Hakim – the most hilarious and amiable character to appear in a game.It Takes Two is easily one of the best games I've ever played. The amount of creativity and effort invested is just incredible – especially considering the limitations of Hazelight as a relatively small studio. Imo a must-have for every gamer.

This is not going to be a game you play for 100 hours, but it delivers an amazing experience. I highly recommend this game for couples/friends!10/10!

author: Nikel
review: This game is the paragon of co-op multiplayer game! You help each other, make banters, and occasionally compete. You are both unique, and it shows that teamwork means everything and you can't go on by yourself!In terms of exploration, you can spare the headache of checking nooks and crannies for missable collectibles, because there aren't any! Apart from easily-discovered minigames and achievements, that is. This means you can focus more on having fun, paying attention to little details of the world, without the worry that your partner might think "Hey, did we miss that small platform over there? There might be a hidden star!"This game is absolutely fantastic, and a lot of fun to play with a partner! And still even a lot of fun as an audience as well if you have a group of friends!

review: An absolute MASTERPIECE !!! ... Where should I start with the great  voice acting! Or the sheer amount of ideas! The first chapter alone is worth the full price ... I recommend it to every gamer who has lost their passion for games This game reminds us why we fell in love with games in the first place 10/10 without a doubt.

author: Spec
review: My boyfriend and I are playing this game right now and I love the feeling of completing puzzles with him through teamwork. The minigames where we can get competitive with each other are also very fun and memorable to me. Any two people whether they're a couple, siblings or just friends should expect an amazing experience to remember with this game. It has a nice sentimentality to it that can deepen the relationship of the two players. Can't wait for more games like this to come out in the future.

author: lostlife
review: Made by the same people who made the game A Way Out, this was a long and fun interactive game I played with a friend!There is so many things in the environment you can interact with and so many random ways to die, so even if you know what to do you can just wander off and find a mini-game or something else to mess around with.The game was also surprisingly long and every time I got sad thinking it was over: It wasn't!The story was interesting but The game is listed at only $40 but only one person needs to buy it thanks to the "Friend's Pass" which can be used to play with friends online without them owning it or if no one owns it you can try the free demo.This game is well worth your money and I highly recommend it and can't wait to see what other treasure this company makes!

author: Daxter
review: An adorable game that allows us to re-connect with those we've had trouble seeing throughout Covid. The Friendpass is a game-changer and it really made it easy to just quickly buy this game and start enjoying it instantly, not having to worry about if the other can afford it.

author: DTechnology
review: It takes two is a great game.The game design is excellent, every level is memorable and a joy to play. The developer trying to put anything all around the place hoping it sticks, and thankfully most of it sticks. This approach result in a rich gameplay experience. I think they're following Titanfal 2 approach where it 'gives player mechanic, change the mechanic before they got bored', this approach works as there's almost 0 time where I got bored when playing it. The game design almost on par with mario game's. It's solid, clever, fresh, inspired and most importantly FUN.The presentation is top notch, there's tons of love and care put in to this area. I lost count how many time I blown away in this area. The textures, the lighting, the models, the environment design are top notch. The shader team constantly flexing their skill, there's an area where it let you draw using a oil paint and you need to combine multiple color to achieve specific color and it behaves like a real paint. The asset and environment style are highly polished and fresh, each stage feels different. I kinda think it almost at Pixar's level, the human model are kinda flat but it rarely shown so no biggie.The story is decent, it does the job but no highlight here.The detail is insane, there's tons of small stuff that you can play around with. That oil paint thing that I mentioned earlier is not a main content, it just a small stuff on a small corner that developer put. It's insane how much love that being put in this game, I can feel the passion and love just by playing it.Highly recommended this, a split screen coop is a rare thing these days. Split screen coop with great game design? I'll take your entire stock.I officially put hazelight studio into my radar. Great work guys!

author: Hylia
review: One of the best games of the year.Recommended if you like a game that is just genre-hopping like crazy with a strong pacing and full of awesome ideas!

author: plus1!
