author: StormZ
review: I recently had the opportunity to play "It Takes Two" and I must say, it was an incredible experience. The game is a platformer designed for two players, where you control two characters, Cody and May, who embark on an adventure to save their marriage.The game's graphics are stunning and the . The world is full of vibrant colors and imaginative creatures, making it a joy to explore. The soundtrack is also noteworthy, with  and enhances the overall gaming experience.The gameplay is , with puzzles that are challenging but  to solve. The , making it easy to navigate the world and interact with its elements. I especially appreciated the , including platforming, shooting, and even musical sequences. It kept the game feeling fresh and prevented it from becoming repetitive.One of the standout features of "It Takes Two" is its co-op functionality. The game is , and the interaction between Cody and May adds another layer of depth to the experience.  to solving puzzles and overcoming obstacles, making the game a ., "It Takes Two" is an outstanding game that I would highly recommend. The gorgeous graphics, engaging gameplay, and co-op functionality make it a must-play for anyone who enjoys platformers or wants a fun and unique gaming experience.

I got to admit, some parts were darker than expected, but it mostly just made me and my friend laugh. I give this game a: it takes 2/2 (funny pun)

author: Timothée
review: My wife and I just finished it yesterday. What a wonderful game. She used to despise video games - and still does, to some extent. However, she had only high praises to sing about this one after we were done. She was very impressed. The writing is witty and engaging. The world building is unique without rev-inventing the wheel. The gameplay constantly stays fresh through different powers being awarded to the heroes as they cross from one world to the next. We have also personally liked the theme. The "easy love" culture has ravaged the West, leaving many children crying in the shambles of its precarious edifice. It is good to remind people that love, marriage, is like most virtues or goods in life, it needs careful maintenance, a willingness to grow and learn, the desire to fix it when it breaks. Throwing it away because the other is "too difficult," "I have found someone I love more," et cetera is a cowardly and ultimately lazy way to deal with this. It is the vice of our modern age: if it doesn't work anymore, do not fix it, throw it away. And, believe me, my wife and I are no perfect examples. We do talk from experience here. So congratulations on the devs for communicating some universal truths which will no doubt be appreciated by many. This is without a doubt one of the best video games I have played.

author: Unreal
review: It Takes Two is endlessly creative.Gameplay speaks to narrative, while narrative informs gameplay, and the entire experience just feels incredibly polished and detailed. It nails relationships in ways that so many games—and even other forms of media—just can’t. It asks the player to engage with the the story through mandatory co-op to tell the tale of a couple on the verge of divorce, rediscovering the good in their relationship. It’s not just one of the best action platformers in recent memory, but also a fantastic and unique story representing a dynamic that you don’t often see represented in games, at least not to this depth and nuance.

author: Farlen
review: Fantastic co-op game and frankly one of the best games I have ever played. Brought me back to playing the original Spyro games when i was a kid. I rarely right reviews and wanted to for this game.My wife and I rarely plays games together and we couldn't stop with this game. Really love that we only needed to buy one license to play online, friend pass is used for your partner, and could even local co-op via split screen which is rare these days.Gameplay is great, its not really difficult but challenging in a fun way. The jumping around for dear life yelling at your partner to JUST PUSH THE BUTTON kind of way. laughing at your failure... and laughing again when you finally get it right. It feels rewarding to understand and solve the puzzles, but also has fun things to interact with along the way. So the game really encourages you to explore the level.On that, the level are just gorgeous. If you just go to solve each puzzle you are missing out. There is a snow level, no spoilers, where you can literally just skate around, throw snowballs at each other and participate in other winter activities. Has no impact on the game, just fun to mes with.. and throw a snowball at your wife then pretend a penguin did it till on the 4th time she realizes it was you. Each level has its own little story, a story that you overly excited nephew would say "happened to them today" when they have literally been in eyesight of you all day. You will want to explore everything and interact with it just to see what happens.Overall it was a great experience and I really hope they make a second game to this or another game using the same formula.

author: popmygun
review: It Takes Two. The game started off with a family but one problem. The parents were constantly fighting and arguing. One day the daughter finds a school book at school called "Book Of Love". The adventure begins. You turn into small clay figures that live in your home. You explore each part of the house and become closer with the other person your playing with, all of the tasks and exploring needs two players. The game brings you together and bonds you with your friends. It Takes Two feels like a movie it doesn't feel boring and your always engaged its a great game to play with friends and family, just for an hour or two. The graphics are insane and the music is outstanding, every where you go its amazing from the garden to your Club. Its a really good game 100% would recommend to play. The game can feel long sometimes so I would take some brakes. The entire game was very well scripted and made, to the Story line to the graphics and small mini challenges. The game is not difficult at all, its perfect for any body that first uses a computer. It tells you what to press and go if you get lost. Even for people that uses a PC for decades it'll feel enjoying and adventures. It'll change the way you view video games and movies.  The entire adventure was always fun to play.

author: rarepeppersteak
review: I absolutely enjoyed this game. No joke, it is one of the best I've ever played! The sheer amount of content, unique puzzles, beautiful environment, lovely music, and the many, MANY minigames for you to face-off with your game buddy. Believe me when I say you won't regret buying this. You can read on for my amateur take on It Takes Two!The most significant part of the game for me was  the mechanics you could play and try out! I was continually impressed by just how creative they were. It is literally different in every chapter, together with the puzzles that do not get boring. Even as I try to encapsulate and convey all of them into this review, I have difficulty doing so. Its best to experience them yourself! Another greatly appealing part of It Takes Two is that you get to play multiple games within one game! Like around 10 for the price of 1. There's so much heart put into that, and I feel that it really sets It Takes Two apart from the rest. A special mention to the environments: I really love the effort that Hazelight put into this!! There's so much to see and explore, all the little tidbits that you can activate; you might actually spend more time doing that than progressing the game :) I give hugee props to the team for making the game so beautiful.One gripe I had though, was the story. I admit, I did find myself a little stumped with it. I understand that Hazelight first comes up with the mechanics, before moulding the story around it, but I did get a bit confused how simply navigating something together fostered a closer relationship! Cody and May don't talk much to each other, other than some compliments and remarks. Are we supposed to fill that in ourselves? Hmm, this is especially when the initial issues that resulted in the divorce weren't cleared up and communicated away. Dr Hakim has a point about collaboration, but I don't know, I feel that communication should be a tenet as welll? More exposition and closure on their relationship could be provided in a cutscene. ALSO, if their doll selves could be better linked with their real selves, that'd be great. Cody and May can consider it just a fever dream but damn, talk about it.However, I suppose it would have been awkward for friends, siblings or family members playing for Cody and May's relationship fixed so obviously, so I kind of understand. At least their dialogue shed some light on their issues! That aside, 11/10 game.Other things:Especially loved the end scene with "Hold Y", felt like a bit of a call back to A Way Out's final scene as well! Though the contexts are very different.Music-wise, not sure if I caught part of "River" OST from A Way Out? It was very distinct! The two games share the same composer after all (Gustaf Grefberg)Josef Fares was the mocap actor for Dr. Hakim; everytime you see Dr Hakim shake his hips, its Josef.Thank you Hazelight for producing this masterpiece. Again, can't recommend this enough. When It Takes Two gets its awards, they are 100% deserved! <3

author: Peritus
review: This is hands down one of the top 3 games I have played in my entire lifetime. The game has an incredible story which I do not want to spoil, but despite following the same pattern throughout every level it never gets boring. Not only do the different riddles and puzzles change drastically from chapter to chapter, even the gadgets used vary. From simple tools like  to amazing , the different items cause the game to give you a completely different feeling in every chapter. If you were just fighting , feeling a little bit as if you were playing a Doom-RIp Off, you immediately slide into an epic , followed by a  showdown. The game never once bored me and the minigames you find in the chapters even extend the fun. Additionally, the world is relatively open, providing lots of interesting secrets to interact with, such as There are only few negative aspects about this game:-It takes two  The one thing that makes the game unique and one of the best games is also kind of a disadvantage. If you have no partner or friend to play with you, you will be unable to experience this game. Of course, there isn't much of a workaround possible as a solo-version would not be able to create as good of a gameplay.-It ends  With around 20-25h, the game is average in time. You dont feel like you have wasted your money at all, it is totally worth it, but you know that if you could buy an extended story, you absolutely would. All thats left for us is to hope for a worthy sequel-Some gadgets go to fast  Some gadets are cool. But some are breathtaking. And just when you mastered , the chapter is over and other gadgets are already waiting for you. But sometimes you just wished you could've used them just a little longer.The most important thing to cite, however, are the graphics. The landscapes, which range from green grass and blooming flowers over a snowy winter-wonderland up to a tree filled with militant squirrels, are animated so perfectly, you sometimes just sit there and look at the view, taking some epic screenshots. If you are looking for a sign to buy this game and play it with a friend or partner (i did both, and each option is great), THIS IS IT. Get this game. Play it. Have the time of your life.

author: alryxne
review: was recommended to me by a friend who called it the "best two-player game of all time," so how could I not give it a try? Despite having my expectations super hyped up, I was not disappointed!You and a partner play as May and Cody, a couple in the midst of getting divorced, who take on non-interchangeable roles throughout the game to solve various puzzles with a wide array of powers across the game's chapters. This game is chocked full of different types of gameplay, all of which are incredibly well done. You basically get to play every game that's ever existed all in one.> All of the different types of gameplay actually work really well! I'm usually not a fan of obligatory driving sections in game that otherwise have nothing to do with driving, but even those parts didn't make me want to pull my hair out.> Great art and design.> Each player has a unique role in each chapter, so it truly takes two.> Lots of fun Easter eggs and small details to make the world come alive.> Extremely easy. The puzzles themselves aren't difficult, and there are no consequences to dying.> The vertical split screen can be limiting sometimes.> You have to have an Origin account.>  (Okay, this one isn't really a con about the game. Just an oof.)The entire game is well thought out and a lot of fun. One of the best coop games out there. Although this is the kind of game you only have to go through once (no alternate paths, etc. to explore and all the achievements can be done in one playthrough if you're a completionist), it really does take two.

Now the only problem is i am waiting for the other shoe to drop and EA to return to normal form with the next game.

author: British Crumpet Man
review: It Takes Two is an absolute masterpiece that achieves almost everything it sets out to do with flying colours. The story is tragic, heartwarming and fun all at once, the gameplay is varied and stays fresh with new mechanics being constantly introduced and given enough time to be fleshed out without overstaying their welcome and the game looks runs exceptionally well. Being able to play online co-op even if only one player owns the game is just the icing on the cake that makes it hard to believe that this is even an EA published game.The only negatives I can think of are that you need origin to play the game and that when you're throwing as much ♥♥♥♥ at the wall as this game does not all of it will stick; even considering that, enough of it does stick for this not to be a real problem and the platform you play this game on is more of a mild inconvenience than a legitimate problem.I don't have much to say to be honest, just play this game, it's one of the greatest games I have ever played.

author: Weeabamboozled
review: My overall score for this game is a 4.6/5 I highly recommend it!!!Review Below:Thoughts:Overall coming into this game, I expected it to be kind of boring as it looked really goofy from the preview pictures. I would highly recommend this game for lovers and the best of friends to have as much as much fun as I did with my friend. I would in fact replay this game as Cody as through my first run I played as May. At first the main characters were obnoxious but in time you started to grow more and more attached to them. They correctly divided the game between its graphics, story, character development and minigames/puzzles. Graphics: (5/5)Not much to comment about how beautiful this game is in Ultra settings. There are a good number of portions in the game where you're able to sit back and enjoy the scenery such as the Clocktower and the Snow globe areas.Gameplay: (4.5)The gameplay was fantastic, for the most part of it. It had a lot of creativity in the mechanics of itself. You felt as you were playing completely different games at certain points in time which were all enjoyable. They had stressful situations as well as peaceful puzzle solving portions that had you rely on one another while completing the game. Each portion of the game was unique and well thought out. With this game I feel it is separated into sections or areas and within each area it has a certain amount of clear time with its objectives. Unfortunately, I was a little disappointed that as we got closer to the end of the game that the areas were taking much less time to complete. Greenhouse and Musical area for example. That and a mixture of the hard control scheme for certain portions that lead to pointless deaths knock off a tiny bit of its score.Story: (4/5) Story was a bit basic, but the game-play kept it amusing. At first you were loathing the main characters and the book but as time progressed you start to invest into the characters keeping you focused on what is happening. Some funny moments such as how the daughter can clearly see that May is knocked out but acts as if she can hear her. Maybe I would have positioned Cody's body to be asleep laying the desk it would have made more sense. (*Cough* just makes him look like an ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ ignoring his daughter sat up at his desk) Another issue with this story is how I was able to predict the ending after we got to the Squirrel portion of the game however was still thoroughly enjoying my time getting to the ending.Completion Time: (5/5)Wow for only $40 you get 9.5 hours. I was shocked by how much time we were playing the game for. No, we did not rush the finish line and no we did not take our time. However, we thoroughly enjoyed the mini games versing one another probably making up an hour of the game time. Boss fights only took about 20-30m in each area. Keep in mind this is how long my friend and I took but I probably would be willing to redo the story as Cody instead of May practically doubling our time, sure it would take a little less time. I would estimate 15 hours of playtime if you play both characters.Gave me enough laughs, sad moments and connected my friend and I to the characters having us pity them or calling them ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ at points ha-ha.My overall score for this game is a 4.6/5 I highly recommend it!!!

Super happy with the outcome.

author: SpodeAce
review: It's rare to find split-screen games these days, but this is a fantastic example of not only that, but as a game overall. The premise is ridiculous enough that it allows them to really flex some creative muscle and stops you from saying "that's not particularly realistic" and simply embrace the fact you are rolling around as a potato killing a plant that is spewing purple goop at you.The visuals are fantastic and it certainly taxed my machine but it was well worth it.I really enjoyed the fact that each section of the game was very different, right down to the way you interact with the world, with different weapons and kinds of puzzles to solve. It never felt stale and you were always excited when you were given a new toy to play with. At the core, the game is a 3D platformer and there are sections that require some tight timings and to make hard jumps. My partner suffered with these as she's not a regular gamer and found it a little stressful. In most cases, I could grab her controller and do it for her - but there were one or two where you also needed to keep in sync and those were particularly hard. I don't really see this as a failing of the game, but rather of my partner :P I guess it might have been nice to have had the option to skip a section if you've failed it more than a few times.As others have eluded to - there is a scene that is a little disturbing killing a character that really didn't deserve it, but I didn't find this any more upsetting that the overall topic of children suffering at the hand of divorce.From a replay perspective, I would be keen to play again as an alternative character, so if you take that into account you're looking at around 40 hours of play-time. Unless you get particularly enamoured by one of the (many) mini-games.The game does have Internet play as well, but I did not test this and judging by some of the negative reviews - I would not count on this working as it is done via EA's Origin. Overall, it would make my top 10 of co-op couch games and well worth taking a look.

author: TheMagneticSeal
review: 10/10. One of the greatest games I've played in recent years, I played through the whole thing with my girlfriend and we both had an absolute blast for the roughly 12hr story and then even went back after completion to pick up the extra few competitive mini-games we missed.Visuals - The game is gorgeous from start to finish, the art direction, character designs, set pieces, world building, it's all impeccable and really helps the player immerse them self into the world. Vibrant colours and emotive facial expressions really sell the "Pixar" feeling to this game and it runs buttery smooth on High graphics settings on my RTX 2060 super with little to no frame dips.Plot - The story is really sweet and heart-warming, centering around a couple on the brink of divorce that are shrunk down to toys and must slowly restore their lost love throughout their epic quest to get back to their daughter. Along the way, little snippets of dialogue, items from their past and a... book of love (trust me it makes sense) remind them of what they once had and what they would miss if they were to divorce.Gameplay - Gameplay is NEVER stale, each new area gives a new ability or game mechanic to each of the playable characters such as the ability to manipulate time, to shrink and grow, or even create a clone of yourself. These abilities often pair together in unique and creative ways, creating the necessity for teamwork, not only strengthening the bond between you and your partner of choice, but the main characters too. Each new mechanic and item is fresh and engaging and never outstays it's welcome but is also fleshed out enough that it doesn't feel novel and gimicky. Additionally, along your journey there are fun little competitive minigames to be found. These range from chess, to whack-a-mole, even to guitar-hero style button pressing rhythm games which serve as a nice break from the main story and allow you and your partner to take a break from working together and go head-to-head! (These are particularly entertaining if you and your partner are quite competitive, which we most definitely are XD) Also it should be noted that although my girlfriend and I are rather experienced in gaming; the puzzling and platforming (while still being very engaging) never gets too difficult and should you get stuck there are pop-up hints if the game sees you spending a little too long on a particular section, making this game suitable for any age in my opinion!I could keep typing forever singing this games praises and I simply cannot recommend it enough. But the bottom line is that the magic of this game is experiencing it for yourself and me going on for any longer would only spoil and thus detract from your experience. So i urge you, buy this game, grab a loved one and just enjoy this absolute work of art together!

author: moonshine
review: One of the funnest coop games I've played since Portal 2. Split screen works great, the levels are varied, graphics and game play are well done. Each section of the game has puzzles and opportunities to work together with your partner. It has challenging moments but isn't too punishing. The story line is sort of cliche and like a Pixar movie, but it's serviceable and doesn't detract from the fun imo. A solid recommend if you want a split screen coop game (or a coop game in general).Edit: Finished the game and still highly recommended. Game of the year candidate.

author: Mango
review: In a world where half-finished games, bundled with microtransactions and unpolished AAAs from previously trusted developers are commonplace - It Takes Two brings light to the darkness. For a price of 39.99€ where only one person has to pay for it, the other one plays for free via the Friend's Pass or Steam Remote Play Together, this game truly shines as a prime example of a labor of love. The game itself is truly something else and is a must-play for seasoned co-op cowboys and newcomers alike. And for those who are familiar with Hazelight's previous title, A Way Out, well let's just say that this one takes the cake!!

author: Hylian
review: This is one of the best co-op games I've played in a while! Not only is this game very enjoyable to replay a second time because your experience is different depending on if you play Cody or May, but it also has minigames mixed in between the gameplay that you can always revisit later! The game might be a bit pricey at 40 euros but if you can split the money with a friend it's 100% worth your money! It's a pretty short game with around 10 hours of gameplay but if you decide to replay it while swapping characters you get your money out of it for sure!It's pretty refreshing to see all sorts of easter eggs and playstyles/genres mixed in between the game. You never expect what will happen next or what game styles are waiting for you. The game never gets boring and my friend and I finished the first play-through in 4 sessions spread over 3 days.I would rate this game 9/10 with the high price and short duration of the game taking away 1 point. If you get this game on sale and have plenty of people to play this with, then there's no reason to not get this game!

author: rosy_ariete
review: The game is well done and it's cool that you can play with a friend with only owning one copy of it. The graphic is very accurate in the details in each level and sometimes it's just a shame to rush into a zone without taking a good look to appreciate the efforts made by the devs. Plus you'll have a new power in every zone you'll enter which is cool. You could also try to beat the game playing with the other character once you've done with one of them, just to experience the other perspective and try some "new" powers.I also think the longevity of the game is just right, not too short and not too long.The cutscenes with the book, Hakim, are a bit annoying sometimes, but that's just for my taste. You may appreciate them. Still I hope I can beat his ass up at some point haha.I'll say this game is a must if you liked "A way out" and if you like puzzle games to play with a friend.

author: Lazlo
review: This game is hands down the best co-op games I've ever played. An absolute gem of a game with great pacing and interesting level design that continues to surprise until the end. The underlying story is more than enough to carry the game to its conclusion and delivers a great message. The game's overall difficulty is very easy but that is a non-issue considering the simple fun that can be had from playing with your friends. It's more about the experience and joy of just playing the game rather than having a brutal challenge. The game's graphics are stunning at several points and the mechanics are buttery smooth through the entire game. I cannot recommend this game enough.

author: AJukes3132
review: played this game with my husband (not really, i don't know why she told me to write that, i was playing as cody and we're not even married i have no clue)when comparing this game to a way out not only is it longer but every level without exception is of higher quality; whereas in A Way Out there was a few different types of gameplay but it was very de-centralised as to what type of game it was with control schemes changing every level, with all of them feeling very clunky and unrefined. It takes two grounds everything as a 3D platformer (don't expect mario odyssey levels of controls here, but still very good) with different levels giving you different abilities depending on which character you are and what part of the level you're inIf you're playing this with someone who can operate a mouse and keyboard and can tell some funny jokes, you're in for 10+ hours of pure, unfiltered fun. Why can't more games be like this? this game is fun. why aren't more games just fun. I'm sure everyone's heard someone justifying a bad game by saying "well it's fun with friends" this is basically that but this game is actually fun, and you're playing it with a friend! this game is fun and hilarious.I love this game, I can't wait to see what Joseph Fares and Hazelight come out with nextAlso, Dr. Hakim one of the funniest characters in any game

author: Thamriyell
review: Hands-down the BEST cooperative game to play with a friend or a loved one! Playing this one currently with my Girlfriend and I'm awestruck by the amount of variety, original design, and the overall experience of it all!- characters are written really well and the acting is stellar, the characters feel so real in their expression & reactions to things going on around them- this game constantly changes things up at every major point, never keeping the gameplay feeling stale. Its constantly introducing a new cooperative mechanic in a section- each section of the game feels like an exciting roller coaster, each full of their own excitement while still being sincere to the overall story- It feels like a disney-esque adventure, full of love & passion into the art style. Whether its trying to stay realistic or imaginary, it nails the cross between realism and exaggerated art styles- the coop netcode works fantastic and we have only had to deal with one single disconnect in the last several hours of playing. We're playing across the Atlantic, and it still holds up great with nearly no latency in-between!- This game knows how to pull at your heart strings in one moment, while giving you a breath-taking adventure in the next without feeling jarring or too sudden. The game's pace is well-designed!Aside from split-screen coop, this game is miles different than their previous game 'A Way Out,' but it feels absolutely incredible - dare I say better? 'A Way Out' was a revolutionary way to tell a realistic story, but 'It Takes Two' is full of heart, super creative, and is a breath-taking adventure into the imaginary! I don't remember the last time I played a game with this much creativity before! This game is absolutely amazing and I can't wait to finish it soon!(Also, as stated in previous comments, you don't need to have both people buy the game - only one needs to buy it, and the other one downloads a Friends Pass to play for free with a Coop buddy. Highly recommend playing it with a loved-one!)

author: superbia.rook
review: It takes two. Friend Pass Review (Played: May) This is definitively a game both, my girlfriend and I enjoyed playing. And not just parts of it. It's a joyride from start to finish. The story is simple but when it comes to gameplay, it's a bomb exploding in your face with fun worlds, always new mechanics and almost not one thing that is the same. 10/10Now mine (played Cody)It's big fun. We've been clocking sixteen hours over two days into this game and we have always looked forward to the next part or picking it up again when we took a break from playing. There's tons of mini-games to explore and while none of them are genius or unique, they bring back fond memories of your childhood or maybe are games that you've always wanted to play, but didn't. There's lots of game references in this as well and while the story might not be the most inspired, it is inspir. We haven't found any real bugs, just one moment where one of us slid under an obstacle, but that was easily resolved. This is something for feeling good with your friend or significant other. We'll definitely play this again sometime. 10/10

author: *Haemo
review: We haven't quite beaten the game yet, but playing through this has proven to be one of the best co-op experiences of the past decade, easily rivaling co-op titans like Portal 2. The puzzles and the environments that contain them are thoughtfully made and creatively rendered, and new concepts and mechanics are constantly introduced before you can tire of the previous ones. The game truly makes it an absolute joy to cooperate with and compete against your partner - there is simply no shortage of positive things I can say about it, and it is in my view absolutely worth the somewhat intimidating $40 price tag, especially since it's really only $20 per person. The only caveat I would mention is that the vast majority of this game is played in split screen, whether you play local or network co-op. I don't personally think this is a detriment since it is relevant to the fundamental design of the puzzles, but this may still be a turn-off to some.

author: =.VaRtaZiaN.=
review: Played 3 hours so far and REALLY enjoying this experience. Runs flawlessly for me and my friend asside from a few sound hickups on his machine during cutscenes. He has a 2060S @ 1080p and I have 2080S @ 1440p. The graphics are absolutely stunning. Gameplay and creativity is really good. Puzzles are fun, make you think a little bit but nothing challenging. The animation is like a pixar movie.Graphics: 9.5/10Gameplay: 9/10Performance: 9/10Sound: 9/10Music: 8.5/10FunFactor: 9/10I can tell you that if you like platforming with small creative puzzles, and small boss battles with a friend, this is the game for you.

author: crozy
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: 月読尊
review: There is not much to say about  that hasn't been said already, but I will try to pass down the experience my girlfriend and I had. is about a married couple going through a divorce, so the usual tropes about overcoming the issues and "living happily ever after" are expected as a given. However,  evokes ever-so-relatable relationship nuances by not shoving them in your face. Rather, it conveys some of the deep topics (egoism, cognitive biases, parentship, relationship dnamics, value projections, etc.) for those who are keen on details. However simple, the narrative managed to keep us on the edge of our seats by being amusing whilst also being realistic and serious when it should have been. Hence, Josef Fares and cool people at Hazelight Studios successfuly made a simple story with a strong message that gets stronger as you keep scratch the surface. Additionally, the cinematic presence of Fares' work is noticeable and immersive. However, where  shines the most is .Calling the gameplay innovative may be up for discussion for some since each chapter lends gameplay mechanics from a different video game genre. However, I am yet to find a video game with such a smooth and reasonable way of continuous mode switching that simply makes sense. When you add that upon the already amazing and astonishing level design that immerses you completely into the game world and evokes the right amount of nostalgia, you have a recipe for the GOTY.Based on these multi-genre mechanics,  steps it up by subtly breaking the fourth wall with minor adjustments -- making you the core of its gameplay and storyline itself. After we finished the game, both my girlfriend and I were left with hearwarming feeling and tears of joy. Moreover,   managed to break the usual stigma of video games as something one would do just to have fun without chiming a single brain cell on real-life issues.  Additionally, I found that she would kick ass in Diablo, but could not do any platforming for the life of her! It's been some time since I last felt this good about playing a cooperative game.The very emotional journey and experience encapsulated in the past two paragraphs witness how innovative, daring, and worth every damn penny  is. You can feel the devotiongame developers were trying to transmit upon their player base by making a game that has a purpose higer than sheer entertainment.A true spit in the face of today's industry stained by money-hungry corpos!

review: The game is actually fun and has lot of qualities.I'm just putting a thumbs down because it has the most spineless, bland, generic, anticlimactic ending possible.I thought the extremely obnoxious personality of the Dr Hakim character and the very questionable speech about relationships was at least somewhat ironic, but the ending makes you feel like they meant every word of it.Why?Why can't we have good endings?Does anyone even care anymore?Also, thank you EA for forcing your ugly Origin service.Aside from that, cool game. Very easy, but cool nonetheless.

author: Dravic
review: EDIT: aaand it got the Game of the Year award from " (admittedly pointless and tone-deaf) The Game Awards 2021". I'm happy for the developers, even if I despise the show itself for being out of touch in the past.It Takes Two is a wonderful journey that I wholeheartedly recommend, you should aim to play it with a partner or a friend from start to finish. The game features solid graphics, decent soundtrack and amazing set pieces both artistically and gameplay-wise.The always-on split screen really makes the game "pop" among other coop games, it's splitscreen even when you play over the internet, giving you insight into what your teammate is doing and provides a very unique feeling to the entire game.

author: Boris
review: This is definitely a fun game to play with a friend or partner. The gameplay is enjoyable while not being terribly challenging yet still challenging enough to stay engaged. It has some flavor elements and an amusing story and characters. The characters are insufferable while charming at the same time and will grow on you. you'll also have plenty of moments that will likely make you laugh. Overall a good buy, especially at a discount, and remember only one person needs to buy it and the other can use the friend pass to partake in the co-op so a great bang for your buck.

author: ChildishRambino
review: This game, is not only polished, but tells a wonderful story with tons of fresh mechanics and game play that never feels too dense. I was sincerely impressed at the quality of this game, and it would be an absolute sin if we never see a sequel to this in some way,shape or form. Given all the pop culture references too, this game rewards you very well for paying attention to things you can explore, ultimately making playing this with a loved one very fun! Overall, this is a solid 10/10 for me, my ONLY constructive point of feedback, is some of the mini games don't feel as responsive as they should, but even so, the ones that work well, work REALLY well.

author: (NJT) Speirs
review: Simply the best game I've ever played. Designed for Coop experience would give it extra points for me, but level design, story, game mechanics, and volume of content, are all potentially the best I've seen in decades.Barely had to look up solutions (I think maybe twice?) so that speaks to the right balance of 'think about it for a bit and you should get it'. Played through with my 7yo son, a little intense at times, but worth it; memories were made.Sincerely, thank you to the devs, and for the leadership that let dreams come to life for once.

author: arie
review: This game, is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! You can tell its not for the money and genuinely made by people who care. The friends pass is free allowing you to play with anybody who buys the game, and not only that, it has so much effort put into it. Even with its fictional nature, it makes incredibly realistic graphics, even at an incredibly large scale. The story is cheesy, but still enjoyable. Not to mention the mechanics. Each mechanic felt super fun to do, me and my friend kept going back to the ice skating because of how fun the mechanic was. The mini games are a interesting and fun way to add more content into the game while keeping it focused at all times. There wasnt a single moment in this game i felt like it was wasting time and i wanted it to get to story. Not to mention its layout. It reminds me of classic xbox 360 lego games i used to play, and that bit of nostalgia really put the cherry on top. 10/10 buy this game PLEASE

review: Had a great experience of 14hrs. author: Nathin Karpkana
review: I loved playing this game with my boyfriend, we both found the game captivating and mechanics easy to use. I used a controller and he used mouse and keyboard, and we had no major issues. The story was well put together and it was about 12 hours to get near the end. The stages in the game are well thought out and graphics we nice too, not too demanding on the GPU either. The progression was there and the story hits a lot of good points about marriage, and it gives them a clever twist to get the message across. My only complaint is the British accents. The mix of accents is annoying. Especially when May say Priv-acy instead of Praivesy (both phonetically spelled), like a normal person. Then one of the frogs has a New York accent and the other one has a love language accent. why?! But anyways, the game is well worth the money and it's really cool. 9/10 would buy something like it again.

author: cheesebox
review: This game is just beautiful from start to finish. Each stage is unique and a wonder to behold, where you can feel the love and attention the game gives to even the smallest sections that players might not even see. The co-op aspect adds so much to the gameplay, where each puzzle feels unique and fresh, with both players experiencing different things as you go through the game. 10/10.

author: eraserbedhead
review: Easily one of the most well-made games I've ever played. The whole experience was awesome, with unique mechanics for both characters that kept changing to keep the game new and interesting. One of my favorite aspects specifically was the sound design of the game. Just finished playing through the main story (haven't found every minigame yet) so you're looking at roughly 9-12 hours depending on skill level and how many minigames you seek out. It was definitely weird, but in the best way, so don't let that scare you away. During the Musical Chairs minigame, the game got very buggy. Upon exiting that game and entering the next section of the chapter, the game crashed and one of the files was corrupted, so it had to be uninstalled and reinstalled. So probably just avoid that minigame but all else was great!

author: Gosh
review: Amazing game, I played this with my friend and every moment of it was never dull. The diversity and the creative ideas in this game run rapid and make the game a blast to play. The mini-games where you battle against you friends are the best because they are all interesting and competitive. I would highly recommend this game if you have a friend to play this with. author: Shadow116
review: I've been playing this with my friend who has been using the friends pass. This game is fantastic! The levels are unique and fun and so are the mechanics they give your for each level. The games gives off the same co op vibes as Portal 2.

author: Lukeinator
review: One of if not the best co-op game I've ever played. It's so endlessly creative and fun with it constantly jumping to the next new idea keeping it consistently fresh and never boring. It's only heightened by its amazingly well executed and acted story. It totally deserved and earned Game of The Year. It's just a complete blast.If you don't have fun with this or feel some kind of joyous and childlike wonder come over you by the time you're finished with this game, I don't think you're human.

author: Maghalateam/Quinten
review: First of all, this game is my game of the year, truly. I love this genre of games, another example being A Way Out, wich is of course from the same creators. The splitscreen/play-with-a-friend genre is one of the finest there is and can truly improve the relationship with he or she. I played this with a friend of mine and he also really enjoyed the game, every level is really different and they are at their finest when you can do something like skate on ice or swim underwater, those active things really improve the game, all the equipment you gain really change the game. At one time you are shooting wasps with a gun that shoots matches and the other minute you have magnets on your back or youi can change time with a clock or you can scream to explode glass! These things are game changers and the creators should be really proud of what they made here. I give this game a solid 10/10. I also love how there are no collectibles, but smal things to do like minigames, or jump on the back of a train. All those small things make the game so beautiful. Really recommended for friends or couples who want a solid game to play togheter.

author: rem-rin
review: I love this game, I played with my Dad. When I was sad, he made me glad.

author: reView

author: ✪ ReAct =D
review: INSANE GAME !!!!!

author: LaggyTheWhale
review: The game is great. My daughter and I have been having a blast. The new abilities are demonstrated in a way that we are able to pick them up and the way they are used is great. Can't wait to finish the game!

author: Arexn
review: Great game, highly recommend it. Gameplay is great with every chapter introducing different mechanic to change things. Level designs and visuals are great. The game also has lots of minigames and hidden areas that you can enjoy with your partner.

author: DreamedReality
review: Absolutely beautiful game. The level design is amazing. Never feels repetitive. Requires some real nice cooperation with you and your partner but never feels really difficult to figure out. The minigames give a nice little break from the rest. Visually its a treat. Every level is absolutely beautiful and unique from the last. The soundtrack was spot on. Why isn't the soundtrack available? It so needs it.Took my partner and I about 18hrs to finish our first playthrough and felt a good length. They really stepped up their game from A Way Out, which was already a fantastic co-op.  Really hope this studio will continue to make these fantastic co-ops!

author: Gandheezy
review: I'm comfortable saying now this is the most innovative co op game i've ever played. I'm playing with a good friend and we are absolutely having a blast. This really makes you work together and use your individual skills for the common good to progress, and it's just focused on fun 100% of the time. This should be in the 2021 GOTY conversation. Absolutely do not miss it. Play with a buddy, a significant other, a sibling, doesn't matter. You will have a great time. As a child of divorce (a particularly horrible divorce), I still found this story to be super endearing. Some people need to be apart, others need a push from a certain Spanish long-armed book to find their way back together. I have never seen a game push the theme of collaboration so well and so thoroughly. Every action must be supported by your partner's action, and vice versa. You bring different skill sets to the table, but ultimately the only way to get anything done is to learn to work together both through the narrative and the gameplay. This is a pinnacle of thematic consistency, which you know I love. Absolutely outstanding.

author: Duck Vader
review: Incredibly fun coop experience. Took about ~14 hours to complete. ~16 total for all achievements/mini games.Very accessible in terms of difficulty/mechanics, without ever getting boring.I wasn't a huge fan of A Way Out (never got drawn into the story, and thus most of the gameplay fell flat), but It Takes Two was incredible.The experience is constantly fresh, and the creativity is insane.I'm probably going to make my 50 year old parents play it, because I want other people (especially those not normally into games) to experience this game.Update: My parents are at the castle level, about ~16 hours in for them. They've struggled a bit with the shooting mechanics, especially the wasp level, but besides that have been thoroughly enjoying the game

author: The Danish Kiwi
review: This was an enjoyable experience that kept on surprising me at every turn with new and exciting ways to tell the story of 'It Takes Two'.If you have a significant other that enjoys the occasional video game experience - this is DEFINITELY a must. 100% worth the price of 12-13 hours of gameplay.10/10

author: Taylor
review: BEST COOP GAME EVER. The story feels like it was made for a failed pixar pitch that was written by someone who was on LSD 24/7. But other than that the gameplay is the best platforming and coop sections I've ever seen. Easily the best coop game and one of THE best games I've ever played.

author: Jesse
review: Good

author: UNTILTABLE

author: wagaboo9000
review: Honestly this is my new favorite game I have ever played, I would reccomend it to anyone and everyone that would ever be interested. The game is hilarious, makes me laugh all the time, but is equally impactful and heart felt. I have laughed, I have cried, and that's just talking about the emotional aspect of the game. From a video game aspect its even better, every boss fight/level/chapter is completely new and unique, not your baby brand fight 10 unique bosses that every video game says the boss fights are genuinely completely different very little if any of the mechanics of the game are repeated in any sections making every level and chapter and interaction completely novel and enjoyable, the games visuals, animation, mechanics, acting everything is polished to a sunlike shine honestly this game is amazing and because of the friend pass is a steal for the $40 price tag the put on it I can't reccomend this enough.

author: Cr1ticality
review: This game pairs a great story with incredible 3D platforming and very fluid controls. This game is co-op only, which might be a downside to some, but in my opinion the co-op elements only serve to further enhance the overall experience provided. While not for absolutely everyone, this game can be enjoyed by a huge variety of people, and I would easily recommend it to anyone who's been looking for a fun co-op experience to have with a friend, family member, or significant other.

review: Story feels allot like an 80s family film. But even with that in mind the ending was disgustingly cheesy. It's a hella good co-op game but near the end it feels rushed with  poorly thought out level gimmicks and imagination. I highly recommend this game cause it's probably one of the best co-op games you can get [excluding the last 2 chapters].

review: My girlfriend and I have been together for 3 years and I always wanted to play video games her. We finished this game in 27hrs and while she didn't become a gamer, I will forever remember playing this with her, it is now a core memory. We both had a lot of fun, and she was so happy everytime she got a puzzle right or beat a boss or me in a minigame. It was wonderful seeing her smile and play like a child.

The story is good too though surprisingly mature as it tackles the impact of parents falling out of love.My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed this game.  I definitely recommend it.

author: Lambanog
review: This game is definitely GOTY material and well-deserving of the title for 2021. The Couch Co-Op genre is being brought back to life. Try to remember the days when there was no online gaming and just a 2-player Nintendo console hooked up to your TV. The retro games back then turned non-gamers in the household into gamers just by sitting beside you on the couch. This is the stuff this game is made of.

author: jmac
review: This is a really excellent game. If you're on the fence about it and have someone that you like to play co-op games with, please just buy this game. It is 1. incredibly charming, 2. brimming with smart and interesting gameplay ideas and mechanics, 3. looks gorgeous, 4. easy to pick up and put down, 5. a great choice for players of various skill level (saves are very generous, there are not real 'punishments').Point 2 is really where this game shines. At its core, It Takes Two is cooperative platformer. But each world you visit is premised on one or more styles of asymmetrical co-op gameplay, each player being granted a different power to traverse the world and assist their partner. Like in a Mario game, the difficulty isn't terribly high, but the gameplay is crisp and the sheer amount of ideas and mechanics at play means it never gets dull. This is an extremely fantastic value for the amount of fun you will get out of it.

author: Jobonoobdude
review: Wow, can't say enough good things about this game. The wife and I have been playing through it, and she's been asking to play it! No other game does that! If you are looking for a game to play with your spouse, I couldn't recommend this enough!The story is top notch, the voice acting is amazing. Really easy to empathize with these characters, sometimes I forget I'm playing a video game and not watching a movie! Great gameplay that isn't too challenging for my non-gaming wife, but doesn't hold back. The varieties of gameplay are a blast too! I love playing all the different minigames, or switching from a 3rd person platformer, to a first person shooter, to an overhead dungeon crawler all in one sitting!

author: Human
review: My wife saw this game and recommended we play it together. It has been a great bonding experience and we have had many laughs while playing it. She's not a huge gamer but she got the hang of the controls easily! great for beginners.

author: Kamadeva
review: I don't know where to start this game has solidified itself as on of my GOAT.   1.Wind Waker, 2.Time Splitters 2, 3.Nier Automata, 4. Monster Hunter 4U, and Finally 5. It takes two....this game is perfect, grab your significant other or your best friend and this game doesn't disappoint there are so many easter eggs...l.♥♥♥♥ I loved every second of it just buy it.
Spent 2hrs on main menu inviting friends.one of them called cops on me.

If you have a friend/loved one or even someone you just want to get to know better, you should play this game.After completing the game, I can honestly say it's one of the most varied and enchanting cooperative games I've ever played. Cheers to Hazelight for doing an amazing job with this game.

review: I have not played a game like this in forever, me and my friend agreed that we would play for only 30 to 40 minutes, that extended to 4 hours. By the end of the those 4 hours i felt like i had further deepened our friendship. We both agreed this was the best decision we've made. I'am happy i bought this game it was worth every penny.

author: Derpiña Colada
review: Every step of this game has such a wow factor, it's truly unique. We'll definitely be replaying it and look forward to many more games from the devs. Wish I could forget I played it so I can experience it for the first time all over again!

author: Villain™Ⓥ
review: It Takes Two is a 12-15 hours of pure fun and genius enjoyable pacing , it doesn't feel boring or repetitive in a single second , with heavy focus on platforming and puzzles that requires precise understanding between the 2 players in order to move forward , mixed with a compelling story that is presenting modern issues that couples have , it feels like an amazing fairly tale, its one of the highest quality games out there, do yourself a favor and don't miss it , only one copy required for 2 people to play.

author: Redeyeswizard
review: If you have a friend to dedicate a full play through with then i HIGHLY recommend IT TAKES TWO. Every level was something new and fun. Some actual interesting dialogue with a couple good spots of humor. If your thinking about it, do it. Well worth the money spent and with some time between could totally see doing another play through later down the road.

review: This game is like an amazing Pixar movie turned into an amazing game. Writing is awesome, pacing is great, it's not to hard or easy, nothing gets boring, and is wacky as all hell. It's pretty much the best you could ask from a co-op game to play with a friend or sibling. I simply cannot recommend it enough. 15/10

review: Amazing game to play with your girlfriend, its easy and most of all not repetitive and you can replay it again after you beat the game to switch characters.

author: Samm_ster

author: Dumelax
review: An absolutely incredible -if not the best you'll ever encounter- co-op experience, unlike any other. You progress through a magical world with lots of various themes, each one different than the previous one and all looking as gorgeous as can be. Gameplay is very accessible and varies with each chapter, keeping the experience fun and fresh. The story and messages of the game are some we could all use in difficult times, not only making this game 2021's GOTY, but pretty much every year's GOTY until you played it. If anything, this thing is food for relationship. Whether it be with a friend, family, or anyone else, your relationship will grow stronger, in addition to feeling like you're the main character of an animation movie. A definitive must-play, regardless of video game genres and consoles.

author: ideyaf1x
review: The game itself is far from 'overwhelmingly positive', but keeping in mind the fact that we don't get a lot of decent co-op titles it gets a pass (on sale or via EA Play). My main problem is that it could be several hours shorter. Hell, it  be several hours shorter. Last chapters feel like something you have to get over with rather than something you truly want to play, and subpar main story definitely doesn't help. It may not be much of a problem If you're couch co-oping, but If you're playing online you  notice significant dip in your engagement and enjoyment during the last ~4 hours.

review: It was my first time playing co-op with my best friend, and we had a great time the entire time. It is incredibly gorgeous, imaginative, diversified, and, most importantly, the several mechanisms crammed into this game all seem fleshed out and responsive. In my opinion, this makes it a must-play. Hazzlenut should create more games like this one.

author: Mery Johansson
review: the game is really adorable. especially the story takes you into the game. being co-op strengthens the story. so idk the price worth for the game but u guys can get ea play and finish it in about 15hours. in a result if u still alive u must play IT TAKES TWO before die..(play with ur gf or bf not guy...)

author: Kream
review: This is the first game I've played from Hazelight Studios. My co-op partner and I are nearing the end of our first playthrough, and I can barely put into words the joy this journey has brought us both. We're both 30 and most games don't have the same grasp on us as they used to, but this past weekend It Takes Two pulled us both into its world and we played until the AM. We will be sad to see the credits roll, as we both agree that this is honestly the best game we've ever played. It's hard to find games made with this much love and creativity. The level design, music, and co-op interaction is all flawlessly executed. We plan to go back and get all the steam achievements and also can't wait to try A Way Out next. I can't wait to see what else Hazelight does in the future.

author: ホタルの森
review: My bf gifted me this game after telling him about this game awhile ago, and this game is a really fun game to play with your partner or even a friend, lots of dying from laughter moment! There's so many elements to this game! Each chapter is all so different! And the mini games are fun! (Just don't let your partner "cheat" >:( mine was spamming WASD to where some mini games did not count as a point for me, babe you cheater!! Give this a try!!! you won't regret it! and some part of the game is so cute! I really love the snow/water part! that was by far my personal favourite! Give this a shot! you won't regret! Also....You might have this thought to kill that book ... :) JUST A WARNING! But the book is funny though :)

author: Hmmm
review: Best split-screen couch co-op game ever. Had such a blast with this.

author: DragonPixels
review: It Takes Two is an amazing game from the creators of A Way Out. The gameplay is absolutely amazing and never fails to entertain me. All the puzzles are unique and really satisfying to complete. Each level/world also never fails to be outstanding with its visuals and new mechanics it introduces. It Takes Two featuring amazing graphics. It really impresses me how much the game looks like a movie. The soundtrack is also really great and it pulls everything together, from the gameplay to the story. Speaking of the story, its kind of like a Disney movie style, which in my opinion is great. The story ties in really well with the gameplay and the story also has some unexpected twists here and there. Lastly I would like to talk about the co-op. It's super nice of Hazelight to make it so only one person needs to own the game to play with another friend. It's really awesome that they did that and it's another reason why I love Hazelight so much. Overall It Takes Two has impressed me a whole lot and me and my friend both love the game. We haven't even completed, so that really says something.

I really love how May got a slightly more important roles/abilities so she felt more appreciated. Through the entire gameplay we only encountered 2 bugs, one which I fixed through vigorous jumping (stuck between two objects), and one through restarting from a checkpoint (Cody not responding to a left-click action), so it really is a no problem. The only problem is because my partner is not a gamer at all, she's experiencing a quite hard time using a controller and adjusting the camera lol.Well earned Josef Fares, Congratulations!

I wholeheartedly recommend that everyone find someone to enjoy this title with.Story  9.5/10Value  9.2/10Music  9.2/10Acting  9.6/10Setting  9.7/10Graphics  9.8/10Replayability  7.5/10User Interface  9.5/10Creativity  9.6/10Character Design 9.2/10Overall Score 9.3/10

author: Chadworthy
review: It Takes Two is packs so much high quality fun into such a compact space. I was constantly impressed by the amount of fully detailed interactables and minigames (even if we skipped them, I was still impressed) that must have taken a lot to get polished just to entertain players for a few minutes before moving on, they really designed the gameplay for constant moment-to-moment fun.The storyline is not family friendly despite the appearance of the game, and focuses on a lot of darker themes especially towards the first third of the game. Joseph Fares shows here that it was no accident that A Way Out set the bar for a true no-compromises co-op experience, and I don't see how he can top this but I eagerly await his next project.

author: ʕ•ᴥ•ʔ
review: Brilliant game. Definitely deserves some of awards for goty 2021. As of today there is no better co-op game out there. It takes two literally has so many different games in it. I believe it's an amazing different gaming genre introduction for someone who doesn't really play. Music is amazing, story is insanely fun and interesting. Some of the location are simply amazing. I really loved the winter one, it's so charming and beautiful. Controls are very responsive and it's feels really good playing it. I've never experienced anything like this.I got it on sale and would 100% recommend it to anyone who wants to play it with their wife or girlfriend.

author: Lord Moon
review: This game is phenomenal. It adds mechanics that are intuitive but don't last too long, as so that you don't get bored. Some levels so this better than other undoubtedly. The use of real world physics reminded us of how much fun we had when we played Portal 2's Co-op mode. This game truly amplifies the co-op element. I guarantee if you play this with a long time friend like myself the puzzles were enjoyable and we could bounce ideas of each other. I will say some levels abilities require more teamwork that others.The visuals are amazing and fairly optimised which is unusual for an EA game. I managed to play at 1440p resolution staying above 60fps during chase sequences. The fantastic visuals just make the game even more worth exploring.The story was alright but it served as a decent enough foundation to the gameplay.The minigames are nice extra that allow you to take a break from the puzzles and have fun with your companion. I do have to say my favourite level definitely has to be the Snowglobe level. The visuals are fascinating and beautiful. The ability you get given as well nails home the point that you rely on each other both gameplay and communication wise. We finished in 10 hours or so, which I feel is perfect. The game didnt drag and we did play at least one round of all the mingames we found. For the price I would say its worth it. (I payed £20) considering only one of you has to have it to play it.

review: A good friend of mine recommended this game to my wife and me. Not really sure what I was expecting... But it was amazing. The story, characters, scenery, and gameplay overall keeps you so entertained. Every chapter has a different way to play and there's always fun little minigames or things to interact with in the world. My wife ended up crying for the last 5 mins of the game xD The book is my fav character for sure. COLLA-BORATION!!

author: Acesulfam
review: I've been searching for a game like this for quite some time. I needed a game for me and my gf that is- casual- not too easy not too hard- aesthetically pleasing- geared towards koop gameplayStuff like Mario Kart was too skill based and caused frustration. Puzzle games were too boring or too hard to control for a non-gamer. The developers previous game -A way out- was too boring at times and just lacked gameplay.It takes two now sits perfectly in the sweet spot of what we needed:The graphics are cute and beautiful. The different worlds are absolutely fantastic and creative, ranging from larger open spaces to tight tunnels. Most worlds have been crafted with an eye for details and love and I really loved the little Easter eggs.The gameplay is casual, fun and very diverse - every chapter gives the characters changing skills and therefore numerous different puzzles and fights that in turn are never hard but never boring too. One particular chapter just blew my mind because the game completely changed in a totally unexpected way for a moment (I would like a full game like that chapter tbh). Our very different skill levels regarding video games weren't a problem at all. The game manages to let both players help each other without ruining it for one of them.If there is one weak point it might be the story. I found it to be quite flat and stereotypical yet charming and funny at times. My impatient gf wanted to skip the cut scenes, but both players have to press b for 2 seconds or so 😈 but it's a cool feature and the story really is just as important as you want it to be.Summary: if you have a buddy, partner, family member or ANY person willing to play a great game then do it! It's so good. I want more.

author: GenericNickname
review: There's an Easter Egg where the developer uploaded part of his  infamous **** the Oscar's speech. That alone makes the game worth it.If that didn't sell you: Playing It Takes Two feels like such a breath of fresh air after grinding through countless "serious" games. It's fun, energetic, and the tone (generally) doesn't take itself too seriously. When it does take itself seriously, the change in tone makes it all the more impactful. It's a game that has the spirit of Psychonauts combined with pastiche's of all your favorite genres - sometimes its a shooter, sometimes a rhythm game, sometimes a top down Gauntlet clone. It does all of these well and with a difficulty challenge that even novices to video games can quickly learn. Frankly, I picked up the game just to have an excuse to have something to do with a friend. I wasn't expecting much, but It Takes Two blew me away. It's a *strong* contender for my Game of the Year and is something that everyone should experience. My only real regret is I'm not going to be able to play the game blind again.

author: GoddessEto
review: A surprisingly varied, wholesome, and gorgeous game that oozes fun, rewards cooperation, and never overstays its welcome with its constant barrage of novel gameplay mechanics cleverly lifted from triple A cohorts. This lack of padding and the story-centered linear progression results in an expertly paced experience that is difficult to get bored or frustrated with, especially when playing with someone you have a good shorthand with. And despite not being overstuffed, it still took us a respectable 19 hours to beat, without even discovering all minigames (even though we tried)!

author: EnbyAdam
review: TL:DR: BUY THE GAME IF YOU HAVE A PARTNER TO PLAY THIS, THIS ONE IS WELL WORTH FULL PRICE God, this was such a breath of fresh air, a full coop game that actually had thought and passion put into it with some of the best designed levels i've seen this year (especially the last one but im not gonna spoil that one for you).The game actually had thought put into the splitscreen coop, today thats about as rare as a non depressed teen FOR EXAMPLE: If one player is doing some sort of jumping puzzle while the other is holding a button to make it possible then the screen of the player whos doing the puzzle expands to make it easier on them, because the devs understood you dont need half your screen to just to keep holding down a button.I cant tell you if playing with friends pass is any good, as for me and my coop partner it didnt work, but remote play on steam worked perfectly.The gameplay mainly consists of platforming and sloving puzzles, but it never gets stale, because just like half life 2 each chapter mixes up the gameplay in some new way. One level Cody has a bandolier of nails to nail down moving platforms and to make a path for his partner May to swing through with her claw hammer, another level he can stop time while May can clone herself to trigger 2 buttons simultaneously and in another one becomes a barbarian and the other a wizard and the game turns into a top down hack n slash.And another thing, the voice actors ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ KILLED IT!Overall just a really good, well designed game with a story that takes itself semi seriously with memorable moments sprinkled in.

author: MonkeyJug
review: When I saw Electronice Arts were involved in this, I avoided adding it to my wishlist and pretty much ignored anything to do with it.Then someone told me that this game was made by the same guy who made Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons - one of my all-time favourite games.  So, on that basis alone, I bought it yesterday - went in blind with my 8-year-old daughter as my co-op buddy.Almost instantly, I realised this game is an absolute gem - truly magnificent.  One of the best games I ever played.We defeated the second boss (Toolbox) yesterday, and already this morning she has been pestering me to carry on playing it.To the developer, "I think this might just be [your] masterpiece."November 2021 and it's still the best game I ever played.

review: This game is nothing short of a masterpiece. I could play this game over and over again, because this game is pure serotonin and takes you on an emotional ride with a delightful payoff. I recommend you find a friend and spend the time going through this and enjoying exploring for the sake of exploring. I cannot stress how much this game brought me happiness. The literal only downside is that EA has anything to do with it and that you need Origin to play it.

author: Bart!
review: I'm so sad to be giving this game a negative review. This is also the only game I've ever bothered to write a review for. Played it with my girlfriend and was having a wonderful time; the puzzles hit the spot of not being obvious but still only taking a minute to figure out, and the gameplay displays a surprising variety of styles. Seriously, there's a MOBA section in this 3D puzzle platformer. However, we both found the two playable characters very unlikable. Few redeeming qualities, no glimpses of what made them fall for each other before their relationship deteriorated, and most importantly a lack of concern for their daughter's emotional wellbeing. Then they hit you with an absolutely horrific scene out of nowhere in which you . Absolutely ruined the mood and I really have no desire to suffer through this section to continue playing as these awful people. The way this game is marketed really does not give an accurate impression of the emotional experience. It has lots of cute moments, and I believed it would be a perfect play-with-your-SO-on-the-couch-before-bed experience. So close, and yet so very far. What a shame.

author: chonkz
review: It Takes Two is a fantastic game that truly lives up to its name. I mean, it really does take two to make this game work its magic. One player alone just wouldn't cut it - it takes two players to really experience all that this game has to offer.The graphics in It Takes Two are top-notch, with stunning environments and character designs that'll have you feeling like you're really part of the action. And with its unique co-op gameplay, it takes two players to navigate through the challenges and obstacles that the game throws your way. Trust me, it takes two to tango in this game.Overall, It Takes Two is a game that's not to be missed. Whether you're looking for a fun and challenging co-op experience or just want to try something new, this game has something for everyone. So grab a friend and get ready to play - it takes two to make this game a hit.

author: Messi
review: the game is fun and upmost enjoyable filled with laughs with whoever you choose to play with. the story is written well and the characters are funny to listen to, especially cody! the different abilities make the game unpredictable and require some thought. Well thats for the first 3 hours. Suddenly, you take on the personality of brutal, lustful killers. firstly, you absolutely tear your daughters favourite toy limb from limb ripping off its ears and legs as it squeals for you to stop all while in the attempt of running from you. Keep in mind, the toy is a elephant which has duties of her own taking care of her kingdom. But the impulsive, aggressive, diabolical killing spree followed through may and cody sadly wreaks havoc on the elephant and her soldiers. with may adapting fire powers and melting the poor guards rightfully defending the elephant, as their blood seeps through the carpet of her majesty's hallways. Dont even get me started on cody at this stage in the game. Next thing we see is May and cody crawling through the carcasses of whales and centipedes and finding.. enjoyment out of it? this game is a cover for a dark, twisted, psychopathic story following two serial killers doing everything to return to their human lives, forgetting that these poor souls which followed their path of bloodlust never had the choice of simply returning to a human self. This game is described perfectly in one word, dreadful. i am sorry for whoever saw this as a kids game to enjoy with their children because it simply is not one.
