review: If you've ever played a co-op game and thought to yourself "boy, I wish the protagonists argued with each other nonstop as we tried to solve platforming puzzles" then I have a game for you. The graphics will stutter, but don't worry: you'll still be able to listen to the main characters undermine each other constantly.We turned the speech volume down to zero after a couple levels of bickering. We never finished the game, but this terrible couple gets a divorce, right? Please tell me they divorce. They are not good for each other.

author: Miso
review: 如今，即使游戏画面越来越精致，叙事和演出越来越宏大，甚至人们把游戏奉为“第九艺术”来试图赋予游戏意义，也仍然改变不了当下玩家普遍“电子阳痿”的现实困境。而这种空虚，疲惫，无意义，和世界脱节的感受，我们并不陌生，甚至许多人玩游戏的初衷便是为了对抗这种情绪。但最后我们发现，与其说是对抗，不如说是逃避，这使我们内心更加空心化。一个人玩游戏很难消解孤独，更无法告慰灵魂。这个暑假弟弟陪我一起玩了双人成行。在他家，我们横竖躺在沙发上，用了五个下午通关了游戏。不知道什么时候开始，许多事情每当我去回想上一次经历是何时时，我只能想到小时候。柏拉图在《会饮篇》中认为人原本是雌雄同体，四手四脚的，后来被天神劈为两半，变得残缺不全，只有找到另一半才会感到完满。而这种缺失感，在现在广泛而肤浅的社会关系下更为显著，于是双人成行才显得尤为珍贵。它帮助两个人建立了一种十分全面的临时关系，从合作，互动，到情绪和精神，两个人分享了时间和空间，到达了柏拉图所说的合而为一的状态。制作人Josef Fares和他的双人成行无疑是成功且伟大的，因为这位奥斯卡的弃儿向世界证明，游戏的本质不应该是画面，音乐，战斗，甚至剧情，而仅仅是好不好玩。这是对游戏认识的拨乱反正，双人成行也注定会成为游戏史上的一座里程碑。

author: Aaron
review: I would give this game a 7/10. My wife and I enjoyed the game overall. It's beautiful, has a good long story-line, and there's a lot of content for the money. The only problem I had with the game was that it was WAY too easy. I feel like the game would be so much better if they added difficulties to pick from, for each player. You don't really get to figure things out by yourself, you don't get to solve anything, it's all just laid out for you and that took away tons of potential fun and time in game.3 things that I think should be incorporated into making difficulties are: Less or no hints for how to use your powers, limited lives on boss fights, reduced or no aim assist.In conclusion, this game is perfect unless you are an experienced gamer or like a little challenge.

Only recommended if you are itching for co-op focused gameplay...maybe skip scenes?Really cool co op focused game design. It's a lot of fun to see what gameplay mechanic they will come up with next. Gotta be honest though, I kinda hate the story. Seemed interesting at first, but don't really dig the dog-piling on the mom, characters make absolute nonsense choices, and biggest issue...most of the characters are awfully annoying.As the game has continued me and my friend have been less and and less inclined to continue...I actually forgot we were playing it.If I do ever finish it and it turns itself around, I'll alter this, but I dunno man....not digging it despite mostly fun gameplay.

author: cruss19
review: I 100% would recommend this game - so long as you're playing it with someone that you've been with for awhile. I would not play this with a stranger or someone that you're just beginning to see.  To elaborate on that last comment; if you're looking for an escape from feelings of the real world, this isn't it. It's a very emotionally heavy game with relationship concepts like divorce and self blame tied in. On that same token, it's one of the most beautiful stories ever told in a video game once it fully unfolds and it's a story that's focused on character development. It's honestly really nice to see a great game where the theme is healthy relationships. It made me and the girlfriend cry at the end. From a gameplay perspective, it offers a great variety of different play styles from chapter to chapter and gives each character unique abilities - that require teamwork to accomplish the goal. It's not immediately obvious what needs done, so it forces you and your significant other to communicate and use "CO-LLA-BO-RATION" to accomplish objectives. It's also a very fine balance that it's easy enough for inexperienced gamers to pick it up quickly (and difficulty can be adjusted in the settings for each character if someone is really struggling), but difficult enough that it's still fun and interesting for the more experienced. The boss fights are also quite fun.If you're looking for a great time with the significant other, but also a game that truly is as fun as old video games were (before the age of microtransactions), buy this. It's for you two.

author: allenjt
review: This is supposed to me multi-player, and it is, except it doesn't work well.  The non-host player always has too much lag to get timing correct.  The "Play local" feature is NOT to play over the LAN, it's to play on the PC with a controller hooked up.  We don't have or use controllers, we're mouse and keyboard all the way.  So, games like FarCry can be played on the LAN, like many other games, with no or little lag.  But the EA servers don't seem to be up to playing this when playing online.  We have 500MB fiber connections on Alienware R7s, so it's not our end.  Other games work great, but this one is too laggy to play.  Otherwise, it seems pretty fun.

author: leon129999
review: i went in expecting a challenging game to play with my friends. It is literally difficult to fail. deaths dont reset your progress apart from in certain areas where it puts you back a very small difference. it definitely loses some excitement/fun by not having any progress lost when you die. like in the tree area when you ride the big wale and it spins around, you dont have to move at all. you can just slide off, die and instantly respawn with no penalty which just ruined that whole area. They definitely shouldve considered good players (not just beginners) by not forcing you into an easy mode. When there is a challenge, the fun part is losing for a while and finally beating the area which feels great as you both put in effort to beat the area and both performed well. The puzzles are also easy to solve.In my opinion, operation tango was a much more fun two player game. it also has so much more replayability as the two characters have a completely different play style compared to it takes two which is relatively similar.That being said. I love how the creators had almost no limits creating this game and chucked in the most random things just making the game so much fun to explore.That being said, all two player games are fun and a great laugh.

author: DohBoy
review: HOW WAS THIS GAME GREEN LIT??? What is a wonderful animation and amazing game development is completely overshadowed by the halfassed concept of content it presents. What was an entirely original idea for the first 4 hours, quickly turns into a derogatory manipulation of previously successful ideas for games throughout the 90's and early 2000's. This game should have ended within the first 6 hours and been a cute but wonderful story with amazing animation and great nostalgia mixed with modern day graphics and animation. That being said it went on for hours and hours with no real character development or interest/connection towards the life experiences of the main protagonists which led to it being a drag to finish the game and by the end just being glad it was over and genuinely hoping they ended up unhappy instead of wishing them the best. Next time don't sell a game based off of how much money you can make and instead make a game based off of how much you genuinely want to make the content involved. 1/30

author: Matt
review: The game looks nice and the environments are cute but there's little more and I don't think it's worth your time.The puzzles aren't really puzzles. They're closer to a series of interactables that move your character through the world in interesting ways. And that process is very slow; All of the animations and cut-scenes are drawn out; If the game tasks you with dodging some projectiles, it will ask you to do so for 3 minutes instead of 30 seconds. It was more of an interactive movie.The narrative created through cut-scenes and banter is both pallid and disconcerting. The game as a whole seems to be geared toward children but I don't think it serves as a interesting or wholesome parable. The relationship of the divorcing couple is pretty toxic and the game seems to charge the daughter with the responsibility to restore their love. The voice acting is vivid but I genuinely disliked all of the characters. I don't know who the target audience is.Without puzzles and without story there's no reason to play the game.

author: Scales of Love
review: I had played A Way Out by the same developer and thought it was a great execution for what was ultimately a fairly weak experience. It had a lot of tools to make the cooperative aspect novel but the moment to moment gameplay was just not interesting enough to carry it unless you were interested in the story. I was dubious over the accolades surrounding It Takes Two as it was by the same team but was blown away once I finally got my hands on it. Cinematic experience games are good fun but tend to never live up to the same adventurous feel their movie counterparts hold due to their constraints on how the characters can handle a situation. Everything needs to firmly lock into place to make sense with the engine the developers created after all. Not It Takes Two. This game is throwing idea after idea after idea. New chapters appear with new powers which lead to even more new powers and modes of transport and visuals. It actually captures the spirit of the family friendly adventure moves exceedingly well. With such an overwhelming amount of mechanics, I kept waiting for the inevitable wonkiness that comes with underdeveloped or untested moments. Instead the game was exceedingly well done. It accomplishes this by never dwelling too long on one aspect which can be praise or criticism depending on your point of view. None of the challenges ever really escape that honeymoon phase of just figuring out how the game wants you to think. Considering the pacing of the story, it works out favorably but don't go in expecting to be pushed back too hard. There are a few lows for me that might be highlights for you but overall I'd say the experience managed to stay so positive by feeling generally good most of the time. Which again, could be seen as negative since it never really goes into a section that feels absolutely fantastic. It's a different kind of game though. With how many ideas it tries, being positive for nearly its entirely runtime is more than enough to make the whole experience feel amazing overall.

author: Jilisa
review: Lesson numero uno: Time!Ask yourselves – do you give each other enough time? Maybe one of you is never at home. Spending too many long evenings at work. Meanwhile, the other has no sense of time whatsoever. Believing that time is limitless! Ay ay ay... Already, we can clearly see that you are on parallel tracks in life that are not connected to each other.The task is then to join the tracks. But how?Simple! I will give one of you the ability to clone yourself. The other, I will grant the power to control time. Then all you need to do is to use your powers and work together to come together!Lesson number two: Passion!How do you find your purpose in life? Through passion! The passion lights the path to the purpose of life. Pursuing your passion might not always pay your bills – but if you give it up, you give up on a part of yourself. You also risk losing the passion for each other along the way.So, I will send you on a journey to help each other rediscover your passions!Used to have a green thumb? We’ve got some serious gardening ahead of us. Or did you stop singing because you “grew up”? Let’s put on a show, baby!Lesson number three: Attraction!What else, besides love, make couples stay together? Mortgage? Kids? No, it’s the attraction of course! It pulls people together. See, attraction is like a magnet. But you need both poles for it to work. North, south. Plus, minus. You, me!What if I told you that actual magnetic powers could help you rediscover a lost attraction?Oh yeah, let the magnets warm you up, baby!– Dr. Hakim

We didn’t find all the mini games but the ones we did find were a lot of fun and (not to spoiler it) but the game takes certain mechanics from a few games like Street Figther and Mario Kart which was cool to see. The ONLY bad thing was EA servers (IKR? SHOCK!). We played online and getting kicked from our playthrough all the time was extremely infuriating to the point we dropped the game for a month or so. Luckily Hazelight are generous in regards to checkpoints so we when we did get kicked not much progress was lost. Definitely recommend but only on local co-op.

author: freed954
review: Ok.. So my girl is a big gamer. Mind you, even though she plays games, our interest in video games is not the same. She loves simple games. I love complicated games. Then I have multiplayer games that I tend to play with my guy friends. When I try to play those games with her, she get's frustrated and quit. So I decided to purchase this game on sale since I seen the reviews. As soon as I started the game, she love the story, also, we end up playing the game for two hours straight together. Mind you my girl has never even played a game with me for more than 5 mins even if it's her own game. The graphics is nice, love the puzzle solving together, controls are good, only problem is the camera with me. After that, love it. I recommend this game for any couple, father & daughter or just any guy with a girl.  NOT to be biased, or anything, but this is a game any female would love to play cooperatively with a anyone.

author: =AVATAR=
review: Very nice game with a good concept. we need more of these kinds of co-op games. HAZELIGHT studio really put their best in this and it really shows.The gameplay mechanics are the main focus here and they nailed it, very good level design and fun puzzles that all require you to think and work with your partner, it really shines when it comes to gameplay and design as this is the best part of the game.Other things to talk about it the story , which has a great pacing and a satisfying ending, it's not the strongest part of the game but it is certainly enough to keep you going.Music is another part of the game that may not be anything special at first but will show it's best at the later chapters of the game which gets much better.The game also has some replayability for atleast 2 times to try out both characters , also maybe trying to play with other friends/partners you might have. Don't forget your friend/partner doesn't need to own the game and can download the friend's pass version to play online with someone who own the game for free.Overall this game did really earn the game of the year title and worth the money spent on.

author: Giga-Roboid
review: I enjoyed this game!I was impressed with the design of the cooperative content. A large issue with co-op games is when a puzzle is presented and one player ends up solving the puzzle for the group. Though this is more prevalent in turn-based games it can occur in real-time ones too.This game mitigates that factor by giving each player different abilities and different puzzles to solve. Normally this would eliminate the co-op feel of the experience, but this game solves that by entangling the puzzles with one another fairly seamlessly.But this game can only be played with Origin. It being listed on Steam doesn't seem like an honest marketing practice by Steam, so I recommend you buy it through Origin instead of here.

author: Ririx
review: After playing through the entire game I can honestly say that it's probably best if you spend your time elsewhere.The game itself has amazing graphics, great sound effects, some super fun puzzles and stuff, but after about the 5th act, it falls off super hard. The puzzles get stupidly easy / basic, the story takes a turn for the dumb, and it's just monotonous. The little girl is the absolute WORST character in the game, along with Dr. Hakim. They're both so annoying and full of cringe that it makes me sad. I get that Rose is a child who doesn't understand the situation, but they've made her flat out stupid. The parents are both very cookie cutter. The mom is a workaholic made to be a raging b---- every 5-10 minutes of gameplay, and the dad is a moron who doesn't work, and of course doesn't support his wife.The ending is absolute GARBAGE. It honestly would have been better if they just killed all the characters instead of pushing a half-arsed story about "collaboration" and divorce. You can tell at some point they didn't know what they wanted to do with the story or how to progress the game, so they stuffed in some cliche bs:  In the first 3-4 acts, you fight a boss, or multiple bosses, but after that, you kinda don't. There are a few other action packed things sprinkled in afterwards, but nothing challenging. Some fights are straight up annoying and tedious rather than challenging, but the most infuriating part is that the minigames are easy to miss. I don't mind looking around or exploring, but if you're not checking every single corner or climbing to the top of every shelf, you'll miss a good bit of them. Some are super basic, not worth doing, or very one sided (mostly the ones a the beginning).Although the game is $20, you can't play it alone and you have to play it with someone else. This is kinda remedied by the fact that the friend pass is free, however there is only one save file and you have to go through tedious folder swapping if you want to play through it with different people. I suppose it's not meant to be played more than once, or with more than one person. Once you've played it through, you'll basically have to sit there and do nothing if you play with another person, otherwise it's just too easy and they don't get to experience the fun aspects of screwing up and killing each other over and over lol. There's no way to save the game which is absolutely UNBEARABLE if whoever you're playing with DC's or has to leave mid-level. Despite the game saying that it is "saving" at the shorter cutscenes, it actually doesn't! So if you quit the game and pick it up later, you'll have to start the entire level over again. It's even more annoying because cutscene skipping doesn't exist. I also found it odd that the game lagged quite a bit for me and the other person playing it, regardless of who was hosting, at certain spots. It was never unplayable and didn't persist for more than 20-30 seconds, but I'd expect no lag, especially on a game that is less graphically intense than most other high-end games.There are some GOOD things with the game. If you explore and play the minigames, I think it has maybe 8 to 10 hours of gameplay. The game is beautiful, has some funny moments, some cute moments, and you'll definitely have fun with whoever you play it with. Unfortunately, at the full price, crappy ending, and mediocre gameplay past the 1/3rd mark, I would suggest getting this on a deep discount, if at all.

author: ☢ HELIX ☢
review: This game is absolutely amazing! The game has a lot of hilarious references. The game has a some beautiful scenery. The game is VERY VERY creative when it comes to all the different puzzles and gadgets that you are given in each level you complete. It took my friend and I about 12-13 hours to complete the game from start to finish. The only negative about this game is that once you get near the end you feel almost as if the game is being dragged on a bit, but it's still amazing! This is hands-down the most fun co-op game that I have ever played and there were several moments where my friend and I were having SO much fun. I hope the creators of this game make another co-op game in the future because they really know how to make an entertaining, funny, challenging, and overall elite tier co-op game. Highly recommend it!

author: DÄNNÄH!
review: It Takes Two is hands down my game of the year! I know most people would disagree, because it doesn't offer groundbreaking visuals, and it is 'made for kids' (Whatever that means...), but it does offer a whole new experience that I have never seen from another game! I think the best way to describe it is 'a series of smaller games that all come together to tell one big story'. Speaking of 'story'; You're playing as either Cody or Mae, a young couple that lost the spark of their relationship and are contemplating getting a divorce. After being turned into dolls by the hands of their daughter and an anthropomorphic book named Dr. Hakim (Yes, it's a wild ride!), the couple travels through several awe-inspiring and breathtaking worlds to try to rekindle the flame of their relationship and stay together. Couples' therapy through cOlLaBoRaTiOn!1!!11! In each world, Cody and Mae get a new special power that only works in said world, and they're gonna have to work together to overcome obstacles and move on. Each world also focuses on a unique gameplay style. There is flight simulation, melee combat, third-person shooting, and much more! It Takes Two really is a game you need to try, especially with a friend (Who can play for free remotely, using the game's Friend pass, by the way)! At a lower price point than your average triple A game, It Takes Two offers so much more than Call of Duty, FIFA, and all the others!

author: D.Apokalypse
review: My GF and I really loved this game. Our reaction after finishing it follows:Her: Fun. Clever, funny. Difficult. Different.Me: Challenging enough, but not frustratingly so. Very much different.Her: Sneaky. I think that’s prob one of my fave games.Me: Great art, great music, great story and great mechanics. Can't ask more for a game.Her: Yeah, for real though.Story hit home for both of us in a way that moved both of us to tears. We both absolutely recommend this gem of a game. Also, with Steam Friend's Pass, you need only buy one copy and share it with your co-op partner. Great value made even mo'bettah.

author: mai
review: 和尼宝把双人成行打通了主要是我够懒 3月26发售6月27打通 整整用了三个月的时间 但其实游戏时间也就只有15小时但是确实是继逃出生天(A WAY OUT)之后最棒的双人游戏，制作人Fares(逃出生天其实也是他做的)说的不好玩退一千刀确实是有底气说的出口的15个小时里做进去了大概20个左右的大场景，每个场景都有自己的特色，玩法上一脉相承逃出生天的co-op双人合作模式，并且这一作还加入了各式的道具，每种类型的道具也有特定的用处，两个玩家要互相配合，并且使用道具才能推进剧情，所以十几个小时下来也并不觉得枯燥。并且在推进游戏的过程当中一路会遇到各种双人友尽对战小游戏，并且中间还加了一段固定视角RPG，甚至还可以下国际象棋，按内容上来说塞得足够满，确实做得足够诚意，也足够用心，这一点就真的值回票价。美中不足的是剧情有点拉稀，并且游戏的定位有点摸不着头脑spoil warning剧情讲的是形同陌路的夫妻在两个玩家的操控下，进入了一个缩小的世界经历一连串的冒险，然后在冒险当中被对方感动得无以复加，再然后相互啵嘴破镜重圆（至少结局是和好）的故事，我玩得时候其实一直在挠头。一个是像我这种悲观人很难去想象即将要离婚的夫妻会因为一个十小时的冒险经历而复合，另外一个就是游戏很侧重去描写他们的女儿不忍心自己父母离婚的场面，甚至在最后还要尝试离家出走(我觉得是以一种小孩式的威胁)的方式来让父母撤回决定，然后从冒险里回来的父母就为了女儿，决定不再离婚——宣扬的观念有问题，这我觉得就是赤裸的绑架两个人合不合是性格和三观决定的，如果本身性格不合，那经历了十个小时的冒险我觉得也没有多少意义，激情过后还是要生活的，但是冒险并没有消除矛盾，就如同国内千万家庭一样，形婚十几年之后就如同陌路人，如果为了女儿而强行留在一起就是延长了这份痛苦而已，以后的不和的时候真的只会更多——要离的早晚都会离的，没离的要不是一方麻木了，就是拿刀把对方给捅了所以我真的很难想象一个美国团队能做出这种有着中国传统家庭观的游戏，真的觉得高院和民政部也别搞什么离婚冷静期了，引进这个给离婚的人玩就够了 所以我觉得剧情上要做到无懈可击，还得要从化解矛盾至少在对话上要剖析不和入手，但是这对于一款游戏来说确实有点苛刻了是吧。定位上，刚开始我看着像童话一样的风格觉得应该是给年轻朋友至少是适合8+的小鹏宇游戏的，如果是什么父子玩我都承认是款卟错的亲子作品；结果越到后面越儿童邪典了吧？直接分尸小象我一个成年人都感到不适，什么打到一半内脏炸裂的机械蜜蜂，为了洗地板狂揍会哭的云，还有什么没有头的管弦乐队，确 确实不是给小鹏宇玩的..9/10不过总体还是瑕不掩瑜，今年还是3A小年，如果没有什么强力的竞争者我觉得GOTY甚至都可以。并且前作逃出生天我觉得也很棒，强烈安利，但是能爽玩这一类coop游戏前提是还是得有一个跟你玩的固定朋友

author: bentou
review: Great game, one of the best co-op story games I've played. The variety in this game is crazy; each part of the game is unique to the point that each chapter could be a different game. Characters can seem pretty dumb at times but they work well with the overall tone of the game and both main characters become much better as the game progresses. The pacing is also great, and is made so that the changes in the characters as the story progresses is believable. Visually stunning; great mix of pixar-like cartoony characters and realistic environments, and some areas that are just beautiful. As an added bonus, there are lots of little details, a lot of optional exploring and mini-games that can be done, and a lot of references to other games. 10/10 made me laugh a lot.

author: Sun Paladin
review: (Ignore my playtime, I bought the full version of the game close to the end of it, it should be closer to 12.5 hours)Genuinely an amazing experience. I was blown away by the music, the visuals, the art direction, and how fluid the game feels to play as well.Each chapter has unique puzzles for you and your co-op partner to solve that never felt repetitive, cheap, or too obtuse. It felt just right, and I feel like once again Hazelight managed to give us a spectacular co-op exclusive story.I STRONGLY recommend you get this game, even at the full price. It's worth every dollar, and is packed to the brim with love, polish, and care.Pick up the game, find a friend to grab the friend pass, and PLEASE play this game, because it's a game you won't forget any time soon.

author: Gnampf
review: It Takes Two is the best co op game I've played so far. Every level is unique with always new mechanics, during the whole time there is not even boredom, which is quite rare today. The graphics were beautiful, the soundtrack was very good, it was funny, it was just one of the most fun games in the last couple of years. My only criticism is that the story was sometimes a bit too cringy but otherwise it was a great game.9/10

author: Zache
review: This review will contain ZERO spoilers for It Takes Two, this is a review for players who are thinking about buything It Takes Two.It Takes Two is a action adventure platform game with split-screen cooperative mulitplayer, singleplayer mode is not an optionin this game. The game is developed by Hazelights Studios based in Stockholm Sweden and they gave us Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons and A Way Out.-So much passion and love was put into this game and you can really feel it, feeling such a passion for a game is rare which is why it has such an unique charm.-Only one person need to buy the game, that person can then invite the other one with a friend's pass. This just proves that they didn't make A Way Out for money.-Immersive and engaging story from beginning through end.-A good soundtrack and an fantastic theme song.-It Takes Two always gives you new tools, powers and it lets you explore completly new, different and unique environments after every chapter. This makes the game fun from beginning to end and it never gets repetitive.-It Takes Two is extremly long, roughly around 11-13 hours long even if you decide to play it quick. Based out of the content in this game, 11-13 hours is a lot more that I ever expected.-It Takes Two is based of Cody and May, the character development within these two is written extremely well.-It Takes Two has fun small mini games that you can find throughout your playthrough, you can play these with your partner.-Amazing graphics with an unique, special but good style to it.-The voice actors in this game did an excellent job portraying the characters.-Without spoiling the ending, it was really hyped up and a good ending to this beautiful game.-This is sadly one of those games that you finish one or twice and never play it again.-Although I personally loved this game, I can still definitely see that this game has a special style of it that isn't for everyone.-Unlike Hazelight Studios big hit A Way Out, It Takes Two misses the opportunity to make choices together with your partner. It's understandable why they decided to not add this feature but it would've added something extra to this masterpiece.Although it's rare every once in a while you play a game that is so fantastistic that you simply can't get your mind out of it, It Takes Two is one of those games. I am sure I will think back to when I played this game in 20 years, the experience me and my partner had when playing this masterpiece was a fantastic once in a lifetime feeling. I have close to no bad things to say about this game, the only big and sad thing with this game is that you only play it once before leaving it and never touching it again but that really shouldn't stop you from trying this out. As a person who spends 8-10 hours per day on my computer just playing games, as a person who have played hundreds and hundred of difference games I can proudly say that this game is without any doubt my top 10 games. There's no chance I won't give this game a 10/10, thank you Hazelights Studios.

author: Aka Manto
review: I do not normally leave steam reviews for games, but there was absolutely no way I could play through this game without recommending everyone to buy this immediately. I have only played for 5 hours so far but I have found nothing to critique. Each section feels creative and unique with new ideas and abilities to master. The mini games throughout help keep things competitive although you are trying to work cooperatively. There is so much to explore without feeling overwhelmed by large collection logs or huge discoverable areas. The gameplay and puzzles throughout throw you challenges but allows for people newer to video games to be able to learn quickly as to not be discouraged. The story is magnificent and you quickly will feel immersed after no time at all. Long have my buddy and I been searching for a coop game that can satisfy all the qualities that "It Takes Two" provides. This is truly an all-around coop experience for all levels of friendship or relationship that will put your team-work to the test. For $40 both you and whoever you want can play and explore the many hours of  visually-appealing gameplay. Do not forget to work with CO-LLA-BO-RATION! Enjoy!

author: Ghost
review: I stumbled upon this and did not regret my purchase. My cousin was skeptical about this game based on how it looks but after 1 hour of it, exceeded not only his but my expectations too. Just finished this game and had to give a good feedback on this amazing gem. The story is amazing, humor is a bonus and gameplay is tons of fun!

author: Clarridge42
review: Played this game with my wife and we had and absolute blast. The gameplay itself is varied enough to keep staying fresh throughout, the mini games littered in each level gave a little break to relax and have less puzzle solving fun, and the levels were brilliantly thought up designed and put together. We bought two copies and played it that way together because I assumed that would remove the screen from being split, which it didn't...and at first I thought I didn't really like that design choice but as levels progressed it made it really easy to see what the other person is doing or looking at and in some puzzles almost a necessity to make it through without being an absolute headache. Maps were large enough in some places to feel like you had a solid free roam area to explore and the transitions were great. Even though the levels vary so much in design and look, I never felt like I was in a weird place for no reason or that it was a level just chopped in to cover any tropes. The humor was great, the banter between the two felt really good and I've always been a sucker for a game that can make you feel something without it being forced or contrived. I will admit *no spoilers* that the ending didn't quite feel as earned as it could have, and there was at least one major instance I felt like I might not be rooting for the main characters and it kind of stuck with me through the remainder of the gameplay, but I'm no writer, so who am I to tell anyone it wasn't to character. Loved the game from start to finish and look forward to any game these great people com,e out with in the future.

author: UpInFlam3z
review: One of the greatest adventure games I have ever played in my entire life. The level of artistry and imagination are unparalleled. I found myself screaming "how is this game SO GOOD?" at least a dozen times during the game. I was expecting this game to be a 3 - 4 hour experience, but it just kept on going! The gameplay was smooth and felt great to play. Every time a new mechanic was introduced, it was exceptionally innovative. It Takes Two was an absolute joy. This is hands down Game of the Year, and I wish more developers made games with a fraction of the creativity that this game has. The only complaints I have are that the game was a bit too easy and that the dialogue could have been a bit wittier. That's it. Every other aspect of this game was incredible. BUY. THIS. GAME.

author: gertaarl
review: I love cooperative games.  Be they Action Role-Playing Games, team shooters, escape rooms, or strategy board games-- cooperative gaming is my jam.  I like a game to have clever puzzles, or intense battles where you can barely eke out a victory through coordination and teamwork.I am critical of the stories we tell and receive in our media/art.  I appreciate subtle storytelling, well-crafted worlds, dynamic characters, and drama.  Biting commentary?  Wild sarcasm?  Slapstick comedy?  Pop culture references?  They all have their place, and I adore them when used properly.So how does It Takes Two fall flat at almost every hurdle?  It's almost an accomplishment in itself.  I loaded up the Game of the Year 2021 expecting at the very least to be entertained by dynamic characters, environments, cooperative challenges.  Instead, the prevailing emotion I felt playing through with my friend was boredom, aspiring occasionally to frustration or annoyance.  The protagonists are introduced and they are not likable.  That's fine-- this can be fertile ground for drama, right?  Tension and resolution?  You learn to appreciate their foibles, and they grow together, and eventually overcome their differences?  Not exactly.  The resolution, when it comes, feels unearned.  The characters don't so much grow as they are body-snatched in the last chapter.  These are pod-people of the characters as they were even ten minutes earlier.  In the end, player agency is utterly stripped, and one cannot help but feel that these two just rummaged around in their attic until they got thirsty enough to stick it out for another six months before getting divorced.When not "advancing" the "story", they are abusing one another, shouting the answers to "puzzles" at one another within moments of arriving at a given situation (meanwhile the UI is also shouting at you which button you should press to pursue this goal).  They mock one another for their performance and shortcomings relentlessly.  The disbelief to be suspended to accept the resolution of the plot arc is... unreasonable.The writing for the protagonists is poetry compared to that of the antagonist, Dr. Hakim, about whom the less said, the better.So the characters aren't great.  The comedy falls flat and drama feels... bad.  The writing isn't great, is the gist.  There's still a lot of great cooperative gameplay, right?Well, no.  The game tries to be ten or so different types of game, but none of them (good or bad) is given room to breathe and develop into an experience.  As a result of the shifting genres, the game's UI has to broadcast your controls pretty much constantly.  There are no fewer than four vehicle sections-- I know I am of a particular PTSD type group still suffering from Half Life 2.  I recognize my bias against vehicle levels.  But some poor bastards spent hours and hours of their lives animating and coding frogs, spiders, an airplane made of garbage.  And then writing dialogue and jokes(?) about them, all for two minutes of gameplay that is somehow both fleeting and interminable.While there were precious few instances of fun to be had (I am remembering moments of the ARPG and rhythm game sections), they are terribly brief, and far outnumbered by worse.  Tedious and/or obvious puzzles, clunky platforming, and quicktime events are followed by cutscenes that feel like they ought to have been player actions.All of this innovative gameplay sits atop an often beautiful world that begs to be explored while simultaneously refusing to reward the players for doing so.  Maybe the real rewards was the divorce we made along the way.I openly applaud the accessibility of the game.  Had there been any consequences for death, the sometimes baffling control decisions or badly designed platforming combined with performance issues would have been unforgiveable.  I wouldn't recommend it to gamers looking for a challenge of any type.The game is quite pretty.  At its best it is a weird intersection of garry's mod and Little Big Planet.  At its worst, it is boring, poorly-written, and creepy.

author: Barrett1983
review: I think this developer came from a divorced family and felt if they can't have a happy family no one else can. Played this game with my wife (non-gamer) and would not recommend for anyone else in the same situation. I thought this would be a fun co-op with the wife, but it caused more frustration than anything. First level was nice, second level ramped way up, and third level was rage quit. The camera control was too difficult for her and there is no enemy indication so when she came back to life she would die spinning around trying to find the mid level boss just to die again as soon as she saw him. So if you plan to play with someone and introduce them to gaming I would not recommend this one. If they are already a gamer then I can see this as a fun co-op. There is no game play difficulty to help ease them in... save your marriage and steer clear.

author: Noah
review: Honestly, it's not that I don't recommend it. It's a good game. I'd rate it a C+But with ~95% positive ratings on steam, I can't say it's that good.PROS: the visuals, art, world and game design are top notch AAA quality. There are some truly beautiful levels. The gameplay is so varied it's like 30 games in one. It's very well polished with not a single noticable bug or glitch when I played. And there is a TON of content. My 16 hour playtime was 1 playthrough, and I skipped most of the optional minigames.So why not recommended? Why not say it's good? Because the flaws of the game run so deep through the entire experience, tainting it all.CONS1) The writing. The entire story makes you feel like you're trapped and being punished into playing the game. It's all pretty one-note from start to finish, there are no twists, no turns Just 15 hours of a story that could be summarized in 1 sentence. You can guess the entire plotline 15 seconds into the intro cutscene. The main characters and their child are wholly unlikable. I hated spending time with them, hated listening to them whine about their trivial problems "you didn't compliment my gardening, waahh". I had no sympathy for them at all, and couldn't get invested in their journeys or the stakes of the story. Cody is a contemptible loser, and May only seems OK in comparison to him.2) The gameplay: Yes, it's one of the "PROS" too. Because the variety of gameplay is the only thing that makes it bearable. Every time I was bored out of my mind and wishing the game would be over, there was a complete change in gameplay that gave it a little more life to keep going. It's a mishmash of gameplay from every other game out there. There's puzzles, platformers, shooters, action-adventure, etc. If it's been in an old arcadey console game before, then you'll get a chance to play it here.Between 1 & 2, I just kept wanting the game to be over already. But we'd committed too deep already and just wanted to finish the damn thing.Just to give an example of how hateable the main characters are, I'll have to spoiler:I truly wanted these two to lose, die, fail, get divorced. They are both awful and toxic, and the kid probably would have been better if she had run away from the two monsters who danced and laughed in her tears.So why still a C+ rating? Well look at the PROS again.  The visuals, art and world are beautiful. And the fact that there was so much variety of gameplay that I still played 16 hours instead of uninstalling is a testament to how fun the gameplay can be.

author: CowLick
review: If you don’t watch the scene, then at least be warned that there will be uncomfortably brutal cartoon depictions of death / torture in this game  If you’re cool with that, then the rest of the game will probably be fine for you. But we went into this game under the impression that it was a fun, happy-go-lucky co-op game to snuggle up on the couch with. We did not sign up for forced torture of screaming innocents. (Shoutout to the game being Rated T for Teen by the way). So that one scene completely soured the majority of our playthrough when the game expects us to sympathize with and cheer on these characters afterwards.On the plus side, the gameplay itself is fun, most of the ideas in the game feel innovative and fresh. The controls are smooth and the gameplay transitions are impeccable. But on the other hand, the story itself felt weak, the character development was practically non-existent, and the game offered little insights on what it really means to be a parent / spouse. Unfortunately for my fiancee and I, the pretty graphics and imaginative world weren’t enough to drown out the apathy created by poor storytelling and unnecessary dark humour.

author: rubm
review: I solicited a refund after 61 minutes of playing.The pros: The game seems polished. Everything just worked, playing with two controllers in local co-op. The graphics are nice, the physics are very nice right from the beginning. The cons: The game didn't have any sort of skill progression in the 61 minutes I played. Doesn't seem to be a part of it. Also, this game is purely co-operative, there is no individual competition between the characters (as far as I can tell from the short time I played).The real negative is this: Between the chapters, there appears this book character which teaches actual lessons abort relationship, about love, cooperation and so on. I understand that this is part of the story and I play a character that is planning to go through divorce and so on ... BUT. My SO and I like couch co-op and we loved Trine 2, despite it being a bit childish and cheesy. This book character was just too much for us. The game has pretty good review statistics, so I seem to be the only one. But we can't help it. For us, it is Impossible to enjoy the game like this. We are too old, or not the target audience or I don't know.

review: After all the positive reviews I bit the bullet and bought this game. After all the real annoyance of installing origin and signing up and then friend listing on origin we sat down to play. In the same room across from one another we booted up the game on our steam decks and sat down to play. Now the deal breaker. Forced split screen camera view. My wife hates split screen. Finds it distracting and immersion breaking. It Takes Two... much of your screen up with forced split screen. Beware it is a design choice for "Story Telling" or as I see it "Your partner doesnt play video games so you can watch them and back seat game by telling them how to be better at their part of the puzzle"

review: This game is a masterpiece!I have never played a game, with more love to details and marvellous gameplay! Every level differs from the one before, it's absolutely beautiful and the riddles are absolute stunning! I love this game so much - except for one detail. Rose. This kid is the reason for the game itself, but the sequences with her are annoying and, in my opinion, not in her favor. She's pictured as absolutely dumb and I just don't like her. But if you ignore her, there couldn't be a more lovable game. + Teamwork NEEDED!+ Great riddles+ a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of details and fun extras (like the spa)+ fun dialogues+ awesome mechanics+ absolutely stunning levels+ cute graphics- The kid's annoying as hell, but easy to ignore.TL;DR: I WANT MORE OF THIS! PLEASE, HAZELIGHT: MAKE MORE SUCH GAMES!

author: Pwnonator
review: Started by me and my friend agreeing with the divorce, but than  agreeing at the end, it's our daughters fault for all of this . So Once we're back to normal, we sending her to military school. For the actual game. It was very fun. Loved Away Out, but this was leaps better. They say teamwork makes the dream work, but when you give us ways to troll our friends, you know I'm taking it whenever i can.  It has a ton of games from other games within it from sunset overdrive rail grinding,to some arpg.  Highly recommend this.  No match making so you will need a friend to join you, and the can with the friend's pass.  The game itself took us around 12 hours to complete. Probably around 11.5 hours if we stop killing each other.  I don't believe in rating anything at max because nothings perfect, so i give this a 9.9 out of 10. :) Shameless plug: I'm a small content creator and I'm trying to dabble into expanding and improving. Here's Ep 1 of It takes 2 if you want a more of an idea of the gameplay.

author: Fatty McBoomBoom
review: The only part i dont like is i cannot go back in time and experience this all over again for the first time.What can you expect? well it's hard to describe this wild adventure but heres a few things.-polished game & controls, nothing feels clunky. -lots of world variety, game feels huge. -great graphics-puzzles (not to hard that the game feels slow, but hard enough to make you think)-hidden achievements if thats ur thing.-varied gameplay. (one moment ur zipping through an underwater world using magnets as propulsion, the next your crawling through a top down RPG as a wizard hurling frost bombs.)It take's Two is a GEM, the devs put some heart and soul into this one, and ive enjoyed every bit of it.With the friends pass i do recommend this game at full price its worth every penny.One side note to the dev, what in the cheek grabbing sam heck were yall THINKING with the elephant scene, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ that was so cringe and fricked up, i know dudes its just a cartoon but daaaymn.

author: SoK |
review: At this point I haven't finished the game, but so far I absolutely cannot recommend this game at full price.The gameplay can be okay, but it's extremely linear and doesn't allow you to do much if any thinking outside the box. When playing online and not local there are multiple parts in the game where it's extremely frustrating due to latency issues (or perhaps just horrible controls), and there's at least one point where I've been flat out soft-locked by some dumb programming that disabled all my controls until I restarted at "last checkpoint" and had to re-do five minutes of stuff to get back there. Additionally there are tons of mini "PVP" games and so far almost every one has been horrible.The story is quite abysmal as well with an extremely idiotic couple of main characters and a story that goes from "Sure, that's alright" to "You're kidding, right?" quite quickly. I'll be utterly baffled if this can somehow pull itself together by the end, but as it is I've been finding that both the gameplay and story have been taking a nose-dive as I get further. I'm pretty baffled by how much people enjoy this game. If this were a single player game I would've quit it an hour or two ago playtime-wise.

author: ayo_itAlex
review: My wife's boyfriend let me stay up past my bed time to play this game, definitely recommended!Honestly tho:This game has something for everyone. Action, adventure, comedy, romance, heartbreak, you name it and it has it. I never leave reviews but after completing this game (14 hours of game-play btw) I felt an obligation to give this game what it deserves. I didn't discover a single issue with this game, no audio/visual bugs, no glitches, no issues with connection for my gf who played the game via friend's pass (also an insanely good idea, the fact one person can buy the game and another plays for free is just... ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ great). If this game was £60 it's worth it, I'd even say as good as £70, so the £30 something I paid is a steal. Now we've completed the game, we are going to replay it as the other character, as it's essentially a different game (for Cody/May). Support the dev's as these dev's actually have fantastic ideas and know how to make a game. A good game. A very, very good game. Can't wait for their next one. Also, credit to the actor's, both voice and motion capture's as every level had new/newer animations and nothing felt reused or boring. Not a single dull moment to be had. The comedy timing and delivery throughout this game was spot-on perfect. If any dev's/actor's/anyone who participated in the development/making of this game sees this, hat's off to you. You made the 14hrs I spent playing this game an absolute dream and reignited my passion for gaming.

author: Aquaneesha
review: This game was, in my mind, very problematic. I get that it is trying to be cutesy by having a kid try to make her parents stay together, but in reality it's not necessarily a bad thing for parents to get divorced. Some people find out that they don't work as a married couple, and they shouldn't stay together. The game continues to force the main characters to stay together, despite their obvious issues. Any "resolution" at the end is completely contrived and doesn't feel earned in the least. They're just together because.....well because the game needs them to be because it's the end of the game. Not because they earned it and not because it made sense. This forcing of a relationship is super gross and completely discounts the agency of the characters. Also, a big part of the game involves doing a lot of work to set up a certain situation for one character to do something, despite that character stating REPEATEDLY that they DO NOT WANT TO DO IT. The other characters just laugh it off with comments like "it'll be fine!" It clearly is not fine....Beyond the issues with the framing of the game, I have problems with how it controls. For a platformer that relies on jumping from one place/thing to another, the mechanics of this game are very sloppy and not tight in the least. I continually struggled to make a character perform a simple action, simply because of how the character controlled and how floaty the jumping was.This game is good to play with someone who doesn't really game (if you can get over the problematic story), but if you and the person you are planning on playing with are both gamers, I highly suggest you play a better game like Portal 2.

author: Dorkaxe
review: It's a decent co-op game, and a few of the levels are genuinely really fun. The best aspect of the game in my opinion is how welcoming it is to people who aren't used to playing a lot of games. It cycles through a lot of different genres, at times even fighting and topdown action. The boss fights are the best example of being welcoming to newcomers, as most have all the attacks you'd expect (expanding ring you need to jump over, shadows on the ground indicating an attack from above, heavily telegraphed swipes to jump over etc) so it's a nice training exercise for the newbie. This game excels I think with one experienced and one non-experienced player. That being said, the story in this game is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ awful and the cutscenes take up a shockingly large amount of your playtime. The characters are annoying as hell, and the premise itself is beyond childish, bordering on problematic. Sometimes adults should get divorced. The game itself is also just way too ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ long. It starts off really well, putting you into environments that are clearly a part of your house/yard. All of the garage/attic(I think?) bits were great, the tree was pretty good, and as was Rose's room. Everything afterwards just gets ridiculous, and it just feels like padding after a while. I can only take so much of the samge puzzle platforming gameplay with a new gimmick. The clock and snowglobe, I mean, cmon now. If this was half the length, I may have wanted to replay the game with someone else, but as it is now, I'll be lucky to even finish the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ thing. Also that ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ book is a piece of ♥♥♥♥.

author: gobbee
review: I love cooperative games. Not cooperative games based on shooting things together, and not "cooperative" games where you're forced to fight each other. Cooperative games where you actually, you know, work together. And this game? This game has that. Boy does it have that. You really do have to cooperate, and it's executed amazingly. Superbly. Artfully.The level designs and puzzles are stunning. "Eureka" moments in video games are what give me life, and there are many of them in this game. It looks and plays beautifully, and though there were a few moments that frustrated me, and even some puzzles or mechanics I don't think I quite got, on the whole, I would say that, gameplay wise, this cooperative platformer/puzzler is executed wonderfully.What's even better is that you do not have to buy this game twice. You buy it once, and then anyone who has the entirely free friend's pass can play the entire game with you. How amazing is this?But I can't and I won't recommend it. Ever.(Spoilers ahead.)************I lived my life in an abusive family. I am on the spectrum, so I see the world a little differently. My only friends were the dolls and toys I had, because I just didn't know how to connect with people. And even those rare times where I was able to let people past my shell, my family's absurd and shocking habits would eventually scare these friends away.Cody and May are abusive parents. Full stop. They are cruel, mean, little people, and I had to spend the entire game playing one of them when, frankly, I didn't want to. They are terrible people, and they never get better. They never realize that what they are doing is ultimately harmful to themselves and their daughter. They never take strides towards being better people. They. Never. Apologize. For one thing they do.It may seem strange, even childish, for me to say that I wanted to stop after what they did to Cutie. I wanted to stop and never play again. I forged ahead, tense, angry, confused. Desperately hoping they would make this up to their daughter. Because while it is not outright stated, I believe their daughter is on the spectrum, and as such her toys may be her only friends. As mine were.They didn't. I don't assume they had anything to do with the band-aids keeping Cutie together in the ending credits.I am not a mother. My own scared me off from the prospect. But if I was, I can damn well tell you that I'd never willingly want to make my child cry to help myself. There is very little in the world that would get me to try and make my child cry, especially in such a heartless, terrible way.It's really a shame, because this game has some amazing sequences. Some outstanding puzzles. The controls are tight. I was left breathless in the music levels - as the song I and my husband composed was integrated into the soundtrack, and at the very end where we were using our controls for that awesome club party in a very Warioware-esque way. (Even though I found the ending to that level - and the game - lackluster. They wrote amazing music and we're left with a lyricless "la la" song for May to "sing"? Talk about dropping the ball...)I had high hopes that I may replay this game with my best friend, but I don't think I can bring myself to do that. Because I don't want to help Cody and May. They don't seem to want to help themselves. If they had an ounce of recognition and contrition for what they had done... but they don't. And it left a sour taste in my mouth, and a pit in my stomach that returns whenever I think about this game.

author: ragosaurus
review: Awesome level design, challenging puzzles requiring strict cooperation, tons of secrets to discover, solid platforming. I'd say the game's a little easy for most gamers and some of the areas/minigames get a little janky.The story, the characters, and the dialogue are just excruciatingly bad.Parents? I rooted for them to die all the way through the story.Dr Hakim? Just not funny. And not in this, "lawl I get to laugh with the main characters at how cringy this guy is", more in the "I have to walk off the third hand embarrassment every time one of his cutscenes comes up" kinda way.Kid? Seems slow.And something I've seen other people mention in their reviews that I think just highlights how you've no idea how to write a coherent, entertaining story. How the ♥♥♥♥ do you make a PEGI12 game where you torture a cute, sentient being, ripping off its limbs, while it's trying to crawl away begging for its life? I've played some sick games in my time, but there's time and there's place for dismemberment. This was not it. Get a grip people.

review: I can't understand the positive reviews for this game. I guess if all you care about are graphics and game mechanics, then yes, it's great. If you care about story, this game is abysmal. There is virtually no character development. The parents (the playable characters) are simply bad people. They are unlikeable and cruel to each other throughout the game. Even worse, they are AWFUL to their distressed child.There is a scene is this game that I feel deserves a warning and should be mentioned especially to people hoping to play the game with a child. It's shocking, and really traumatic and serves no narrative purpose. It's just there for shock value:

author: Microsoft Word
review: Finished the game with my partner. I suspect my partner would give a thumbs up for this game due to graphics and some small delightful gameplay here and there, but other than that, perhaps we both dislike it.First of all, Do not play this game if you have poor tolerance of bad accents. There are two characters (out of the four main ones) who have really really bad and seemingly fake accents. Having to put up with them is painful. You'd be enjoying gameplay and once you hit a cutscene you just want to mute the game.The puzzles are largely about ninja-roping here and there and gliding. It's quite Trine-esque, except half the characters are annoying. If you're an adult, you'd probably dislike that the characters give you zero time to figure out the puzzle yourself. They'd be talking out loud to each other on what you need to do, so you don't exactly have to think... for a puzzle game.Some parts of the game has delightful paths . But sometimes you'd like to think you can venture elsewhere on the map but it's just not possible.It feels like a kids' game.. and yet it isn't. There are some parts which can be pretty scary and inhumane .But, if you want a no-brainer, two-player, adult-required-finesse, and annoying voice-acting game, perhaps this is for you. Otherwise, Trine is a pretty good alternative.

author: jamuspsi
review: Here's the thing: this game is FANTASTIC.  But you should not buy it through Steam, because whatever nonsense hoops it has to jump through- launching EA's Origin client and telling IT to start the game- doesn't work reliably.  Launching from Steam opens the origin client, but not the game.  Launching from origin, Steam reacts as though the game will start.. then doesn't.  Launch the EXE?  Origin opens itself, then minimizes itself, then opens itself again. No game.Again, the game, when I actually got it to launch once, was FANTASTIC fun and way better than I thought it would be.  I'd love to play it again someday.

author: Sanity
review: This is hands down the best co-op I've ever played, and I'm not just saying that because I can use the hammer on my husband. Pros:- Beautiful graphics- It requires problem solving skills and cooperation - Nice new environments everywhere you go- Plenty of giggles- Unique tools for each charachterCons:- Split screen, but after a few minutes you don't even notice it so it's not a big deal. - The constant movements and different camera angles can sometimes cause a bit of confusion, but it's temporary. All in all, it's so worth the money and I'm very happy with this game!

author: const arch *
review: The actual gameplay in It Takes Two leaves a ton to be desired, and the fantastic graphics really don't make up for it.I was bored most of the time that I was playing, as most of the game boils down to running up to the icon that shows you you can use your current power there, using it, and then your partner doing the same. Half the time the interaction is basically just opening doors. There was always one solution to everything, and it was typically an extremely straight forward use of the ~2 powers you had. Some of the boss fights were actually pretty good, and there were occasional moments of fun gameplay, but they passed quickly and left you back on the slog of you and your friend running to the next interactable, pressing the button, and then running to the next interactable again. As for the story, there was one part that I was surprised in a good way by, but aside from that it was really not that interesting, and the characters annoyed us quite a bit.It's beautiful, there's clearly a lot of artistic work put into it, but I can't say that I was having fun for the majority of my playtime.

author: flakor8
review: One of the most unique games I've played in a while! It uses the mechanics of both player's screens as well as your partner's full cooperation in order to complete the puzzles that are in this game. And there are a LOT of puzzles, with each one being both unique and different from one another, again using yours and your partners newfound abilities for each puzzle. Abilities that you get at a frequent pace, with each new section offering new mechanics to learn in order to succeed on to another new section, with another new ability. The story was better than I probably give credit for. I thought it was going to be fairly generic, but there are times where the story goes absolutely off the rails, and it seems as though drugs are the only way to comprehend what on Earth is going on. All in all, this is a game I'd recommend if you have a solid friend to play it with, or just someone you want to get closer with/learn more about.

author: WorldConqueror
review: Unplayable due to too many glitches. Had no problems at first BUT ONLY UNTIL the first boss (vacuum cleaner). My gf with the Friend's Pass experience unbelievably long lags thus we can only poorly respond to the boss (she tried lowering all graphics settings to the lowest but to no avail). We could not attack the boss fast enough due to her lags.I also often could not mount the vacuum cleaner weapon. Even after pressing E repeatedly, what happens afterwards is only an animation of my character about to mount the weapon, but then slipping from the weapon back to the ground. Then the time is up and we could not attack the boss.After a considerable amount of time (due to the errors above), the vacuum cleaner boss does not stop stomping the ground at all. Thus we could not even progress as we did not get the opportunity to attack with the vacuum cleaner weapon anyway.My laptop is a gaming laptop with i7 11th gen, 16GB RAM, RTX 3060. My internet connection is fairly fast.My gf's laptop also has i7 and 16GB RAM. Her internet is much faster and better than mine.Seeing that many other people in Reddit has similar problems with glitch, I believe this is either the game's fault or Origin's fault or EA server's fault.Unbelievably unplayable. Me and my gf had great expectations and was looking for so many fun date nights playing this game. Now it's only disappointment. I requested a refund immediately.Two thumbs down.

review: I'm shocked to see how many positive reviews this game got. It's extremely linear for the first 2/3 of the game and doesn't get much better towards the end. the entire point of the game is to solve incredibly easy puzzles. It's essentially a mashup of several different video games rolled in a shiny looking game. It's extremely boring if you're any kind of a gamer. If you've never picked up a video game before this may be the game for you though.  I've been playing this with my gf and we both can't stand turning it on. The only reason we're finishing it is because we spent $60 CAD on it.

author: acorn_leaf
review: The gameplay itself is so fun for a multiplayer, but sadly it just isn't enough to compensate for the very poor substance of the rest of the game. Graphics aren't everything to me. What makes a game great is what's below the surface, and this had little. So the goal is about trying to keep two parents together that are planning on getting a divorce- by forcing the mom and dad to use teamwork to get out of a pickle. Right there we didn't need any of that. Let them get a damn divorce if they're miserable. It's weird that the kid seems written as responsible for their parents' happiness, and becomes in charge of saving their marriage. Just red flags everywhere. That just seems really weird to put that on a kid character, I don't understand the target audience with that at all. And don't get me started about that book character. Oh god, anytime that character appeared my friend and I were just like, "oh god not this again". The game would be great if it weren't for the poor story, the cringey stereotypes and unbearable dialogue and one-liners. We couldn't even finish the game, couldn't take any more.One last thing I'd like to add: To compare this game to Portal is absolute blasphemy, I tell ya! Portal had so many more dimensions and integrated much more clever writing and creative storytelling than this dim-witted, predictable, codependent, marriage counseling deprived, weird abomination This game is NOT like Portal.

So I will be refunding this, I hope Arkose Labs (the company which made solve captcha ten times thing) goes bankruptEDIT: managed to work around horrible origin problems. author: Goose
review: This game is no doubt a great experience. If only I didn't have to jump through the hoops and maze of confusion that is Origin. I was hoping to dive right into the game, but it seems nothing is quite that simple these days. Make an origin account, get your friend to do the same, spend a good 30 minutes online trying to figure out how in God's name to add friends. I was excited to play this game, but after 30 minutes of confusion and verification emails, I am not pleased. Finally was able to invite my friend only to discover that they only have a trial, which is confusing because the ad said friends play free. I could keep trying to figure this out, but I'm honestly so annoyed at this point I just want my money back. Looked to be a really great game, if you have the will and patience to actually start it.

author: hibikir
review: Oof.OK, the game is very pretty, and it's a natural coop, which is rare. But there's a lot for me not to like here. The game is really a wide collection of small games, except none of them are really polished... because that's what you get when you don't dedicate enough time to make the game be good at one thing.But what is just horrible, and I hope few people complain about because they are just too young, is the story and the characters. The elevator pitch is very good, but once we get into the details, it's as if they had left the writing to the programmers. The two main characters are neither likable nor interesting. Another character that shows up all the time is the most annoying thing since Jar Jar Binks, and a horrible stereotype that makes Speedy Gonzalez look progressive and modern. If anything, just based on the characters, it'd make sense for the couple to join together in their hate for this hateful caricature that appears to be some form of psychopath. But no, they are going along with this, and reach the ending for... no actual reason. I guess it's time to end the game, let's make them want to stay together! There are no story beats that change any character, or that make anything work.I am perfectly happy to play games with no story at all. Or even a forgettable story that is in the background. But this game dedicates a lot of time to a terrible story. The game would be better without dialogue. I would have told you that this is the worst story I have played in my decades of gaming.... except 12 minutes also came out in the same year. This is ending of Game Of Thrones level of nonsense: I was half way expecting David Benioff to have writing credits here. Hell, David Cage might do a better job.

author: yeminiariel
review: My biggest complaint is that the game is not meant for gamers. It is too easy and holds your hand the whole way through. If my friend and I had known - we would not have purchased the game. But all the reviews praised it and almost everywhere the game received a high score - So we've bought it and I then felt that I had been set up.In addition, the game requires you to install Origin. In order to play - you need to open both Steam and Origin. Feels very unnecessary and inefficient. In addition, the connection in Origin was almost never smooth and always summed up to a few minutes of waiting. Sometimes we couldn't find each other, and one of us had to exit and re-enter Origin.The levels are very diverse and the music is excellent. There were two or three stages that my friend and I enjoyed, but most of the time the challenges weren't real challenges, and we felt like we were playing a child's game.The lines were very cheesy and unpolished, and the characters felt really stupid and ignorant.to sum up: this game is excellent for children and for couples where at least one of them is not a gamer.Otherwise, I would recommend looking for another game.I am very uncomfortable giving a dislike, since I can recommend this game to some of the people. But I will give a dislike  Just to be in the minority of people who say no to this game and their voices are not really heard.

author: bready_gurl
review: I don't normally write reviews for games, however I found it pertinent to write this as I believe in the integrity of games as well as transparency with the consumer, so here goes.First off, I am not a qualified game reviewer, if there even is such a thing. I have over a hundred games on my steam account and, for full transparency, am writing this on my girlfriend's account since she got the game. I'm not on some high horse, I just have some things about this game I find important to say.A lot of people I've seen leaving negative reviews here bring up the scene with the elephant, so I thought I'd address that first. If you haven't played the game, and don't want spoilers, I'll stay general here, but the gist is that it is an unnecessarily traumatic scene that is glossed over and is one of the worst feeling moments in any game I have ever played. I don't mean that in a good way, either, I mean it in the way that this game to me was brought down by the inclusion of this part of the game.The rest of the story itself is rather harmless, where the game really shines is the gameplay and how fun it is to play with two people. That's the main selling point, right? And it is, to be fair, reasonably fun. However, the largest and most unavoidable problem in this game, and the one that's the other most complained about issue in the reviews section, is EA and the Origin launcher. Our experience with this (me and my grilfriend) was absolutely horrendous. Today, we completely lost the ability to even launch the game, and so we have ended our time with it. I find this a fitting end to our time with the game, as we got about 2/3 through before the hassle of the launcher became no longer worth it.Finally, glitches run rampant in this game. The game breaking ones are rare, but ones that completely shatter your immersion are commonplace. I find this important because of the lack of transparency EA has with this issue, a common issue with most EA games. Overall, bearable. 5/10

That, will wipe your progress because it gets stuck before it can save. I've tried, and failed. Otherwise, a very fun and enjoyable game, but me and many others suffer from these unfixxable bugs.

author: Syann
review: This game is great! MUCH better than "A Way Out" in every way.We had so much fun and even returned to the game after finishing it, something we never even considered for "A Way Out". Lots of replayability. Worth the full price.If their next game is anything similar, it will be an instant buy from us on day 1.A few sections are particularly difficult or boring, but you move on to new sections with very different gameplay style quite rapidly and most of them are a lot of fun so it never got too much of an issue for us. One better player can definitely carry a lower skilled player thanks to the way life respawns and checkpoints work.The story was horrible. Slow, boring, annoying accents... we kept yelling "BBQ" at each other anytime a cutscene would start.(Because controller players need to hold B and keyboard players Q to skip them).The voice actors were good, but some of the accents were hit or miss. For us, we found both Hakim and May to be unbearable to listen to, but this is a very subjective opinion. YMMV.The variety and fun of the gameplay was great.Two things I hope they improve in their next game:1- Let us switch which character is on which side of the screen.2- The "free-roaming" areas where we can just run/skate/swim around large areas and discover all kinds of cool little things were easily the best parts of the game. I hope there can be more of these and possibly even bigger ones.

author: ErefeWinter
review: This is a beautiful example of what a well-funded marketing team can do with a turd. The game itself has a bland story with a harmful message, which is labelled an immersive, artistic masterpiece. The core mechanics seem to be standard Mario 64 / Crash Bandicoot platformer controls. Each themed segment gives a theoretically unique additional mechanic for solving puzzles, but the game treats them more or less identically. All in all, the only reason this game didn't immediately fail is the marketing team's tireless efforts.The game seems to derive its difficulty from interface issues rather than skill challenges. Most of the time, when the player dies its because the camera got shoved somewhere weird, or the game took away a core movement ability. The length is similarly artificial, with each of the "innovative" segments being repeated far too many times.All in all, the game is neither interesting nor fun. The only thing the game achieves is being a huge waste of time and money.

author: knmichi3
review: I hate to mention this but I can't even run the game. I followed some steps on the GUIDE section and some other steps on the internet and nothing works. How's that the game doesn't even Run in Steam but by Origin. I'm truly disappointed.

It's a good casual co-op game: great visuals, fun mini-games, forgiving gameplay, and an engaging (albeit silly) story make it a pretty excellent game for couples.I'd even call it "jolly", but at some point the writing makes a casual detour into psychological horror for an entire level, including an extended torture and murder sequence, which damn well caught me off guard. ()Characters take a quick dip into being completely irredeemable monsters, but come back like it's no big deal. Can't entirely recommend it to families with kids for those reasons, but overall it's an enjoyable experience.

author: astroboylrx
review: When I try to launch this game, origin app launches, and then it minimizes itself to system tray but nothing else happens. Then both steam and origin think I'm playing the game (stream shows it is running and the "play" button becomes "stop", ; meanwhile, the "play" button in origin app grays out). However, there is not even a game-relevant process in task manager. I don't see any extra window or error message. After one or two minutes, origin app exits and the "stop" button in steam becomes "play" again -- maybe they find out no game is running. I've tried various ideas online to fix this issue, none of them works. I also tried to reinstall this game three times, and reinstall origin multiple times. Nothing. Every time I tried to launch it, I accumulate one or two minutes of "play time" in steam -- what a joke. I don't know why a third-party app is necessary for players to play this game on steam. Totally frustrated. Wasted five hours in a could-have-been-fun Saturday night.

author: Flo0op3R
review: The game was fun initially but turned repetitive and boring pretty quickly, none the less me and my friend still played it from start to finish. The game had nice visuals but lacked the proper story writing to have it's players stay emerged/engaged. They should have made it 6 hours maximum as it started to feel like the game was forcing you to sit there and listen to an annoying/obnoxious book dictating things.They also shouldn't have made it dependent on only one account to actually have the game in order for two people to play... They should have just split the price down the middle and have people actually buy their separate licenses. As things are now there is no way for one of the two friends to ever replay the game without having to buy the game again. In my case we split the cost but it still feels unfair as my account is the only one with actual access to the game.5/10 (Only thing landing it above a 4 are the visuals. Would have  been higher with a better more condensed story and shorter campaign).

author: Windows XP
review: My friends and my game were almost never in sync, causing many of the challenges to just be guessing games (luckily many of the challenges weren't challenging in the slightest, and some didn't require any form of co-op). The game would constantly give you the exact answer to a puzzle, removing any trace of fun from them. Audio would constantly go out of sync during cut scenes.  The story was decent but felt poorly written, and the only character we weren't actively rooting against was Rose . The controls sucked. This could have been because I was on mouse and keyboard, but that isn't a good excuse. They were very floaty and at times forced you into positions where the game wanted you or would not control in a natural way (up is down, left is right) (Also, for no reason at all the sensitivity would change and we would have no idea why). The entire game seemed to lose steam as it went on, with end of the game being a load of "references" and what felt like rushed game play.The main redeeming factor was the design of some of the levels, making them fun to explore, but once we exhausted these areas there wasn't much more going for it.Chess was 10/10, I kicked my friends buttOverall 5.5/10, it does A LOT of things somewhat ok, but nothing very well.
